Reviews.Title: “Scary elevator ride”
Reviews.Author: anitaowl
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I were here to celebrate my birthday with NYC nieces and Boston kids. My mom has major mobility issues, and the room worked for her with her rented wheelchair. The rooms were comfortable - but we arrived in the midst of a 100 degree heat wave! Only one elevator worked at a time (out of three) and there we long waits. Then, on my birthday, I was stuck alone in the elevator. For a claustrophobic person, it was the fear of a lifetime! After 15 minutes or so talking to the staff on the elevator phone, they got it going, thank God. Stella at the desk (desk folk were lovely) promised me Starwood points enough for a night's stay as compensate. When i checked months later to use them, they didn't exist. I've called repeatedly. She hasn't been there once. Frustrating - and a ghastly experience, to boot. We went to the restaurant several times, due to my mom's problems moving around - dinner and brunch. It was decent, but overpriced and not overwhelming. The brunch was better than the dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous NYC hotel we return to every year!”
Reviews.Author: ZenSwan77
Reviews.Content: Just completed our 2012 booking for the W Union Sq. and realized we had neglected to review our wonderful May 2011 stay. We have been traveling to NYC for our anniversary for a number of years and now consider the W Union Sq. our preferred hotel in the city. The hotel is in a wonderful location for shopping and dining...both uptown/downtown. We find the entire staff (doormen/front desk/housekeepers) go out of their way to ensure that we happy and enjoying our stay. On our last visit there was a small issue with our room and Mr.Tellez personally took us up to the new room (the new room was spectacular btw) just to be sure we were completely happy. The staff has also kindly remembered our anniversary each year by sending up a card, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Bottom line, we are not high profile/VIP guests but we are always treated as such...you will not be disappointed if you stay here. Looking forward to the newly updated rooms and public spaces for our May 2012 stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice location.”
Reviews.Author: scuba_ski99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. Platinum member at Starwood for years and have stayed at the other 2 W's in Manhattan and this exceeded my expectations. First room I was given was suite on the 4th floor which was nice but way to noisy based on its proximity to the street. We were then moved to the 18th floor where the room were refurbished and this made a world of difference -- not a suite but a really large Fabulous room (room 1810). Elizabeth B. (front desk manager) made our stay. She was extremely pleasant and helpful and sent up a bottle of sparking wine -- free of charge for our room swaps. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “W union square”
Reviews.Author: OrmondBeachFL
Reviews.Content: Upfsted rooms are a bit overdone but clean and spacious for NYC. Restaurant currently closed and restaurants close by are limited. A bit pricey but good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: mhoehn5
Reviews.Content: The location at Union Square is perfect for whatever activities you're interested in. Close to great shopping, restaurants, and theatre. Just a short taxi or subway ride to lots of New York attractions. Many rooms have been completely renovated and have a new, modern luxurious feel. My room overlooked Union Square on the Park Ave side with a spectacular view by day and night. The staff was very friendly and professional. The restaurant, Olive's, is great with a small but exceptional menu and a bar/lounge area for enjoying drinks and conversation in an intimate setting with small groups.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Singerred
Reviews.Content: My family stayed as part of a group who were in NYC for an event. Our upgraded room was pleasant, but a bit worn, and the hallway carpet was in rough shape. Our first day in the hotel, they left us a note to say that the hotel was undergoing a remodel. I think we should have been told that prior to our visit. Meanwhile, the signature restaurant, Olives, was closed. We were not told that fact when we made our reservations. There is a small bar area in the lobby for light food. For breakfast, it took 45 minutes to get our food. I had a banana. To pay the full rack rate when the signature restaurant is closed, and we have the old furnishings prior to the remodel, is ridiculous. With that said, the staff was great and made up for a lot of the flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W Union Square this past weekend with our young daughter. While we have stayed in many other NY hotels, this was our first time at this one. We had a nice time and found the staff very pleasant. The hotel is located almost adjacent to Union Square, which was a great location for us. The room was nice but small, even by NY standards. In fact, because we needed a roll-away bed for my daughter, we were "upgraded" to a room capable of fitting such a bed. Well, in a literal sense it fit, but with the bed down, there was no room whatsoever to walk. But that was OK as we only put the bed down when we came in at night. The one thing I found truely objectionable, however, was the price for valet parking. With tax it came to just over $70 per day, which is more than I have ever been charged in any city to which I have traveled. This includes many 4 and 5 star hotels. This really comes across as gouging.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to give a raving review.....”
Reviews.Author: mzimm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is amazing, I had a great suite, staff was amazing, but I had a 4PM check out and the house keeping barged in on me even after I told them I was in the bathroom, and they began questioning me about my check out time while I was in the bathroom! CRAZY! I will definitely be back, but they need to work on getting the check out times right and make sure that they deliver on what they promise during the check in period. This stay did NOT end on a good note!

Reviews.Title: “Great week long business stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival my room wasn't ready so I dropped off my bags and headed to my company's office just steps away. Upon returning I found my room to be upgraded, a nice welcome for such a long (7 night) stay. The hotel staff was very welcoming and cordial, bellstaff went out of their way to greet me upon each return throughout the week. The room was very clean, comfortable, and the workspace was good too. There were lots of sirens each nice, but that's New York, and too be expected I think in a downtown setting. There is a CVS right next door to get last minute snacks or toiletries, and some good restaurants nearby. Concierge was helpful as I needed to find a tailor to fix my suit. Her recommendation was spot on and the price was reasonable. Overall very pleased, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in all ways!”
Reviews.Author: JudyArlingtonMA
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay twice in the last 2 months. My most recent stay was on March 4th, in a newly renovated room. It was terrific! I like the textures, colors, and design that make if more dramatic. The location is superb. I have lived in NY in the past and often stay in the Financial District, Upper West Side or Midtown East when I visit from Boston but like your hotel VERY much. Every staff person went above and beyond to accommodate. I am telling everyone I know about my new found “home” in the City.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: HS106
Reviews.Content: I am a New Yorker who now lives in Boston. I travel everywhere now. I love this hotel. The rooms, the service, the location, the people, the front desk people, the restaurant. The best!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: miamor1989
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, each for one night stays. Front desk staff is always wonderful and friendly and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Union Square is a great area, and a quieter, cleaner part of New York. I have also stayed at a few other Starwood properties in New York city, including the Sheraton Times Square, W Times Square & Westin Times Square and the W Union Square is by far my favorite out of all of them. I love the area and the building is beautiful and amazing. I plan to return to this hotel when I visit New York again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Accessibility and Peace!”
Reviews.Author: Preethi_Kamath
Reviews.Content: I love Union Square, as a former NY student it was one of my favorite haunts and its a great location for those who want to stay between mid town and downtown Manhattan. This area has one of the best subway networks as well, so its perfect to get around. When a W opened here, i decided it was the perfect hotel and location for my next stay in New York and turns out i was absolutely right. Room was lovely, it was huge by New York standards and the hotel is cosy and has character. Service is as good as it gets at a W. Iv stayed at two other W's in New York, the Times Square one being my favorite in terms of ambience and design. However, I prefer the location at this one as the times square one is a little more touristy. However, If your a first timer in NY and want a room with the quintessential NY view, than this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, A Little Dark and Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: Angie652
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel Union Square was a great stay. Good location, have to walk or take cab downtown. The lobby is very dark, loud music playing and a little claustrophobic. The rooms are dark as well, but good size for NYC hotel. The beds in this hotel are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in on vacation. I got sick during the night, and the front desk staff went to CVS to get me medicine at 3:00 a.m. which was extremely nice. The next day, the staff continued to bring me water and chicken soup and buckets of ice. They even sent a "get well" card, which was unexpected. You could tell they actually cared. The staff was exceptional. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great location but...”
Reviews.Author: foxiileigh
Reviews.Content: When we first stayed in New York, we stayed in a hostel on the upper west side so this was a massive step up. The location was great and we spent a lot of time wandering up and down the easy to navigate streets. Half a block down is a Big Daddy's diner which was great for breakfast (though a little expensive). The Lobby was very impressive, if a little gloomy inside but it was the room that was the most disappointing. I was expecting a little grandeur for the price and the location but it was nothing special. I know it's New York and the rooms aren't going to be huge but it was really tight and the bathroom was on the small side too. The decor was average too, nothing I wouldn't expect from a Holiday Inn or other chain hotels. I don't think we'd be staying here again, we'd probably look for better value for money. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great. I was hoping for more.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Oplacesyoullgo
Reviews.Content: Previous stays in other hotels have always been noisy given the city but this room was silent! Spent most of my time in lower manhattan (soho and chelsea predominantly) and walked everywhere. The room was very clean, it was well priced (expedia) and the staff was very accommodating and lovely about a room change request. Anyone not liking scents would find the common areas off-putting but my room didn't have the strong odour. The king size bed room had a great bathroom but the 2 double beds room had a tiny bathroom and sliding door that didn't really close.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kokolig
Reviews.Content: Cramped bathrooms but it's NYC. Great location. Lobby is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine stay at the W except for ...”
Reviews.Author: impicky
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the W. Our room was sophisticated looking and quiet, considering how close the building is to Union Square. The weekend rate was reasonable for the area. The room was extremely clean however, the perfumed scent in our guestroom was stomach-turningly strong. When I discussed it with the front desk, the person immediately said "It's the signature W scent. Some maids overdo it." Apparently, it's a concentrated solution that should only be squirted once or twice but workers don't understand that and blast spray "the W Scent" like it's a cheap can of Glade. Clearly, this is a common problem since everyone on duty at the desk understood our complaint (And we aren't people who are scent-sensitive or allergic. This stuff was overpowering, in our room and the hallway). The manager tried to help, putting an ozone machine in the room for a couple of hours when we were gone (along with opening a window as far as it would go) but the odor remained. Next morning, we were moved -- and upgraded (thank you) -- to a room that had no trace of the "W Signature Scent." Please, W Management: hotel guests only want the scent you get from a freshly scrubbed and clean room .. not corporate's idea of what "chi-chi" smells like.

Reviews.Title: “Barely average....”
Reviews.Author: DJJondy
Reviews.Content: I think The W chain of hotels has become lazy. I recently stayed at The W at Union Square and was somewhat disappointed for the price (almost $400/nt). I'm in NYC often and have stayed at numerous hotels including The Setai (amazing) and The Hudson (also very average) when not staying with friends. First, a hotel that still charges for internet access should be ashamed of themselves. Seeing as this was a quick trip, it was for work, and it was close to our shoot I didn't have much of a choice. Not staying at this particular W before, I figured it would be more than adequate. The radio in the room used to listed to an ipod was broken, the knobs were falling off. The service was pretty good, but being in NYC, many of the staff were pretty rude which I've come to expect from NYC (The Setai being an exception, they have wonderful staff). Anyway, I will make it a point to not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stop march 2009”
Reviews.Author: Clonket
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night of our wedding. Very comfortable bed, and romantic decor. We still stop at lounge for drinks every once in a while. Nice size bathroom and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaCanuck
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in the W Union Square, for my semi-annual trip to help my NYU child move into residence. This hotel has become our home away from home, not only because of its proximity to the NYU and wonderful SOHO area of New York. We had arranged for a "mega" room because of all the luggage we had, and the room was great. We lucked into a corner room so we had two different views. The doormen were wonderful helping us with our luggage. The breakfast in Olives, the hotel restaurant was superb! The egg white omelet they make is amazing. The dinner was also great; I didn't feel like anything fancy and the chef was good enough to just give me pasta with tomato sauce, with no fuss at all! The staff were all wonderful, and very pleasant, even wishing my daughter good luck on her next semester. While we were here, an elevator broke down, but the staff were nice enough to let us use the staff elevator, for the one time we had to go up to the room before the elevator was fixed. The gym is small, but well equipped, even with a boxing area for those so inclined. The rooms are a bit dark, but we don't notice it really because we don't stay in the hotel , because we came to be at the university, or explore this great city. Thanks, W Union Square, for another pleasant visit. See you in the spring!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: lx8
Reviews.Content: From the perspective of someone that used to live in NY, the location is fabulous. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was lovely. The bed was super comfortable. To be picky, they could use new carpeting and new bathtubs to take it up a knotch. But I was very happy with the room overall. My only real complaint is about the room keys. Almost every time we left the room, they stopped working and we had to ask for new ones (they were not next to our phones or anything magnetic). This seems to be a known problem that the corporate company should probably prioritize on its repairs list!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Alyson S
Reviews.Content: We live in the City... so why an overnight? With 2 young children under the age of 3 and trying to celebrate our anniversary, we decided to stay at the W Union Square for an in-the-city getaway. Great great time! From the start, Nelson Baez at the front desk provided a wonderful warm welcome and super upgrade. He was a gentleman and the treat was much appreciated. We hit the bar downstairs (could be more seating and faster service), ordered room service and never left the hotel. The staff was excellent and we would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “A dreadful stay at the W Union Square”
Reviews.Author: signothetimes53
Reviews.Content: I did not have a good first-time experience here. What went wrong? 1. No apparent upgrade for my SPG Platinum status, though I was informed on checkin that as a Plat, my "internet was free" and I'd receive "500 Plat Amenity points"...that's the minimum requirement, it's not as if I was being done some sort of favor 2. Doorman busy texting instead of doing his job. 3. Room assignment next to the elevator (#809), thus I was treated to loud guests outside my door until well into the wee hours 4. 8-inch long rust stain in the bathtub, disgusting that housekeeping is apparently so oblivious to maintaining a high standard that it was allowed to be there for a long period of time. I wonder how many weeks or months that stain has been there? How many other guests complained, and nothing was done about it? 5. Breakfast the next morning in Olives, and the waiter served jams with the bread basket...and one of the jams was opened, half-used by a previous guest, and obviously no one in the restaurant bothered to check when they cleared the table from the day before. 6. The hotel overall is in an old building, and the overall appearance is drab, and fairly shouting that a renovation is in order. 7. And I know low lighting is the "style" of W hotels, but at least make the bulbs work on the elevator room numbers. The elevators don't have the same matching numbers array, (i.e., the 1st floor number isn't in the exact same place on the panel in each elevator), and so it forced me each time to have to crouch down to see "1" clearly enough to push the button. 8. An indifferent staff attitude from top to bottom towards me as a customer. This may be "New York" style attitudes, but it doesn't excuse a lack of customer service. Oddly, the only other hotel I've ever experienced within SPG that exhibits this kind of staff indifference to the customer is the Westin Paris. I was told that it was just the "Parisian Way". Whether it's the New York Way, or the Parisian Way, bad customer service doesn't get a free pass from me. I also experienced a great deal of difficulty sending my complaints after the stay to the hotel general manager. The Starwood email giving me his address and asking for my feedback was no use, email sent to the address they gave me bounced back as "undeliverable". Eventually, customer service people contacted me, and while they said all the right words, the only way I'll ever know if their words are sincere and meaningful, and if this hotel is any better than my dreadful experience, is if I return to it again. I'm not sure I have enough courage to want to experience this nonsense again.

Reviews.Title: “19 nights - all perfect”
Reviews.Author: KPAAUS
Reviews.Content: The staff make this hotel - from the moment we arrived the service we received was outstanding - from Eddie who fixed something in our bathroom within 5 minutes of us making the request to Eddie Ruiz and Vincent Sendra going out of their way to solve problems and just be nice! There was not one staff member who wasn't friendly and obliging. We had 2 stays - the first for 10 nights and the second for 9 nights with a four day side trip out of town in between. On our return we were spoilt with a surprise delivery of cakes to our room - which were stunning, and an invitation for a complimentary breakfast - totally unexpected but a fabulous gesture. Both times we had excellent rooms which were quite large compared to other places I have stayed in New York, with 2 double beds, a bath and a great view over Union Square - rooms 1502 & 1602. My only criticism is that the lighting is insufficient. It would be great if any future refurbishment includes reading lamps over the beds. We experienced room service, breakfast at "Olives" and drinks in the bar area. The room service meals came within the specified time and were very good. Breakfast was excellent and good value with large servings. The drinks in the bar area off the foyer were fine but expect it to be noisy as it seems to be a popular meeting place for locals. The position of the W at Union Square was excellent - there is a huge Barnes and Noble book store nearby as well as Starbucks, Macdonalds, Wholefoods, vegetarian take-away and fabulous restuarants and cafes such as Grammercy Tavern, Rohm (Thai), Union Square Cafe and La Pizza Fresca Ristorante in East 20th Street for wood fired pizzas. The subway is very close and taxis were always available out front. There is a Greenmarket held in the Square a few times a week where organic breads, fruit, cheese and farmer-direct produce can be purchased. Throughout our entire stay the Union Square Christmas Market was held daily with a fabulous selection of interesting stores and gourmet food. Two doors away from the hotel there is a 24 hour "Pharmacy" that stocks most food and personal items you would need. The room had a mini-bar but no tea and coffee facilities but each morning coffee was offered free in the foyer. My two adolescent girls loved the hotel and its position - close to East Village and Soho. When I travel to New York again I will definitely stay at this hotel. Thank you to the staff and management for making our trip to New York so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The best service we've ever received at any hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMSC-92
Reviews.Content: The W New York is a small gem in the heart of Union Square with the best service I've experienced at any New York hotel, or any Starwood hotel for that matter. The valet staff, front desk, concierge, and service staff are all shining stars that are true ambassadors of the Starwood organization. A special shout out to Chris, Maria, and Doug (bartender) for going "above and beyond" during our most recent visit. Your warm hospitality and graciousness raised the bar for even such well-traveled folks such as ourselves. My kids are still talking about what you all did for them. A million thanks for creating a memorable weekend we will never forget. Now, about the hotel --a perfect mix of old and new -- and the old marble flooring and steps, ornate elevator trim, and antique office trinkets blend perfectly with the espresso furniture and purple satin linens. Rooms are spacious, well-appointed, and stocked with many amenities. Olives is delish, as are all Todd English restaurants. His signature chicken dish is my kid's absolute favorite meal. The only negative about the hotel is that it is so hip and trendy with twentysomethings that it's difficult to get near the bar or a seat in the "living room" on the weekends. This minor glitch, however, will not keep us away from our new favorite hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't choose again”
Reviews.Author: M30001
Reviews.Content: Rooms are decent size and clean. Like the location - union sq is a neat place - although not as convenient to other spots in the city depending on where you are going. Was woken up both nights I was there by loud customers in the room next door (walls must be thin) and I am a good sleeper with ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - bad service”
Reviews.Author: astirnimann
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, just opposite Union Square. Well worth your while to upgrade if possible to a room overlooking the square. Rooms are spare but comfortable and clean. Fine restaurants, bars, theatres nearby. Easy access to entire city on foot and subway. Good restaurant on site. Three question mark - noise: lots of action on Park Avenue. very noisy bar. Room-cleaner at 09:00 am! No free wireless in rooms!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: ASMULREADY
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from the W Union square to be honest, yet I must admit it really was fantastic overall. I normally stay at Trump soho, the London NYC or the crosby street hotel - all genuine 5 star hotels, yet given i was in NYC over Xmas, the prices around town were very high. I did get a good rate for their "mega room" which was on the 18th floor. Yes, the hotel is a tad tired, and the gym is very small and showing it's age, however aside from that, the hotel gets top marks and I will stay there again. Firstly, if you can, spend the extra money for a mega room as they are very large and comfortable. The hotel is right near the subway and within walking distance of many good restaurants. The staff made this stay for me. They suggested I join the starwood program on arrival which meant my wireless was free for the week, and a late check out request was given without any drama. The staff make this place. I have stayed at the W times sq and the comparison isn't even close. The staff at other W's tend to treat you like you are at a nightclub, yet here they were brilliant. A really nice surprise

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: mmvmm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully well situated, just opposite Union Square. Well worth your while to upgrade to a room overlooking the square. Rooms are spare but very comfortable. Excellent restaurants, bars, theatres nearby. Easy access to entire city on foot and subway. Good restaurant on site. Only question mark - noise: lots of action on Park Avenue. And this is New York, so it doesn't let up in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the w hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dpm3848
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing. I highly recommend staying at this hotel in new York city. The hotel rooms are spacious, clean and elegant. The hotel staff went above and beyond in their services. Eddie at the front desk was extremely helpful and overtly polite. He made us feel extremely welcome and answered all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mrskenny
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas weekend at the hotel and really enjoyed it. Location is perfect - far enough away from the tourist madness to be relaxing, but only a quick subway ride if you want to be a part of it all. Pros: location, well-appointed comfortable rooms, Todd English restaurant onsite, the Living Room, Bliss bath products, historical details that they kept in this 100 yr old bldg. Cons: parking costs $71/day ! Come on. I know its NYC, but we used the ICON parking website and found a garage just a pleasant 15 minutes stroll away and paid $25/day. Not quite as convenient as just walking out the front door, but for that kind of savings, I was happy to take a walk. Beds: initially, they were very comfortable, but we found them too soft for us. Just personal preference. Loved the pillows. Bath: loved the lighted makeup mirror and Bliss products. No tub, but we're fine with that. Would like to have a show head that is adjustable to different types of spray and flow. Noise: we were on the 11th floor, facing east. Yes, there was some traffic noise, but it is to be expected. We're looking forward to our next stay, in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Katrinaaa111
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night at the W in Union Square. I checked in at 10am and my room was ready which was a good start to the stay. The hotel was really great - front desk staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were beautiful and spacious (much bigger rooms than the W on Lexington). The location is definitely one of the best in NYC. Would definitely stay here again on my next trip to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Shocked to see how worn down and out of date this property has become.”
Reviews.Author: HMamiye
Reviews.Content: Had reservations to stay 3 nights at this property with my wife - she insisted we leave after one evening there. Everything seemed worn out and dirty. They haven't maintained or updated this hotel in a long time. Our room was large but only had a bed , a small desk and a mirror in it. Therr was a lot of empty space - Felt like they didn't want to spend the money on an armchair or other furnishings. Room felt like a $80 per night hotel - but it was quite expensive. Location is very good and the staff seemed very nice - but can't make up for its shortcomings. We couldn't wait to get out of there. We won't go back until we hear the hotel has been fully renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, but needs more lights”
Reviews.Author: SFFranny
Reviews.Content: Our family spent two nights at the W, and mostly were quite charmed by the hotel and its staff. Every single staff person we encountered, from the doormen helping us out of our cab and into the hotel, to the front desk, the concierge, and the engineering staff (more on that later), were simply great: helpful, friendly, warm, informative. We loved the location and the general vibe of the hotel, as did our 11-year-old daughter. The room was spacious and comfortable,  with a stellar view over Union Square. Our only issue is that the decorative theme of this hotel seems to be "dim." The halls are dimly lit and our room was so dark that we had to ask for more lights. The good news is the staff responded promptly and efficiently, and brought us both a standing light and a desk light.  We'd  love to come back to this lovely, attentive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pony101
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service, small but comfortable rooms. Could do with a Tea/Coffee maker and safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and well located”
Reviews.Author: skd1305
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel primarily because of its location - cant beat the location with union square at your doorstep, especially at the time with the farmers markets and Christmas markets and being such a short walk from gramercy park and multiple subway lines. We got an enormous room (probably the largest room I’ve ever stayed in in NYC, bigger than our apartment when we lived there) with a view of union square (probably because my husband is SPG platinum). The service was excellent. We needed to store luggage a few times and they were always very accomodating. Needless to say we would stay here again on future visits to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Deborah-AnnB
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 12/17/2011 - the middle of the busiest season in NYC. Our accommodations were great. Bed was perfect and pillows so soft. Room was quiet and spacious (for NYC that means a lot!) No coffee or tea available in the room, but you could have any snack, water, wine or booze for a $$$$$$ price! Hotel has a nice lounge to meet up with folks and a nice bar in the lower level. Our room was clean, but the bathroom (only the bathroom) smelled of stale cigarettes...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy1702
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for my anniversary. I asked the front desk to arrange a flower delivery. They went above and beyond! Service overall was fantastic, and they made our weekend very special.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier with our stay”
Reviews.Author: acquablue11
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic week at the W Union Square. It was pricey but well worth the money. Very convenient location to downtown Manhattan. Hotel is very modern and hip. Very comfortable mattress. We wish we could order the mattress but it is only available in the US so we had to settle for buying just the sheets from the W store.

Reviews.Title: “Location clinches it.”
Reviews.Author: ysar
Reviews.Content: Expensive like all Manhatten hotels. On entering the small, casual looking lobby with noisy bar next door (after a tiring taxi ride from JFK) was off-putting. The rooms however are of a decent size, extremely clean....the bed was comfortable with decent pillows and silky sheets. There was no view to speak of from our particular room...luck of the draw on this one. I went against the advice of many in choosing the location...but was not let down by my decision. Union Square is central in many ways. The market and surrounding shops are a bonus. Chelsea, SoHo, TriBeCa are short walks away... Times Square and 5th ave shops etc are likewise walking distance....the subway station on the square is useful if you don't want the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: Arlo3k
Reviews.Content: Yes, "hip", whatever that means, and that is part of the problem. Overpriced for what you get, and set up to cater to the younger "hard chargers." Doormen are great, and very helpful. I stayed there quite a bit, probably around 15 times as I come from NY originally and wanted to stay away from midtown. Rooms small, clean, and serviceable.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very "hip" lobby bar made it all worth it”
Reviews.Author: Ryan S
Reviews.Content: The rooms are decent; what you would typically expect for a hotel room in the area. The doormen were very accommodating as well as treating me with more respect than I am used to being a young professional on business in NYC. Would definitely stay here again if I have business to attend in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: baconandbeer
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights over Thanksgiving at the W, everything about our stay was top notch. From the moment we checked in Percilla at the front desk set the tone for the rest of our stay-excellent service!! Our room was very clean and spacious. The location is great just steps away from the subway entrance, with great food choices in the area. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: As a very frequent guest at the W Union Square, and a frequent traveler for business all over the world, I feel very qualified to write this amazing review about the most perfect experience a person should have when staying away from home. You will never find a better and more professional staff anywhere. And the best thing....they remember you and make you feel so welcomed, every time. It just doesn't get better than this, and...they love my french bulldog Mitchell. Best beds, best pillows, which you can buy, and great food, love it love it love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel - not cheap”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJane10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W on Union Square a number of times with my wife and also on business, so the fact I'm a repeat customer shows that it must have been doing something right for me! It's in a great location and the rooms are always spacious with good bathrooms and great Bliss products. Has a great bar downstairs as well, and lots of restaurants in close proximity . The main drawback is that it isn't cheap, but it certainly won't let you down if you do stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool and very swish”
Reviews.Author: LawrieD
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. The rooms were nice and the beds were so comfortable with wonderful silky smooth bed sheets. Downstairs it has a cool bar to enjoy really good cocktails and delicious snacks including cheesy fries which were to die for. A very good location with some excellent breakfast places to choose 2 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: comfysleeper
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in The W mid-town before but decided to try this one. We weren't disappointed, it is in a great location, half way between the shops on 5th Ave and Soho, so a taxi ride to both is just 15mins. Our room was surprisingly big for NY standards and had a lovely view overlooking the Park. As with all W hotels it was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful, without having to ask on check-in I was offered a late check-out on the Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Was it a W experience ? No”
Reviews.Author: maubery
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nothing impressive, the doormen are useless (I had read comments about that, I'm even wondering if they don't do that on purpose ...) One of the bar is closed due to work (I asked about it, it's been more than a year, and it is not precise on their beautiful website). The maid woke me up at 10h30, with my hangover I was pretty upset. I went for just for one saturday night (it might not be enough to fully enjoy the hotel, as suggested by the receptionist). The bar was small but full (W reputation ?). I ordered some food overnight, it was good. The room are spacious, even tough the mirror was not even fixed on the wall. And yeah the bliss product are nice. The staff is so so (except the last receptionist when I checked out). Ok, but far from being "cool" and obviously overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has deteriorated”
Reviews.Author: heartguy83
Reviews.Content: In the past I have always stayed here and it has been very good. Now it has changed. The bathroom had no soap. I had to request it be brought. The room cards repeatedly do not work and it requires you go back to the front desk to get a new card. This happened everytime I left the room. The wireless connection is spotty and slow and costs extra. The helpfulness and friendliness of the staff has deteriorated. The location is great. I will not pay the prices they charge to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: heezem
Reviews.Content: What a great stay! We stayed just 1 night, Aug 20th. Beautiful hotel, very comfortable with large bedroom and bathroom and wonderful location! Very clean. We have never stayed in the Union Square area before, and we loved it! The staff was great also! They recommeded a restaurant for dinner (Abe & Arthur's, also wonderful!) Just a terrific place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The W experience a little annoying but great location and adequate room”
Reviews.Author: Cindy R
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm just getting older and more less hip but the pulsating music at the W hotels, the dim lighting in the elevators and hallways, the crazy bar scene in the lobby all seem kind of pretentious and irritating. I still love the Bliss bath products -- they are my favorite products in any hotel I've ever stayed at -- but the purple satin coverlets on the two queen sized beds in my room weren't that appealing. The room was very spacious but dim, dim, dim. And I had only a mediocre (then again I only paid for a standard room). The people at the front desk are cheerful and helpful, and the location on Union Square is perfect. The W interior seems more dated than trendy these days although I still like the pots of fresh grass they have in the W lobbies (when I left at 5:30 a.m., there was a guy actually mowing it!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice size rooms, but DATED!”
Reviews.Author: SFKevin
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't what it used to be. Granted the location is perfect, but room details need improvement. Beds used to have feartherbeds under the sheets, but that service is gone. The bed and pillows were not comfortable, but the housekeeping service was excellent. The chair in the room was dated, worn out, and needed re-upholstering. I would stay here again if I received a very good rate, but it's not worth the everyday price this hotel charges. Yes, the Bliss products in the bathroom are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: CdnTravelB
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was amazing, the hotel bar and bar staff were amazing!! Loved it there. The rooms were quite spacious for New York standards, however the rooms looked tired and didn't feel 100% clean. If i got a good deal I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for business. I love this location because it is close to everything but you don' t have hordes of tourists everywhere. I had the basic room type on the 10th floor (rm 1006) but it was pretty spacious, quiet, and had a nice little view of union square. The bed is very comfortable and I still get excited about the Bliss bath products. Plenty of nice towels and a robe. Good desk for doing work although worth mentioning that the room is dark, both in its design aesthetic (dark woods, dark carpet) and in the natural light it received. Internet access at 15/day! Yuck. All of my interactions with the staff were good, from check-in to the concierge desk. Doorman at the front were extremely helpful- David in particular was extra friendly! Appreciated the complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience at the W Union Square”
Reviews.Author: JimW600
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for the things that matter - decent sized rooms (for New York), and fantastic service, particularly from the concierge desk, who seem to know everything about everything and bend over backwards to help. True, the doormen are a bit hit-and-miss with the front door, but the only time we ever needed their help - with bags and wanting a cab - they were right there. My only complaint is the $2 charge for calling a toll-free number from the room - if you're going to charge for this, it should be spelled out in big red letters on the phone. At the prices the W is charging, I don't expect to have to pay for a toll-free call.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GrahamV54
Reviews.Content: Hear all about W hotels and was looking forward to my stay, the staff were great and very friendly and helpful, the bar is good the restaurant food is good, but the rooms need some attention. Good size but very boringly fitted out. Needs a revamp SOON. Would not rush back

Reviews.Title: “For the money stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: 436Sherrie
Reviews.Content: Came to New York on a girls trip and knew the W name is synomous with luxury but I've had better service at a Best Western. At a 5 star hotel you would expect door men who actually open the door. In 5 days of staying here only a few times did anyone bother to open a door for a customer including myself. I was shocked to see conciere door men stand there and text while your struggling to get the doors open. The men who work the front area are far from cordial and mainly just flat out rude. Then when you are in the lobby no one behind the front desk even acknowledges you to say hello or smile or anything. Now the housekeeper on our floor was exceptionally friendly and so very nice but that was far from the rest of the hotel staff including the wait staff in Olivers. The view is also pathetic. There really isnt a view so for the money I would say stay elsewhere!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven above Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Chris&Karen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and from arrival to departure we couldn't have asked for more. The hotel is located in a beautiful building and has a very welcoming and relaxing vibe with nothing too much trouble for any of the friendly & courteous staff. The hotel decor is contemporary and the lounge areas have a warm ambience and are perfect to sit back and watch the world go by. We have stayed in many areas of New York and would regard this hotel and location as the best hands down and wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting New York. I had mentioned it was our anniversary and some cute cupcakes accompanied by a card were left in our room and I must say a huge thank-you to Gerald Telliz the W Hotels Guest Services Coach who really made our stay a special one.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Experience”
Reviews.Author: LinVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July, attending a wedding reception held at the hotel. Our stay was exceptional from check-in to check-out. The valets held our car while we checked in and while we retrieved luggage from our rooms upon leaving even though we parked the car elsewhere. Bedding waso instantly changed to cope with my allergies. Staff was consistently pleasant and competent - I'm always on the lookout in this regard having worked previously in sales for a top-rated hotel myself. The wedding reception was perfect as well - ready early, ever evident, all details tended to. Very nice touches like candles along the hallway everywhere. The food was to rave about - and we all did. In short, everything was perfect. Sterling service and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it”
Reviews.Author: casamoir
Reviews.Content: I had 5 nights at the W and couldn't wait to leave on the first day. Terrible service at the front desk... I'm Starwood gold member. Called in that morning to request a quiet room as I know that NY hotels can be noisy. Told when I'm checked in that I was upgraded to a great quiet room on a high floor. In reality was a low room facing the street. Went down, put me in another room in a similar predicament. the third room was a handicapped room on a higher floor where someone had been smoking so it was horrible. I gave up and stayed there but asked to move the next day. The 4th room was barely OK. Beds in both rooms were soft and uncomfortable. I can't remember complaining about a bed. Usually don't have a problem sleeping as I travel a tonne, but didn't have a good nights rest there. The rooms are outdated. There's no turn down service. The safe broke down one day and the door keys stopped working periodically. The elevators are extremely slow and you can wait forever to get something delivered to your room or to go down. When you walk in and out of the hotel, noone looks up and greats you. In fact, the front desk staff just seem so busy and annoyed when you ask for assistance. The shining light in the hotel is the bar area. Great staff. Helpful and inviting. Nice to sit in in the evening and relax or in the morning to read the paper.

Reviews.Title: “Generally OK but some inconsistencies”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_tourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Union Square twice in the past 3 weeks (took a break to Boston in between). First stay was on the 3rd floor and second on the 7th. I didn't get a bathrobe, ipod dock or extra pillow during the first stay but they appeared on the second stay, which I thought was weird, because the price categories for both rooms (Spectacular King) were the same. The bathroom of the second room was significantly larger as well (granted there was no tub this time) and although there was a bathrobe in there, high time to replace that grey frayed robe with a new one! Not something one would expect of the W. I agree with other reviews that it is somewhat dated but the concierge was helpful and the checkout efficient. I liked that they offered options on extending the checkout to 4pm because I had a late flight. Location is very convenient, with dining options around the area, the subway a stone's throw from the hotel and the green market is always fun to walk through. The Underbar was closed for renovations which was a disappointment but I'll live. Overall it was fine, but not sure if I would stay again or check out other hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth Floor”
Reviews.Author: tonnacchiello
Reviews.Content: I love the W Hotels, very expensive, never less than $500 a night but really wonderful. I went to the location on Union Square in New York City and at first i was not too happy that i had a room on a low floor. I know New York City very well, when you go there you want a room on the highest floor possible otherwise you cant sleep. But this location has a small balcony facing Union Square on the fifth floor, i opened the huge window and had a great party with my friends. Sometime lower is better.

Reviews.Title: “I have never written a review before, but the W is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa Marie S
Reviews.Content: Really amazing team of people, it put my honeymoon to shame, we went to a Sandals in the Bahamas (note, don't go to the Nassau Sandals). W's beds were so comfortable, the second you picked up the phone for anything they were there, on the first ring often, calling you by name. Door man great, fresh coffee in the lobby, quick elevators. Very impressive! Little details added to the experience, Bliss products in the bathroom and fluffed up pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: Scotalot
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and have stayed several times over the past 8 years. The location is perfect and the service top notch. The rooms are large by NYC standards. My only complaint - the furnishings are showing their age. This hotel is due for a remodel. Would give 5 stars otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: PRP1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and daughter for a week. The lobby is nice and the restaurant Olives looks very nice. We didn't have dinner there but did have drinks a couple of times and was nice. The rooms are a little on the small side, specially for a family of three with a stroller and a portable crib, but we managed. The rooms were very clean and stocked with healthy snacks, drinks and even an umbrella which was great since it rained almost everyday we were there. The location is great, and having a babies r us a block away comes very handy when traveling with kids. Definitely would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Union Square area”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelBug18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and found it to be refreshing and extremely relaxing. Not being in the theatre district, it provided a great option near my business location on Park Ave. The staff was welcoming and courteous. The room was spotless, and the restaurant was a nice dining experience. I would like to suggest that the restaurant expand it's menu options, but the food was still prepared very well. I would definitely return if I need to be in this section of Manhattana again.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the Wonderful Part”
Reviews.Author: on-the-cheap
Reviews.Content: In this hotel’s defense, I am probably not its target guest. I am not young or hip; I favor khakis and button down shirts, subways over stretch limos and a tuna fish sandwich over tuna tartar. No one put a gun to my head and made me stay at The W on Union Square, but for the price paid, $429 a night, it came up short. Negatives, and some are nitpicky, but I think when you shell out a grand for two nights in a 221 square foot room you have the right to be nitpicky: no upholstered side chair in Room 616, as pictured on the hotel’s website for their entry level class of room, the “Wonderful Room.” There was a suitable desk chair, but that was it. … the desk clerk struggled with English and had a dickens of a time communicating with me in order to locate my reservation even though I handed her a piece of paper with my confirmation number and name. … my first two keycards did not work in the elevator. … there is no ramp from the street entrance to the front desk, just stairs, which means rolling luggage is of little benefit. … the really neat looking radio in my room did not work and when I called for assistance no one could explain to me how it worked. … the water control in the shower would not permit a strong flow of moderately hot water: the choice was excellent pressure of scalding hot water, or a trickle of enjoyably hot water. … the mattress pad was a couple of inches too short, head and foot, for the bed, which was not conducive for a good night’s sleep. … plenty of lamps, but lighting was too dim at night for work. … view from my window was into a generally grim back interior of the hotel. Positives: housekeeping was polite, accommodating and worked around my schedule. … I felt safe on the property. … room service breakfast was delivered on time. … well renovated, repurposed 100-year old building, with significant architectural integrity preserved. Would I have voiced these complaints had I paid $275-to-$325 a night, which is pretty standard in Manhattan for a comfortable, well-located room? Probably not, but I do think I paid too much in relation to what I received, and value is important to me. In fact, it is the single most important factor in selecting a place to spend my money, or when recommending to others where they spend theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Architecture meets Contemporarya Design”
Reviews.Author: jwg333
Reviews.Content: The W Union Square is the best of the W hotel selections in NYC. The rooms are a little more spacious with high ceilings creating a more open environment. The room decor is a little dated but contemporary and comfortable. Ask for a mega room upgrade as the regular rooms can be small. Their signature heavenly beds are just that's, heavenly. The lobby is small but contemporary in design. The bar right off the lobby is a great place for cocktails after a long day and Olives restaurant is worth a try for dinner. The hotel is centrally located and an easy cab or subway ride uptown or downtown. Front desk manager Mike Dunbar is a pro and Jose curb side will put a smile on your face. The W Union Square is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JETSETDLDK
Reviews.Content: Hotel was somehow below expectation; given that it was a W. Perhaps after coming from W@TImes Square where there are lights, sights & hype everywhere, we were expecitng an even better stay at W@Union Square but alas! It was not so. The 1st impression at the check-in was not great! Staff was not very friendly, aloof is a better description. Then our room was not ready even after 4pm! When we finally got into our room, it was not fantastic either. Room was dark and gloomy and furniture looks dated. Traffic noise was constant. Location-wise only so-so. Not as convenient as TImes Square and not much to do around the surroundings. We actually regretted moving hotel from W@ TImes Square to W@ Union Square and the rate at Union Square was more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful W Wows Again”
Reviews.Author: Toni V
Reviews.Content: Hello Thomas, I don’t have the Words to express my delight with my recent W experience. I’ve never been disappointed With W in any Way, and this trip was no exception. I am a die-hard W Woman and Whether you Want me or not, you’ve got me for life. Keep up the good Work and thanks for making me (a recent Widow on a mission to sprinkle ashes at Macy’s fireWorks) and my bffitWWW Women feel so Wonderfully Welcome. We had a Wickedly Wild time While there, splendidly relishing the W experience in every Way. I’m looking forward to our next visit to the Wonderful World of W. Many, many Thanks! Toni VanZant

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the US Open”
Reviews.Author: PAWJTravels
Reviews.Content: Good friend and I stayed at the W-Hotel Union Square while attending the US Open. Was a good trip "back home" for us and the location in Union Square is great for quick strolls to restaurants (Gramercy Tavern or Gothan Grill) as well as quick walk to subway stops. The rooms are clean and surprising large for a older NYC hotel. We had a corner room, so that may have explained the extra room. Design and decor is standard W hotel fare, which is pleasant, albeit a little "tired" from use in this location. That didn't deter from the enjoyment of the heavenly bed, though. Carpet in the hallway could use some refreshing. Staff was friendly and effective. Concierge arranged for car service for us from the airport upon our arrival and the service was spot on time even with our 45 early arrival and whisked us off in a new Mercedes S-class. Nice way to start the trip. I've stayed in all of the W-hotels in NYC at this point, and I think this was the best one, so far. Got a half-off rate as a Starwoods Member, but was still a bit pricey at 300/night.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel-best location in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: daisyi295
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival they were so nice to keep our luggage while we went to sightsee a bit before checking in. Although the room was small it offered all that was needed. Very clean and had Bliss amenities and a Bliss store in the hotel! Free apples, a great lounge and the best location within walking to anywhere in Manhattan! Would love to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding splendour”
Reviews.Author: CARIA
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the W Hotel Union Square in New York City, for our son's wedding, although we were delayed by 2 days due to Hurricane Irene. The staff at the W are exceptional, nothing is too much trouble and the hotel itself is lovely. The beds are the best, so comfy. The only negative thing I will say is that we thought the rooms were a little dark due to the fact that we had trouble opening the curtains, which were huge. Other than that everything else is terrific, nice bar area, great breakfast in the restaurant (no dodgy buffets here) and the door ambassadors were fabulous. The gents on shift while we were there were Jose and David and did they make our stay memorable. Having such great guys on the front line really gets your vacation off to a terrific start. The location is perfect, with the subway right there in Union Square and plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Has it all: location, historic architecture, modern "must haves"”
Reviews.Author: impicky
Reviews.Content: This W hotel was so impressive and we will most definitely return next time we want to be downtown. First off, the architecture. It's a former life insurance building, built in 1911, which has retained not only its exterior glory but also touches of its grand past inside. The accent work at the elevators on guest room floors is beautiful and the vintage hall telephones add to the atmosphere. The room was much larger than I would ever expect with a brand new bathroom, comfy bed and great windows that blocked out most of the Union Square area noise. We could actually sleep in this Manhattan hotel. We had a nightcap at the bar, which was gorgeous and stylish and had quite a 'view'. (Seems like there was a professional or two in the room but it was subtle and didn't bother us) The only unfortunate thing: we were only in town for one night. Next time, we'll stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: RLB_NYC
Reviews.Content: We live in the area but stayed here during a week we were unable to be in our apartment. It's a great property. It is very, very busy: it's a city hotel after all and like every W pulsing music in the elevators, lobby, etc. We stayed on SPG points and got a great deal...otherwise I do think it's pricy for the quality and size of the room - but not for the location, which, in my opinion, is a GREAT location for tourists/visitors to the city. Proximity to Union Square subway station allows you to travel quickly all over the city. MUCH more fun, more "authentic" and less overwhelming than midtown and certainly better than Times Square. Rooms aren't huge and bathrooms could stand an update - but when you are visiting New York I imagine you are rarely in your room! Try to get a room with a view of Union Square. Thought the service was terrific. It's located in a really great neighborhood. Don't miss checking out Gramercy Park, the Union Square farmers' market, Irving Place (try Friend of a Farmer for brunch or Casa Mono for dinner), ABC Home (and the restaurants in it!). I am not crazy about Todd English's Olives in the hotel but others love it. Great place to stay - especially if you can swing it on SPG points! As a tourist I think this would be a much better option than the W in Times Square or the several Ws in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TAlongbeach
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant stay. We were not able to have a room with two beds but the rollpout bed was comfortable. The staff was helpful and pleasant. While the lobby was busy and the lounge had a nice crowd and energy every night, the floors were quiet and the housekeeping staff was very nice. As usual, I am tired of the constant hand out of tips. The staff has as one guy that carries your bag 10 feet to give it to another guy who carries it 5 feet and puts his hand out too. Maybe that is just me. ( I hope it is not just me) I guess this is just how it is in the service industry. They were always professional. The dining area had good but not amazing food. The bartenders were quick and very friendly. The lounge was very nice and felt a little like a Las Vegas Ultra Lounge. Good drinks. The W is located in an exciting part of the city and central to a lot of activities. The Hurricane came through during our time and we always felt safe at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “My fave W property - Union Square”
Reviews.Author: ctorres3
Reviews.Content: I generally go to New York city twice a year for some leisure time and when I do I always choose to stay with the W chain. I have stayed at several of the W properties, however Union Square tends to be my preference. Every time I stay, it's always a pleasure. My most recent visit was in August 2011. I always find the staff extremely helpful & very attentive. They really are the reason my stay is always so enjoyable. They care enough to address you by name (on sight, not because they've looked it up on a computer). Also, to call your room throughout your stay to ensure everything is to your satisfaction. For me, they really have set the bar for the standard in EXCELLENT client service.

Reviews.Title: “Enough but somber”
Reviews.Author: Joaq
Reviews.Content: We decided for the neighbourhood but finally booked on W Union Square after searching for an option in front of the park. Yes it has a view which is difficult to find in the city. But decor is somber, rooms are small and yes noisy even in the upper floors. Restaurant Olives is quite good but in the expensive side and the bar aside of it is very noisy and crowded at night. So we will not recommend it if you want tranquility even in one of the most peacefull areas in the city, the W does not keep a peaceful atmosphere. We wiil not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: DomPasqual
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, and location is great. They have this help desk called "Whatever," where they claim to solve all your problems and even answer the phone with, "What is your wish?" But they were unable to give us any help: They told us that they would only charge us one fee for using their internet, but charged us $28 for every device in the room that connected; they have a poor selection of TV stations, they refuse to recycle in the hotel.... In short, they were not accomodating in any way. For such an expensive hotel where they aren't embarrassed to charge $6 for a plastic bottle of water, it would be nice if they made good their pledge to do anything we ask at their Whatever desk.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return!”
Reviews.Author: Selina W
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stay here for our Wedding anniversary (19-21). I was checked in by Natalie Scott, she was very professional and attentive; we even got an upgrade to our room and champagne! The bathtub kept flooding we had maintainence at our door with in minutes and he was very polite and professional (forgot his name :s ) Hotel decor made u feel like u were out of state, lobby was clean and smelt really good! The location is perfect, u can practically walk anywhere, train station I minutes away, restaurants and park right in front of you! One thing I would say is the carpet in the room smelt like it needed cleaning and the bath tub could do with an upgrade, other than that, we enjoyed our stay! Thank You to the W for making our Anniversary staycation worth while!! Thanks to the W for making our anniversary staycation worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but I'm sure there is better out there...”
Reviews.Author: R_G_BAR_G
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were not friendly at all, very short and wanted you dealt with asap - it didn't seem that busy? Room was good, although a hot-shower was hit and miss (twice without). view was rubbish (i suppose a lot of NY hotels are though). Had a desk and wi-fi - perfect for work. Great location on Union Sq (not so touristy), also has a great Market on the Sunday. Hotel bar was good, very nice staff. Breakfast was okay, not amazing. Would definitely go back, but i can't help but think there is better out there for this kind of price.

Reviews.Title: “Another great return and stay”
Reviews.Author: travelot777
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite hotel in NYC which is why I keep returning. The location at Union Square is excellent and it is close to all the things I want to do in the neighborhood. As a return guest and loyal SPG member, the folks at the hotel treat me great and make sure that I get the best room possible. Rooms are spacious including nice amenities and most with excellent park views! Going back in a couple of weeks...

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED. Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick17
Reviews.Content: From the decor of the lobby to the rooms, this hotel is your everyday hotel, not the trendy type that the W is known for. The room that I was assigned to was horrible! The curtains are hard to shut, the shower stall was small. The bathroom door is so big that if you leave the door open, you take half of the space in the bathroom. But the most disconcerting part of my stay was that around 8:00PM a weird LOUD humming noise started! I thought it was a fire alarm or something. I called concierge and sent security to check the upper floor. In the end, the security guy stopped outside of my room and even he heard the loud noise. Until this day I still don't know what it was. The next day I checked out, the manager didn't seem apologetic about the disturbance and didn't seem to care at all. Just said that there was a problem along the '12 line'. I'm assuming all rooms in the same area must hear that noise too. To recap: this hotel was not worth my money and time. Huge disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, big room”
Reviews.Author: Ramey501
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many a New York hotel and this is my new favorite. For a W, it's quieter and not so hip that I feel like I'm sleeping at a club. The door men are great and friendly and the rooms themselves are large. Biggest room I've had in NY yet. The Union Square area is a great centralized area and has great shopping and food just steps away. The only reason I can't give 5 stars is that the internet is horrible. If you are planning on working from your room all day sadly I have to say, don't stay here. The internet cuts me off every other minute and I ended up having to just "Hotspot" my phone and work off that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: whahglund
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel this weekend and had a fabulous time in NYC. The hotel staff is very professional and Joseph the Consierge was really helpful with restaurant suggestions. Breakfast at the Olives Restaurant in the hotel was delicious, especially the lemon crepes. This location is great. Out of the maddening crowd and yet close enough to the Theater District and sights. Highlly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel but for the price you'd think they could afford to throw in complimentary water and free wifi.”
Reviews.Author: Ktwse
Reviews.Content: This hotel feels a bit like any Western airline. A solid pedigree and a polished facade, but that illusion of luxury quickly fades as you realize they'll charge you $9 for a bottle of water, and $15 for 24h of Internet access - PER device. That's beyond cheap. If you pay a premium to stay at a place like this you expect such things to be included. Sadly, this tarnishes an otherwise excellent experience so far. I would easily recommend the hotel if not for this. As it stands, I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding block hotel”
Reviews.Author: yossarian03
Reviews.Content: We hosted a block of guests in the hotel for our wedding weekend -- 22 rooms in all. We had a beautiful corner suite. The service was outstanding, the rooms we visited were a very large size for a NY hotel and were extremely well appointed. Most importantly, Charmaine, Christophe and the rest of the team did their best to make us extra special on our wedding weekend. We, along with our family and friends, had a fantastic experience. Thanks W!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Can_do_girl53
Reviews.Content: In early July 2011, we stayed one night at the W at Union Square in lower Manhattan. The front desk clerk, Nelson, was fun and friendly and very efficient. He upgraded us without us asking, giving us a spacious and very quiet room at the end of a hallway with a great view. Everything about the room and spa-like bathroom was top notch. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: MITravelers
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, right in the heart of Union Square, close enough to LGA. A great bar on the first level, along with a club in the basement. The rooms are nice and the employees are very helpful and nice. The hotel offers a free car that will take you around, within limits and when available.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated Run Down Property”
Reviews.Author: clwoolst
Reviews.Content: Our first room's a/c did not work, TV did not work, wi-fi did not work, and my husband had to fix the plumbing in the shower. 2nd room - telephone did not work and 1/2 drank beverage in the fridge. The meeting facility was also lacking... Later I was charged for items from the honor bar that we did not use. The "Whatever" line was rude. The bright spot of the stay were the doormen and the bar staff from our conference happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite W in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: mandjatx
Reviews.Content: Ended up getting a huge room on this stay, which was a great start to the trip. Not that there's really a bad place for good restaurants in New York City, but the W is a short walk to some amazing meals. The staff is friendly and on this particular trip were overtly helpful in managing bags, restaurant reservations- just a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “i don't get it”
Reviews.Author: Cerrig
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews and stayed in many other NY hotels, I was expecting more of the W. Firstly I’ll point out i did use (many many) AA miles to book the room which might explain why ours was more like a dark cave than a 5* hotel room - 2 tall windows looking out at a brick wall with another building next door - i had to stand by the window and look directly up to even see a tiny patch of sky. The room was certainly large for NY, but would have preferred less space and a teeny tiny view/daylight. There was only one of the doormen who ever held the door open and no-one offered to help us with our bags to our room when we arrived. Additionally, I thought that the communal areas lacked space and wow factor. There were no seats in the lobby and never any free seats in the small bar and the lobby bathrooms were dated and utilitarian. We have stayed in the Crosby St & Soho Grand and much preferred both for ambiance. To be fair, if you had a room with daylight and used the hotel staff a lot (who, it is said, are very helpful), perhaps you would have a very different view. But I am a low maintenance guest who likes lobby space & design in a hotel, so I guess Union Sq W just isn’t for me.

Reviews.Title: “The W US is Always On It's Game”
Reviews.Author: DJV_10
Reviews.Content: Keep coming back here 100% of the time because this place is so special. It really is a home away from home. You know from the time you walk in that people are communicating with each other to make your stay the best possible, from the valet to the front desk to the "Whenever, Whatever" room service. Rooms are very comfortable. The hotel is just starting to rejuvenate the décor and furniture, not that they desperately need to because the rooms are still really nice. My fussy girlfriend always mentions how comfortable the beds are. The management and staff are expert at taking away all the stress that travel and being away from home can cause. When you're happy, they're happy. Great alternative to midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with new rooms, cool small lobby and an OK restaurant service”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: This was the fifth time I stayed here.  Overall a solid hotel.  Location is not the best for tourism but for business can be OK depending on your meetings. High quality, new (or renovated) room with all amenities. nice to stay in these rooms.  Room service can be a bit expensive. Eg 1L bottle for $9 a bit expensive but if you like there are 3 grocery/sandwich/liqueur stores 30 seconds away.  Cool lobby bar with chess board.  Lobby restaurant can be a bit busy. Waitresses of different quality - some can be really rude during lunch. Quality of food good but not great.  Reception fast and easy. Bellboys helpful. There is always a green apple on the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't have been better.”
Reviews.Author: JethroSD
Reviews.Content: Everything about this trip was the way I planned it. Arrival was efficient and fast. We didn't get an upgrade but we did want a room with a tub. I went back to the desk and asked the hotel manager, Gerald, for help. He sensed that I was not satisfied with the room and did everything in his power to make sure that our stay was enjoyable. As we were preparing to check out he called from home to make follow up see that we had a fabulous time. I will definitely be back. I only wish all hotels had staff as attentive and courteous as Gerald and the rest of the staff at the W. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “W Union Square - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ronnylandolt
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights @ W Union Square. Positive: ideally located - very close to Soho and Meatpacking. Negatives: The Hotel is rather old and needs a renovation to catch up with the other W Hotels arround the globe. Rooms are small and prices are rather topish. I do miss complimentary water and free internet. Service could be a touch more benign...

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience; Will be back”
Reviews.Author: MATravelerBOS
Reviews.Content: I usually don't stay in this part of the city, for business or pleasure, but I would come back here again. The room I had was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable. Service was great. A little out of the way from the usual tourist spots, but on the plus side it was less crowded and hectic in the area. Convenient parking right around the corner. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good W property in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Luu
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveller that stays over 200 nights a year in hotels. THE GOOD Great location and nice rooms. W Hotels have a standard that you expect. Certainly the property itself here meets those. Close to Union Sq and easy to get around the city from there. Great food options nearby. The room was nicely decorated, not ultra modern and very comfortable. Much bigger rooms than other W properties in New York so you get better value. Surprisingly very quiet for a hotel in New York City. THE BAD I think service could be better at the front desk and the valet. Not quiet friendly, but not totally rude. More indifferent than anything. Maybe it's a New York thing. I left my wallet and camera in the safe here by accident once. Security was professional and very good at handling the situation. However, trying to get my stuff back when I came back for it took forever.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: pearsoninmarin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many top rated hotels in NYC during numerous visits over the years, but we have settled on The W Hotel at Union Square as our all-time favorite. The location is perfect, the rooms are well appointed, the housekeeping is impeccable, but the best part of the hotel experience is the entire staff. The doormen, front desk people, housekeepers, and management all go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Every special request is tended to promptly and with courtesy and there is never the feeling of staying at a large, metropolitan hotel . . . the atmosphere is intimate and inviting. A gem in the middle of Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “w does not mean wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: TAYLOROhio
Reviews.Content: if you want a dark outdated unfriendly hotel in not so nice of a area stay here. the room was no better than the marriott, no turndown service. no hello or goodbye at the hotel. not even a hello at ck in only photo id and triple a card. the bed was so bad i need to see the chiropractor today. the bathroom had the same piece of hair for 2 days not ours gross. stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Trendy and popular bar.”
Reviews.Author: Astrid72
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping and restaurants (pretty close to meatpacking district). Rooms: comfortable bed, view consisted of a piece of wall, products from Bliss in bathroom, bad lighting and a noisy not very efficient aircondtioning. Everything extra from umbrellas to water and WIFI were available for very high prices (as in all expensive hotels..). The room felt fresh and modern in style. Bathroom: In our room no bathtub only shower. Pressure in shower below average. Service: The hotel's guest service helped us to book restaurants and clubs during the entire length of our stay. Very convenient for international travellers who have no clue about what is in or out in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal, Couldn't Ask for More”
Reviews.Author: Estrella13
Reviews.Content: I will never stay in another hotel in NYC. This hotel is fantastic. We loved the location, so easy to get around everywhere. The hotel itself is gorgeous, the room good size, clean and well appointed. Nice and quiet at night, which is not easy in NYC. The doormen and concierge are the best in the city. Friendly, with a yes attitude and never act like they don't see you. I wrote a letter to the management regarding our excellent stay , which I rarely do anymore b/c service isn't the same as it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Dandu2003
Reviews.Content: I have called beforehand informing Guest relation staff to arrange a welcome letter for my husband who visited NYC the first time. Upon arrival we were greeted and told we were upgraded. That was nice.
