But being in the industry it also meant the message will not in the room :( It was not and it turned out the room was not what the Manager had in mind for us the first place. The bed was old and slept in plenty times. Our preference is the firm mattress. As we have not really enjoyed the room upon arrival we did not even know until we returned after a long day in the city. We alerted the staff who tried their best to accommodate our request. But Unions and late hour prevented it. The note by the way was now in the room. The next day I approached the Manager on duty and long behold he called me while we were out and about that he found another room with a firmer / newer bed. When we returned we were in heaven. The follow up was great, the service phenomenal and the bed fantastic. We were also given a high floor room. We did not like the loud elevator music. Even though W stands for the hipper younger bar crowd the music does not need to be that loud. Look out for the door man Jose. A unique experience. Great - the free of charge drop off in Hyundai car from 10 to 6 daily.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: TerriGirl79
Reviews.Content: Uncaring Staff and a HUGH RAT outside front door, a terrible experience

Reviews.Title: “This place is totally over-rated”
Reviews.Author: jneedle
Reviews.Content: There's nothing special about this hotel besides the location. No perks. The amenities are bare-boned. You call for room service and you need to specify that you want water with your meal, and that it should come on a cart. The room service takes FOREVER, the food is terrible, and it comes with a mandatory twenty percent gratuity. No wonder why the staff doesn't care about making guests happy. The elevator blasts techno music at all hours, the staff is not overly accommodating. This place is lame. I can't believe how much they are charging for the room $600/night?? Rather stay somewhere truly luxurious. Don't waste your time or money

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the Birthday Goodies”
Reviews.Author: DCGoddess
Reviews.Content: Hello Mr. Christophe, I just spent 4 days at the W Hotel in Union Square and had a wonderful time. My two daughters and I were celebrating a graduation and my birthday. Thank you for the room upgrade and birthday cupcakes and strawberry sweets that were left in our room. The service was great and attention to our comfort was very much appreciated. Since my older daughter lives in NYC and I do come for visits, I will certainly book with you again. Thanks to you and your staff for making our stay special. Germaine Parra

Reviews.Title: “Staff is second to none!”
Reviews.Author: Snogolfer
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like someone special, stay at the W Union Square. The staff there makes you feel right at home from the front door, to the front desk, to the bar and most impressive, the concierge. It truly is Whatever, Whenever.

Reviews.Title: “OK but I expected better”
Reviews.Author: melc26
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was fine, but I wanted to let people know that for the price of the room it's pretty standard and there are much better options out there. Olives restaurant where you go for breakfast has the worst, slowest service ever and some of the staff couldn't crack a smile even if they tried. Miserable. Cups & glasses were dirty (I never normally complain about this sort of thing) but this was like they'd JUST been used and then reused. Food was OK. Overall I would say, really friendly front desk. Really nice door guys and room service cleaners were very nice but aside from that, nothing stuck out in my mind. Room was standard, more like a 3 star hotel and what griped me the most was the rate was 500+ a night and then internet / breakfast / water was all extra and at extortionate rates. The internet didn't work well on the 20th floor (I had 1 bar on wireless) and if you ahve multiple devices you had to pay 2 - 3 times for the internet. My room was right opposite the elevators so I had them going throughout the night. As I said, the hotel itself was OK, but much much better options out there for the rate they charge!

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: mess0277
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, well laid-out room. Very quiet inside rooms - you don't hear neighbors. Only 2 downsides: club music constantly plays in lobby & elevators; and bed, although beautiful, was way too soft. Would give 5 stars if the bed was as good as everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Not all Ws are created equally”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: I was unimpressed with a recent weekend stay here. We arrived super late night (think 1 a.m.) and there was no doorman nor anyone to help with our bags. We noticed over the course of our three-night stay that this was the norm. There was rarely a doorman, and when there was, he was usually too busy chatting with people on the street (girls) to actually do his job. There was a family of three checking in before us who took forever. Couldn’t seem to decide what room they wanted. So when it was finally our turn, we were told we had been upgraded. We got a room on the 21st floor but I’m still trying to figure out what the upgrade was. The room was very average and poorly laid out, but maybe just a bit more spacious than the typical NYC hotel room? Either way, it seemed pretty shabby for a W. The air conditioner made an annoying whirring sound, the lighting was bad (the desk lamp didn’t even work), the shower could’ve used a good thorough scrubbing (though the shower pressure itself was great), the closet door got stuck on the room door (hard to explain) and so on. Just a lot of little things that weren’t so obtrusive that we needed a new room, but things that you shouldn’t have to deal with when you’re spending this much $ on a room. The bed was the main saving grace—incredibly comfortable. Oh, and the Bliss products! My biggest peeve—the pesky wifi fee… Why some hotels charge for this still is beyond me. We thought since my husband is an SPG member, it was complimentary. Nope. That’s only for their top-tier members apparently. Ridiculous. The service was rather lackluster. Aside from the doorman issue, the people at the front desk weren’t the most helpful. Our first day there, my room key wouldn’t work in the elevator. The woman at the front desk checked it and told me it should be working, then agreed to give me a new key. The room was in my husband’s name so she couldn’t give me a new key without talking to him first—despite the fact that I already had a key to the room to begin with, and despite the fact that I showed her my ID which had the same last name as the one on the reservation. The location is great but unfortunately the hotel is not. It really doesn't live up to the standard one would expect from W Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great service- I was a happy camper!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great big room, love the bath products. The wherever/whenever operator was like out of a commercial for the W. I asked for the weather and she gave me the most helpful answer on the weather, the breeze, and what outerwear she would recommend. Beyond helpful! As a former resident of NYC this is the absolute best location you can stay in. Only silly thing is charging $15/day for wireless. Please make that silliness go away. On a positive note they had delish flavored water in the lobby and a nice free coffee bar set up in the morning. My trip was a mix of business and then family (2 small kids) and they lovely to all of us. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but......”
Reviews.Author: UandD
Reviews.Content: Having read so much about how wonderful this hotel was we thought it was possibly the ideal place to book....so from a location perspective it was ideal both to go way downtown or uptown and too be truthful the best location I,ve stayed in when visiting NYC. With respect to he hotel, our room wasn't, ready even thou we were checking in at 4.30pm..not ideal in light of the fact we had being travelling all day. After a bit of too'ing and fro'ing our room was ready (told it would be 45 mins, in the end 5 mins!), then....no briefing of the hotel facilities, no offer of assistance with our bags! We had booked a mega room which was mega in size (for NYC), however, the it's layout was poor in terms of furnishings, that said fantasically comfortable. Therefore on after we literally just used the hotel for somewhere to rest our heads, expensive head resting!!! Coffee shop across the square was excellent for breakfast and people watching....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Karren03
Reviews.Content: The location is very handy to the subway and stores and restaurants. The staff at this hotel were fantastic and very helpful. The gym is the best I have ever seen. It was spotless, with modern treadmills, bikes and elipticals and also free weights, balls, and more. The room was beautiful and the beds were comfortable. Wireless internet cost $14.95/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebax
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff were almost great except for one staff that gave us wrong directions, otherwise, the service was great. The room is fairly spacious by NYC standards. We had dinner at Olives on the first evening and our meals and service was exceptional. The hotel is nearby the Metro, bus stop, open market, Whole Foods and some shopping. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal, beautiful and professional staff. Amazing building, bar and food.”
Reviews.Author: meatghost
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in April. It rained most of the time but I still had an amazing time whenever in the confides of the W. Treated like royalty from all the staff, people that I hadn't even met somehow would know your name. They were always smiling and happy to have a chat. The bar staff, waiters were not only beautiful on the outside but on the inside too. The room and bed was great. Slept like a baby every night. Location, location. Right outside Union Square, you can't do any better. I can't wait stay their agan.

Reviews.Title: “I believe this may be the best W out there”
Reviews.Author: Mako32
Reviews.Content: SPG Gold Status member. Booked a mega room via spg.com. Upon arrival was asked (by the most darling front desk attendant) if I could wait until 3 PM and that it would be worth it. I did, and what I was given was beyond my expections. An amazing high floor corner one bedroom suite. Room was spotless, as were the two bathrooms. Room service fantastic. Private entrance to Underbar. I have to say, I have stayed at many, many W's in my time, always happy with them, but this one is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: travellite36
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again without hesitation. From check in to check out, the customer service was outstanding. The staff is friendly and helpful, even providing complimentary transportation to short distances in a chauffered Acura. We did not get to try the restaurant,as there are many sorrounding the hotel. (The location is unbeatable) But the bar off the lobby was very nice and lively. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. Accomodations were without fault. I cannot say enough about the W union square. I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Much much better than its current tripadvisor ranking”
Reviews.Author: vedev
Reviews.Content: First trip to New York and stayed a week on business with colleagues. Hotel just simply couldn't have been better - staff especially were excellent - so thank you! My personal favourite moment in the hotel was when I asked if the concierge might be able to find a digi cam to borrow as I had forgotten mine and she produced some complimentary black and white disposables for me - what a great touch. Rooms are big and the beds massive and comfy, showers always had perfect hot water and decent pressure. My ONLY complaint is the $15 a night WiFi charge - come on guys this is just silly in this day in age. WiFi is, however, free in the bar and restaurant area so I can't complain too much. Can't wait to retun in June

Reviews.Title: “The W sure knows how to do it right!!”
Reviews.Author: ChristopFer
Reviews.Content: I purchased a room for my friends to stay during their anniversary weekend. I received a note a few days before the date from the “W Insider” team asking me if there was anything they can do to make my stay more enjoyable (dinner reservations, etc.). I mentioned that the room was for my friends and I thought they would enjoy the W service. The W Insider team (Christopher Thomas and Elizabeth Baker) took the initiative to add their names to the reservation, gave them a double upgrade to a mega room and provided a complimentary anniversary amenity (Champaign and chocolate covered strawberries). Now that’s a hotel that knows the meaning of service. I’ve always be happy at W Hotels put personal touches like this really widen the gap between good and great hotels. The W Hotel in Union Square is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First and memorable stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Bertrand_FRA
Reviews.Content: W New York - Union Square was the first hotel I stayed in New, and I had in fact a very nice stay. Check in was quick and efficient, and I was quickly in the lift heading to a high floor room. The room was big (according to my standard which is mainly London, where they may classify as a suite something over 250sqf -or even less-). Then I waited for a colleague who arrived 2 days before, but was leaving the Hilton Millennium due to the noise associated to ground zero building site. (to be honest this Hilton is a better choice for us since our NYC offices are located in the World Financial Center Just across ground zero building site) As soon as he checked, direction Concierge to book a table at the strip house for 3, my boss had called to ask what were the plan for the night (very good steak and usual poor/amateurish service you can expect in NYC, strangely enough only in Restaurant). For me and my colleague as 2 French persons (our boss is English) the most important part of the day was done (securing food) we headed for the UNDERBAR, so we passed near the Fitness room (not very attractive, but I am not a sport person) which looks very attractive base on some reviews for our first G&T, this was a disappointment, dark and gloomy, mainly looked like the interior of a bunker (and we were nearly the only ones). No problem then up to the bar in the lobby, where we were supposed to meet our boss (and our 2nd G&T) the place is heaving looks so trendy, really a place to see (and be seen ?, will leave this one to NYC residents) after a third G&T... (no we stopped at 2, we were having dinner with our boss, you may have a look at Strip House New York for more info -but still not written-) we headed for dinner (we had the 3rd one back in the hotel). the location is great, Tube/Subway? is just round the corner and as soon as you understand how it works you can be anywhere in Manhattan within minutes. and if you want something special you can get have a look at the Union Square Farmer's Market (Mon,Wed,Fri,Sat looked at internet to give accurate information) the market is across the street and provide quite a choice of food from the New-England and Canada as well as American natives art) Very good as well for the one, who do not like restaurant on their own, there is a Whole Food across the square (for the non US reader, Whole Food is a grocery/supermarket providing normal vegetable, take away foods AND a dining area and microwave after the tills. My favourite choice on a city tour. Checkout was very efficient and it was time for fly back to Germany for a week before visiting the Waldorf Astoria. Final judgement: I will definitely recommend the place, (without GF, except if she looks like a top model, since a lot of girls in the lobby bar do look like it) localisation is perfect. only issue was the price, got a lot of more enjoyable stays at at other (Starwood) properties in NYC/NJ, However this place may be attractive for me but not other people (W Hoboken, stay tuned)

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: jkdarwin
Reviews.Content: I can sum up my recent visit at the W Hotel in Union Square with one word – FABULOUS! I have stayed at many hotels in NYC, and I can say without hesitation that the W Union Square has been my best experience. Every single person on the hotel team was exceptional from the front desk staff to the bellmen to the housekeeping staff. This hotel knows how to provide exceptional customer service. And the room was spacious and very comfortable. I will never stay anywhere else in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky bar and bedbug-free room”
Reviews.Author: jimmyk4444
Reviews.Content: Room was bedbug-free. Service was excellent. Concierge was helpful and friendly. Bartenders were hot and the hotel bar seemed to be popular with both guests and locals. I stayed there in August 2010 and had the same experience. There is a Dunkin Donuts about 50 yards away (I learned of the last morning of our stay), but great for on-the-go hangover breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly the best place to stay in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Geekontherun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property multiple times on business. They are consistently the very best in NYC! They set the bar very high! Each time I have arrived they know me by name. Every person that works at the hotel greets me by my first name. I have stayed here numerous times during my birthday and each time they know it without any one letting them know. They surprised me on my latest stays with flowers, sparkling wine and cupcakes that were amazing! They service is incredible. The rooms are amazing and large by NYC standards. They have an amazing gym downstairs as well as business center, concierge who will make all of your wishes come to fruition, the restaurant is amazing, a hip bar that is great for meeting people, the views are amazing, it overlooks union square. You can go to the farmers market on the weekend. It is within walking distance to soho and centrally located within the city. They do have the acura driver who will take you anywhere you want to go. This would be a great place to go for that special event occasion. they are THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WHENZUC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W hotel for one night on SPG points. Upgraded room was large, had nice amenities, and was well located. Although i only stayed for one night, I found the staff to be very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night for my weekly trip to NYC. Hotel is in a great location for my office as well as for exploring. Check in was quick and friendly. Apparently got upgraded to a nicer view because of my SPG status. I was on a high floor in a king room overlooking Park Avenue. Room was large and clean. I really loved the bench in front of the bed - so convenient and means I didn't have to throw my bag and briefcase on the bed as I got settled. Clearly got someone else's room as there was a note from the manager along with a snack and some bottled water but that was ok with me. Bathroom had a large vanity and plenty of towels. Shower had great pressure and plenty of room to maneuver. Wasn't feeling well so was going to order room service however the prices were shockingly high even for an expense report meal so many convenient choices just steps away so I ventured out in the cold. Lobby was hopping with bar goers and dining patrons -- definitely would not have felt comfortable dining alone there. After dinner, returned to the room and discovered there was quite a draft coming from the window. Had trouble getting the room to the right temperature but once settled the comforts of the W bed helped me get a great night's sleep. Room was very quiet with no noise from hallway however street noise was another thing --- lots of sirens all night long. Because of the location will keep this on my list however very expensive for what I need -- would like to bring my wife here on a three day weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want in a hotel??”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: What's not to like? Great location. Great Service. Large, updated, clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Great linens and towels. Quiet, quiet, quiet.........no noise from other rooms whatsoever!! Staff is outstanding! We have stayed in many Starwood and other boutique hotels in NYC. I think this is our new favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other NYC W hotels but this is first stay at Union Square and I think the best of the lot. At $300 p.n. (inc tax), I thought this was good value for NYC given location and that my room was spacious. Added plus is that there is a great restaurant, Olives (Todd English), on the ground floor. The gym is decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler640
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night with friends in a suite for a bachelorette party. It was perfect for a group! The suite was big and there were two bathrooms. The hotel is very trendy and modern in design and decoration. The rooms were clean, quiet, and location was great! There are many people walking and shopping nearby in Union Square. The hotel also has valet parking, which is rare in NYC (although it will cost you the same as paying in a garage). My only two complaints are that the hotel staff said they would send up an extra cot for one of us to sleep on, but they never did and one of us ended up sleeping on the couch. However, the couch was comfortable so we didn't mind too much. Our other complaint was that neither of the two TVs in the room worked, but we didn't bother calling down to the desk because we weren't in the room long enough to want to watch TV...we were out and about in the city! The price is not necessarily the best; it was fine to be spit between a group, but when we considered staying there in a regular room for each couple for the bride's wedding, the price was too high for any of us to consider as individual couples.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - would happily stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: Right-O
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights in early January and was not disappointed. Location on Union Square means that East/West Villages are a stone's throw from the hotel.. which means lots of great places for eating, drinking and shopping. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. The bar on the main floor, while I did not use, looked very trendy. My hotel room had a very comfortable bed, a nice big desk and tv and some very thoughtful amenities like a iPod speaker port. Room service, which I had for a dinner and two breakfasts, was very nice, albeit quite expensive for what it was (but that's room service in the heart of NY for you). All in all an excellent stay - I would happily choose the W at Union Square again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYC_lover2011
Reviews.Content: WOW ! Simply WOW! My husband and I went to NYC for a romantic weekend getaway and we stayed at the W Union Square. The hotel was beautiful, well located, very close to the subway. The staff at the front desk were very friendly, courteous and efficient. We got an amazing spacious room on the 21st floor. The bed was so comfortable. Nova the concierge was the best! She helped us with our numerous requests and made awesome suggestions regarding restaurants and bars. I would highly recommend this hotel. We could have asked for a better New York experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: nybeachbumm
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with some friends for a bachelorette party. The location is great; you can walk to many shops and restaurants in the area. The hotel is in a very hip part of NYC. We stayed in a “Mega” room and it was very large. The room had high ceilings and plenty of space for four girls and all of their stuff. The décor is trendy and simple. At night the Living Room bar was crowded with young people, just what we wanted! This hotel is great, I can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wotel and Wervice”
Reviews.Author: Georgio L
Reviews.Content: As I travel a lot, it is not my idea of reviewing every hotel I visit. Only the extremely good or bad gets one. I normally stay at another hotel in NY. They were full (except the last minute deal they offered: 14.000$ for 6 nights...). As a member of SPG and having stayed at another W (W Times Square) a while ago the choice was quickly made. First contact: SMILE! At reception: SMILES and an upgrade to a mega room! Friendly notes from the Stylist (housekeeping) in the room. Terrific toiletries. Plush towels. Great food. And more SMILES, SMILES, SMILES... Need I say more? My friends stayed at the Hudson and ran away to the W. The first thing they said when they were greeted at the door: oh, look at the friendly smiles... They also received an upgrade ànd an adjacent room for their daughter. That's called service and customer care. Thank you for the Wonderful stay. Just one "critic"... The gym has only cardio equipment. Of course, silly me, it's called Sweat...

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay not the typical W experience”
Reviews.Author: Matthew417
Reviews.Content: I recently visited NYC which I do annually. I booked a reservation at the W New York on Lexington but they were not able to accomodate my needs and suggested I stay at the W Union Square. The location is great of the Union Square W it is in the middle of great shopping and very close to the Subway. That was my favorite part of this hotel. The rooms are larger than the W New York, but I found them to not be as well 'styled'. Also, the building is very old... and one big problem is you can hear a lot between the walls. The other issue I had with this W is that the service is not up to par with other W's I have stayed at. The front desk manager was excellent. Front desk and doormen/bell staff was just 'OK'. Upon check-in I requested a roll-a-way bed and never got it. I had to call again hours later to ask again. Also, the doormen/bell staff are not as friendly/eager to assist with getting you a taxi or taking your luggage. The yes I would recommend is a 'barely' recommend. Unless you need a large room and must have the Union Square location I would highly recommend you stay at the W New York on Lexington Ave. The rates are generally lower at the W New York, also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for an Extended Weekend and the New York Marathon”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: My wife ran the New York Marathon this past November and we stayed at the W New York-Union Square. We really enjoyed our stay and thought that it was better to stay a bit of a distance away from the craziness that is Times Square. The staff even had a care package/gift bag for my wife when returned from the marathon. They even noted that she was a participant and had a copy of Monday's New York Times at our door the next day because the paper publishes the names of all the sub-5 hour finishers of the marathon. Very thoughtful. The rooms were a good size for Manhattan standards and offered every amenity. We didn't think that the Todd English restaurant in the lobby was all that special, but only went there for a quick lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: UKMAC96
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Mr Tellez and his team go far beyond the call of duty to ensure your every wish is catered for. Will never stay elsewhere in NYC now. Well done and sincere thanks to all at the amazing "W"

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Mostly Good Hotel - - needs a bit of an update”
Reviews.Author: Pete312
Reviews.Content: The W Union Square is a in a terrific location for tourists. Close to the subway and fun shops and restaurants it’s also away from the crazy overpopulation of Times Square. The hotel itself is very typical W which appeals to many, but not to all. There is a great energy and Vibe about the place without being too pretentious which some W properties fall prey to. The rooms are decent sizes by New York standards and some are quite large. Ask for corner rooms on upper floors. My one gripe - - the rooms are getting tired looking. I’ve been staying at this hotel for years and the décor and finishes were cool 10 years ago but are looking a bit dark and dreary now. The bed and bedding is great – a hallmark of W Hotels. The bathroom is cramped and dated and for some reason the water temperature was impossible to regulate on this past stay…either frigid or scalding. There are better boutique hotels if that’s what you are looking for. I stay here because I’m loyal to Starwood and like to earn the points. If you are traveling with people who prefer more traditional environs (i.e. no loud music in lobby, no busy bar scene) you might want to consider other options like the Le Meridien or the new Intercontinental. All that said - - I will be back as I really do like the hotel and the location…just hope a decorator stops by soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bland W hotel with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Noodlesz
Reviews.Content: Front office desk staff were efficient but nothing special. Hotel is a narrow building, so the lobby is unimpressive, elevators tiny and dark. 'Living room' on the side is cold in the winter, but there is free wifi down there. Sometimes a door man, sometimes not, if there sometimes he'll open the door, sometimes not. What kind of four - five star hotel doesn't have a door man opening the door all the time during business hours?? Had a room w 2DB, which was spacious I thought, esp for NY standards. But beds were a bit soft and could use new mattresses. Cleanliness/maintenance OK, but not spic and span. Soot by the windows and stains here and there, some rusting in the tub area. Can hear honking and cars go by also. Not the best to sleep through. Called 'whenever/whatever' for a toothbrush, had to call twice before it came after 20-30 mins. Again, not 4-5 star service. But did request 2pm checkout and got it, kudos for that. All starwoods i've stayed out have not had a problem with late checkout request. Overall very unimpressed with this property, and feel bad if you had to pay a lot of money for it since i know room rates can go up very high for this property. Plain regular W hotel, but location is ideal with shopping/subway/restaurants nearby. Just don't expect anything cool or hip with this place.

Reviews.Title: “The most extraordinary experience ever”
Reviews.Author: jordie146
Reviews.Content: Without going into specifics, I would honestly say that my family and I have had the most extraordinary travel experience ever. The staff at the W Union Square went so above and beyond to create a memorable experience for us that I am left speechless. I am a fairly seasoned traveler and have stayed at W Hotels before as well as other comparable properties. The property itself is splendid as is the location, but again it is the staff from top to bottom here that are really unique. These people work well together, appear to enjoy doing so and really want to make a guests' visit the most memorable possible. This is an extraordinary group of people in an extraordinary property who are working harder to create extraordinary memories.

Reviews.Title: “Much better stay this time”
Reviews.Author: Ctpat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W last November and it was noisy and not really clean, but the 2 days we spent there last weekend for the Marathon were great! Clean and pretty quiet, considering it's in a busy area, and so easy to get around the city from the hotel--not to mention everything that goes on in Union Square-Green Market, shops, etc. Brunch at Olives was delicious. Beds are sooo comfy! We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect chic nyc hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mtllady
Reviews.Content: chic and sexy huge, quite, plush rooms best, best, best bathroom products great service awesome bar

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location with great linens, but pretty loud”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night in October with DH. You just can't beat the location for the restaurants and nightlife around Union Square. Light sleepers beware! The hotel is on a very busy intersection and we were bothered by the noise. But the room was enormous and the bed was so comfortable we didn't want to leave in the morning! The linens were so soft! Service was professional, but snooty. Enjoy New York!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good service but in dire need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: IslandHopper888
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this particular W a few times over the past several years and generally found it a comfortable experience. It occurred to me during my most recent (sept 2010) stay that not much has changed here in the past 7 years or so and that the property is starting to look a bit worn out and run down. Olives, the restaurant/bar is more or less the same and the rooms and decor are starting to have a tired and aging look. There are newer and more modern downtown Manhattan hotels for the same or less money, maybe these properties are passing the Starwood chain by. Anyway, Park ave location is great and can't be beat, Union square never fails to disappoint with lots of action day and night. Hotel services are generally pretty good. I probably will give this property a miss next time I'm in town and check out a newer venue.

Reviews.Title: “This place looks tired”
Reviews.Author: Fishabs
Reviews.Content: Great location. The room was a decent size with nice, high ceilings. But the rooms are pretty tired. I remember staying here when it first opened years ago and thinking it was pretty nice. But it looks like they haven't done much to update it since. The furniture in my room showed a lot of wear and tear, as did the carpeting, the walls, and the fixtures, such as the lamps. The phone next to the bed did not work. The iPod docking station did not work. Nevertheless, the room was relatively clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location here is great. But for the price, I think you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with not so nice service”
Reviews.Author: Selva18
Reviews.Content: The hotel, building and rooms are quite nice. The lobby is very stylish. The location is very good, right on Union Square with lots of things to see, 15-20 min walking distance to SoHo. The service was not so good though. The front dest staff was not so friendly, and the restaurant service was extremely slow with very high price. I think you can find better hotels for this value, and definitely eat better somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful - Thanks for a Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: RHKH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic weekend at the W Union Square. They were amazingly accomodating of all my requests and surprised me with a special Birthday treat of Champagne and Cupcakes. THANK YOU "W". The room was very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. We even had a great view of Union Square. I will definitely return. This hotel is very convenient for getting to all parts of the city. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about it!”
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, dirty corridors. First night had a dark room with absolutely no light for more than 400 dollars, had to ask for a change... Room service extremely expensive for less than average quality. Will never come back

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: krb5000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location but I feel the price is too expensive. Make sure to take advantage of the free Acura car service. The lobby is great spot to people watch. I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Fionarina
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a very loyal SPG Member and travel very frequently. We tend to stick with W or Westin hotels. This hotel is old and needs updating. It is not trendy and definitely not hip. But it advertises itself to be. Was I upgraded at checkin? Hard to say as the guy never told me. Was there a newspaper every morning? No. The concierge even gave me wrong directions! The doorman, when there was one, was not very polite. The beds were old and sagging. The gym was small but adequate. I asked for a specific number of towels and I didn't get them. However the one good thing is that you can print out your boarding passes for free in the business center. But the hotel doesn't advertise that fact. You have to go into the Wired room and look on the computer screen and follow the directions. Other than good location, I can't praise anything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice room”
Reviews.Author: kate_willwerth
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time, the service was professional and made my first overnight trip to New York really special. Stella at the welcome desk and Richard the overnight welcome ambassador were especially nice and fun to speak to. Aisha at the concierge desk was helpful with directions and activity planning, all and all it was fabulous and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: SergioMarrero
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel is artsy and inviting, the staff is inviting, and the location hard to beat if you love the city.

Reviews.Title: “If you like staying at the Holiday Inn, you will like staying here.”
Reviews.Author: salliejoe
Reviews.Content: The W at Union Square has gone steeply downhill. This used to be our favorite hotel in the country. Now we will never go back. Service is unpredictable and lax. The front desk staff are incompetent to the point of being harmful. The management simply does not care. We were overcharged due to a clerk mistake and were made to feel like we were criminals as the front desk manager argued with me until I cried in frustration. That is very uncool. The hotel is clean (no bed bugs) and safe. You can get better quality service for a much lower price at a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly loved it!”
Reviews.Author: susieque080
Reviews.Content: I travel for business frequently and routinely seek out Starwood properties first. This particular trip was to celebrate our wedding anniversary, so I did some research to select the perfect place. I've stayed at a number of the NYC Starwood properties, but this one is my new favorite. The location was perfect. Each staff member we came in contact with was extremely friendly. They genuinely seemed interested in making our stay enjoyable. Room was delightful...roomy, clean and chic. Amenities were fantastic and ample. Great ambiance in lobby. Decent fitness center, too. For as seldom as we get to enjoy leisure travel, this property and the staff made it an all around wonderful experience for us. I can't wait to return..............................

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Fredrik_Lotta
Reviews.Content: We spent our 10th anniversary in New York passed weekend and stayed at the W Union Square. We experienced very good service from the concierge and other staff. The room was spacious with a nice view over the square (we booked a "spectacular room"). We walked everywhere; to Central park, SOHO, NOHO, Nolita, Little Italy, Midtown and Chelsea. The location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, but smelly bed”
Reviews.Author: LP2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business. It's in a fantastic location and staff could not have been kinder or more willing to help. The rooms are huge by NY standards! The trendy W was its typical techno modern feel with dark halls and hip music in the elevator. When I woke up at night, I could smell "dirty person" on my pillow and sheets. I moved to the other bed. It seems they neglected to clean bed linens from the last guest which is GROSS. I won't ding them too hard on this, but it needed to be noted.

Reviews.Title: “Have not even stayed there yet”
Reviews.Author: eflikimlkfk
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation in this hotel during very busy time, and being busy myself I asked 4 different people for an email address a week ahead so I can write down my questions or possible requests (NOT demands, only requests as I understood the hotel is busy and I had a very cheap rate, I only wanted to place a request), all 4 of those people started their answers with annoyed "Ugh!" and all of them refused to give me anyone's email. I booked room with 2 dbls, but the hotel operator was literaly cutting me off before finishing my sentence saying i booked 1 bed. I offered to forward her my confirmation, she again cut me off with "ugh! No no no you booked one bed i have it right in front of me". I didnt have time to fight so I said, ok its one bed, can you please place a request if anything opens up to do 2 beds or place extra pillows and blankets so we can sleep on a floor", she repeated I booked a king. I said " I am not asking you to switch anything I am asking you to place a request". She got irritated and trasfered to FD. I'm not even going to continue, but I can tell you-I know I pay low rate therefore I really dont expect to be treated great, but this was a bit too much. Luckily there was another hotel available so at the last minute I switched hotels, I would be ashamed to take my family to this hotel and have them be treated like this.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to W standards”
Reviews.Author: traveller_amp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 2 W hotels before - Minneapolis and New Orleans. Both were great. The W Union Square was in a great location. It had a nice lobby and bar and was relatively clean. They let us check in early to one of our two rooms. The concierge was wonderful. We could barely hear any other guests and our room was on the back side and you'd never guess we were on Park Ave. BUT...front desk staff were hurried and unfriendly (I am a native northeasterner so I am used to east-coast attitudes) - not up to the expectation I'd have for a W. I wasn't asked if I had a starwood number, which I did, even though I didn't put it on the reservation. They just, always ask - but not this time since they were in such a hurry (no one else was waiting). The room we stayed in was a good size, with a great bathroom, but the hallway and room had the lingering odor of smoke covered up by air freshener. Our friends were never notified when their room was available, as promised;their room didn't smell, but they could hear the Park Ave noise. The hall rugs were stained from what looked like some water damage. The bill for the room across the hall was slid under our door. The final letdown was that the turndown staff stole my powder makeup (really? makeup?). And when I told the front desk person, I got the same hurried, mumbled, robot-like response ('my apologies for the inconvenience'...that's about it.). I also just found out that the hotel filed for bankruptcy in May. So I would guess that the prospect of any improvements is low and that the hotel will slowly keep going downhill unless starwood intervenes. I won't stay here next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Angelinas74
Reviews.Content: Had a great night on the town with my sis, and we stayed at the W on the 4th floor. The location couldn't be beat and there was surprising little street noise from the room. I recommend a martini at Olives, and make friends with the doormen. They know what they're doing and can get you anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: rssa
Reviews.Content: Although still quite stylish its an older building and its not quite up to W standards. Had a corner suite looking out over the square but was relatively small. If you can get good rates then maybe worthwhile but at $900 a night it felt overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Not In Your Face W”
Reviews.Author: vots824
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the W, from the moment I walked in, to the time I checked out. We requested a room with two double beds, and the only room they had available was a sub-par room. We were upgraded, by our generous guest service agent, to a beautiful corner king room with an extremely comfortable cot bed, with no charge. The bed was very comfortable, only one less to the Westin Beds. The location is also great, as its right in Union Square and a populated subway station. Compared to any other W I have stayed at, this was my favorite one, since it wasn't obnoxiously in your face TREND. Great for any age, and a definite choice for another stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “W for Wonderful, can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMMiller
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews was a little apprehensive about staying here. Was completely impressed and thrilled with the location, amenities, services and incredible staff. This is great location, the outdoor market, shopping and restaurants. Mod, comfortable rooms. Traveled with 7 year old. Very quiet at night, incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: crtrip087
Reviews.Content: We booked a Spectacular Room for one night (8/7/10) looking forward to what was promoted on their website: "More spacious than our Wonderful Room, with sunlight-filled views of Union Square or the storied downtown neighborhood. Lounge, wrapped in soft terry robes, in the overstuffed velvet armchair with Munchie Box delights." Instead we received a small dark room with a tiny window, no terry robes, no bathtub as pictured on website, no munchie box delights. We had to call for the robes, and were told the "munchie delights" were in the refrigerator for a charge and not all Spectacular rooms had bathtubs as pictured on website. The location was great but disappointed in the room and the attitude of the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TCinSF
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the W and will definitely stay here again. Plusses: - Great service, with a special shout out to Natalie, who was so kind and helpful. - Great location. Central to everything and within walking distance to East and West Villages, Chelsea and Meatpacking District. - Good value if you're using SPG points+cash. We stayed in the Spectacular Room, which is a nice size for rooms in NYC. The bed was spacious and so comfortable. OKs: - Room decor probably doesn't measure up to the new W hotels, and isn't much to write home about. Also, the one window in the room is pretty small, and doesn't allow for much viewing or light. - Fitness center is small, but clean and tidy. Minuses: - It cost $10 to print 1 page. That is a bit excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Best W I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Folkgroupie
Reviews.Content: I have been to W's before---but this location the best I have stayed at. My room was large for NYC. Great Breakfast at Olives. Staff genuinely friendly and helpful--not just the hipsters in black who are too cool that I have experienced at other W's. Packed a great airplane pack lunch for return flight (and thank goodness because of delays of flights I was the only happy person at the airport) I will return

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SSGGCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Union Square for two nights this month (July) while apartment hunting. Myself and two daughters enjoyed our roomy upgraded accommodations. What made our stay so pleasurable was the staff at The W Union Square. The Door Men, Front Desk, Concierge and Housekeeping all made it their business to ensure our stay was wonderful. Direction, suggestions, you name it. Good Location & restaurants in the area, check with the concierge she had great suggestions. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: counselor04
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at the W for myself and friends who were coming from out of town. We were meeting for a mini college reunion. I often find it hard to pick a hotel because I am concerned mainly that it won't be clean and comfortable. The W was immaculate! The room with a king bed was spacious and the bed was so comfortable. I was also impressed with the service. Check in was so easy and quick. Everyone at The W was helpful and friendly. I would love to have another stay. My friends who came from other parts of the country were also extremely pleased with their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Divine, classy, quiet & romantic - fabulous all around!”
Reviews.Author: TandKBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W over the weekend and were blown away by how seriously they take their mantra of 'wherever, whenever'. Nelson checked us into the top floor of the hotel and was ready to answer all of our questions and make us feel welcome. After we unpacked, we went down to see the concierge staff - both Nova and Aisha were superlative in their suggestions of where to go and what to do. We sort of goofed on Saturday night and ended up at a restaurant we hadn't expected to be at. When we told Aisha the next day, she made sure we had her card so that we could call her if we found ourselves in the same situation during the day Sunday. In the meantime, she made our dinner reservations for us and was prompt about calling us to confirm them. When we got back to the hotel on Sunday night, we felt like we were safe and at home. NYC is exciting but also a little scary if you're not used to it. It felt like the staff at the W had our back and were ready to help us forget about the hustle and bustle outside. Everyone greeted us with a smile. The hotel room itself was much larger than we expected and the amenities had us looking for a 'Bliss' store in NYC so we could pick some up for ourselves. The room was clean and we slept like logs - not something we expected to do in NYC. We had breakfast at Olives on Monday morning - it was great. The lemon crepes were filling enough to last me a ride back to Boston that day. Kudos to the excellent wait staff in the restuarant for delivering piping hot food quickly and efficiently. We had a beautiful visit to this hotel and are planning on going back next year sometime. We were actually celebrating our 3-year marriage anniversary to each other and thought it was the perfect weekend get-away.

Reviews.Title: “The "W" was WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: REB8232
Reviews.Content: We had a WONDERFUL! time while staying at the W! Everyone was extremely friendly, helpful, and courteous. The suite was fabulous and spacious and the bed was so comfortable. We enjoyed the view from our room of the park at Union Square. The cheese/fruit tray and wine was much appreciated after a long exhausting trip. All of the staff at the W did an awesome job. The atmosphere was outstanding which was shown by the friendly smiles and the appearance of the staff working effortlessly together. Everyone seems to love being employed at the W. Thank you so much for an amazing stay. We do hope to return to the W.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: mustwrkout
Reviews.Content: Stayed there many times, consistently good, was given room upgrade without requesting.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, chic yet charming and tucked away from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Cindy32461
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at this hotel and it is by far my favorite. I have stayed at several other hotels in NYC, but I always try to stay at the W Union Square when I can. The hotel is located across the street from a farmers market held on Friday's and Saturday's which is always a treat. The subway is also located close by. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud, absolutely to die for! I highly recommend the W Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WJMV27
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the W Union Square for 1 week and I proposed to my girlfriend. I wrote to the hotel if they could help me with my proposal and so they did. I could make use of the rooftop to pop the question with the best view of Manhattan and Brooklyn. There was Champagne as well. I would like to thank especially Mrs. Elizabeth Baker and Temara Exton for all the preparation, communication and help during my stay. They make my proposal memorable and special. So a big THANK YOU again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place, Great Vibe”
Reviews.Author: DJV_10
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this property for 9 years, on average 8 times a year. Staff are magnificent. They are beyond professional, knowing what you want before you know what you want. The front desk staff, room service (Whatever, Whenever), and management are intuitive about their guests and use that to their advantage to make everyone feel more than welcome but at home. The rooms are fresh, spacious, and many have terrific views of the park. Amenities are excellent, including the Bliss bath products. Housekeeping is always on top of things. The attitude of the place is: just pick up the phone and we'll make it happen. Olive's (one of the first Todd English, Boston spinoffs) has the best menu with food prepared by a very talented kitchen. Server's are helpful and knowledgeable. Great for breakfast, brunch, and dinner. Underbar has a wonderful selection of drinks, a full selection of beverages, and delightful bartenders. These places can get loud at night but the rooms are always very quiet. Neighborhood is one of the best in NYC. Great central location. Only downside is they are not inexpensive but they are worth the price (especially if you hunt for special deals on the website). Hard to imagine someone staying at W Union Square and not feeling great!

Reviews.Title: “You must try the baked goat cheese appetizer @ Olives, with a glass of champagne of course!”
Reviews.Author: travelinghillbilly1
Reviews.Content: After having a snafu with the reservation at the hotel last year, they more than made up for it this year. It had literally been a year since I'd last stayed at the hotel, but they remembered the issue we had last year and did everything to make my stay pleasant. The location is great, the lobby bar (with free wireless access) is fun and the beds are amazingly comfortable. They also have a nice bar in the basement. It is not the cheapest option in NY, but if you want to treat yourself, it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sooz421
Reviews.Content: Our stay was brief , but extremely enjoyable. I can't wait to stay there, again. From our check-in and the healthy Granny Smith apples available for the taking, to our room's comfortable bed, more than adequate bathroom, and amenities from the general manager, we couldn't have asked for a better "glad you are here" feeling and reception. This W hotel really knows how to treat and pamper a guest!!!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of average...”
Reviews.Author: lindz3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night and was not impressed with much about this hotel. Check in desk was efficient but quite disinterested and abrupt. Room was clean and quite large for NYC. They tried to charge us $25.00 for a cot, but I called the manager and told her that we were promised a free cot when I made the reservations. She didn't seem to believe me but said there would be no charge for it. The cot was to be brought up to our room during the day but when we returned at 1:00 a.m. it still hadn't been delivered. Only three bath towels in our room and after an hour of waiting for more towels...still none. After a phone call to the front desk to inquire about the towels, two different housekeepers showed up with towels! Asked bellman to hold our luggage in a room and upon our return walked by our unattended luggage on a cart at the front door. My husband's computer, etc. were sitting there for at least an hour without anybody guarding it...the luggage was right next to the front door! This hotel was fine for what we were looking for on this trip...a place to crash for the night. There was really nothing special about it. Just average.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Nothing Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MintChip17
Reviews.Content: The W Union Square is in a great location if you want to be closer to the Village/Soho but we found the room to be somewhat average and disappointing for the price. One would expect that at over $450/night the hotel could at least provide a shower cap and more than one soap so you don't have to share the soap between the bathroom sink and the shower. Do I really need to call housekeeping to request these amenities that should be standard?? We also arrived at check in at 3-something after a long flight from the west coast and despite early check in and late check out promises due to our Starwood membership, the room was not made available until 6pm. TOTALLY unacceptable. The hotel did offer me a glass of wine and breakfast for two to make up for it, but this shouldn't have happened. On the plus side, the concierge was very helpful in getting us all our desired dinner reservations and the front desk manager was nice to offer the wine and breakfast. Overall, I would only go back if the price is right as there are far nicer hotels for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: fordpat
Reviews.Content: The W Union Square is simply the best-in-class among high-end business hotels in New York and across the country. My assessment is based on many stays at this hotel and extensive experience with other fine hotels in New York, in major cities around the United Stastes, and in other parts of the world. The physical reasons are plentiful: excellent location with easy access uptown or downtown -- a neighborhood with some of the city's greatest restaurants a short walk away (Gramercy Tavern, Blue Water Grill, Gotham Bar & Grill, Union Square Cafe, Veritas, and literally hundreds of the best are nearby). Business entertaining is thus easy and pleasant, and could include the hotel's Olives Restaurant, run by celebrity chef Todd English, where I often hold business breakfasts. The rooms are spacious, with great beds, great showers/bathrooms, and an outstanding work area with high-speed internet access. The very good rasio alarms also have Ipod docking stations. I get tons of work done very productively there. Across the street, Union Square always is bustling, and on at least three days a week it boasts the finest farmer's market in the city. What a treat! After visiting the terrific restaurants, sushi bars, seafood houses, barbeque joint, and green market within a two-block radius, the W allows you to work off the calories in a superb fitness center stocked with first-rate equipment. The rooms are cleaned and stiocked masterfully by the excellenrt "room stylists," who always address even the most minor special request (e.g., extra linens or such). But those are just physical attributes. As with human beings, the true beauty of a fine hotel goes way beyond physical beauty. The spirit that sets this place apart comes from an extraordinary team of people, and their passion for true hospitality. I've always been delighted by the service at W hotels (have stayed very often at the one in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and elsewhere, including the superb Court and Tuscany hotels on E. 39th St.). At the W Union Square, it's the W spitrit on steroids. The good feeling starts with the best front door team (known as welcome ambassadors), to an amazing front desk team, to extremely helpful concierges, and to great customer relations specialists and managers. I know many of them by name and would like to mention them here, but I am afraid to omit anyone. They consitently come through for me every time a stay there, and they make me feel like family -- on every visit, at least a couple of the guys at the door ask for my wife, who they've met; it means so much to me that they also make her feel at home when she comes. The W Union Square gets my strongest recommendation, as many of my friends and colleagues know. I'm a huge fan.

Reviews.Title: “They just got everything right!”
Reviews.Author: MrsP18
Reviews.Content: A very warm and personal greeting from the doorman led on to an excellent check in service, where the receptionist recognised us from a phone call the week before when we thought we may have to cancel our trip due to the volcanic ash cloud (note that although we were on a non refundable advance purchase rate, they confirmed they would provide a full refund) and we received an upgrade to suite. The suite was amazing with a lovely bathroom with huge window and tub and shower. Free wifi in the lounge, and the ability to check in online and print off our boarding passes, plus an excellent concierge service are all those little extras that add up to a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: fotonutSacramento
Reviews.Content: this is a terrific hotel, Downtown NYC is a fine place to stay with excellent restaurants, the High Line and the SOHO Chelsea areas close by. Clean good service and great staff

Reviews.Title: “This upscale hotel is a gem. A stay here...”
Reviews.Author: moonchief
Reviews.Content: This upscale hotel is a gem. A stay here gives you faith that there still are hotels that are clean, classy, and guest oriented. The bathrooms are spacious and spotless, with

Reviews.Title: “10 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dddkkk67
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W Hotel could not have been more perfect. From the smiley doormen to the wonderful staff everyone was terrific. The Hotel is clean and spotless 24 hours a day and the maid service is the best in NY City. Whatever it is that you do to train the staff at the W Hotel please do not change a thing because you do not fine customer service like this anywhere. From the moment you arrive to the time you leave the staff makes you feel so special and all you want to do is stay or come back as soon as you can. Thank you again for a amazing time at the W Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"WoW"”
Reviews.Author: HS100
Reviews.Content: The experience of commuting into the city on a friday nite is enough to make anyone sick.I travel for business all the time and stay at 4 star hotels. I have to commend the hotel property and insiders on the staff,from the moment I stepped out of the car with my wife and 15 girls(birthday party sleepover for a 13yr old) and luggage everyone was so kind I thought I was on a vacation. The doorman even greeted me by my name when I returned from my night out and even the next day! The insider (manager on duty) Liz was extremely helpful in making sure everything was fine during my stay.This was my first time staying at a "W" and I will defintely try to stay at one everytime I travel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: dyaz26
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in NYC for Business or Personal Trip. Beautiful hotel, very clean, & trendy. Location is GREAT, in the heart of NYC. Anthony (Front Desk Manager) was very helpful during my last stay -- he was beyond helpful and nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a sweet sixteen!”
Reviews.Author: 052410d
Reviews.Content: I recently spent my sweet sixteen with a couple close girlfriends at the W Hotel, and I have to say it was an amazing trip! Our stay at the W definitely made everything very special. My thanks to the staff, Temara, Jose, Kieth, and everyone else, you were great in focusing on making my stay as pleasant as possible! I was so excited to find a delicious tray of sweets and a bottle of non-alcoholic champagne my room. A great touch! The rooms we got were amazing! We had adjoining rooms connected my a private vestibule so that my parents had one room and my friends and I had the other all to ourselves! The rooms were very clean and the beds were so soft and comfortable! It was so nice to have a restaurant right in the hotel. Olives had delicious food and friendly service. What a great way to start a night on the town! Another great feature of the W is the personal driver and complimentary ride offered as part of their Whatever/Whenever service. This was so much better than getting a taxi! Overall this hotel has great service and great quality, and it"s a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: coolsand
Reviews.Content: Since the last few years, I had the opportunity to stay at many hotels in various cities primarily because of business travel. I can say this with a lot of confidence that in comparison, W - Union Square is hands down the best. I think this is a very nice place to stay for the following reasons - Great location, amazing staff, clean large rooms and all the services you would ever need. What impresses me the most is that the staff here consistently delivers top quality service, they are always very friendly, and will greet you with a warm positive attitude which is hard to find these days in busy/successful hotels. The best thing is you do not need any elite membership status to be treated well, I have noticed that every guest at this hotel receives exceptional service. Yet to hear any complaints from any of my friends who stayed here. Also, the other thing that my friends and I love about this hotel is that it is so conveniently located – so close to everything, I just cannot stay at any other hotel even when I need to stay in NY for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room and service!”
Reviews.Author: travelot777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location close to the LES, West Village and Chelsea. I travel to NYC regularly and this is my favorite hotel not just because of its great location but because the rooms are spacious and the staff is really customer focused making sure all details are properly taken care of each time I visit!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place from where to take a bite from the big apple”
Reviews.Author: ChefBaba
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had an opportunity to visit NYC for a weekend of play and leisure and the W Union Square was a perfect place for us. From the moment we stepped up to the Welcome Desk, Temara greeted with a sense of professional playfulness that is signature to the brand. Our room was bright and beautifully appointed. The bar was fun, concierge super helpful, and room service fantastic. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CLK427
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for a weekend get-away and couldn't have been more pleased with the experience. My boyfriend and I were in town for a concert at Madison Square Garden, and ended up getting engaged. No doubt, this hotel made the weekend that much more special! I gave the staff a heads up that I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with a snack when we arrived on Friday night, and we had wine and a delicious fruit/cheese plate in the room as the bellman was dropping off our bags. Thank you Liz ;) Room service was delicious (had the french toast) and the gym was neat and clean. The staff was genuinely helpful and down to earth, the rooms larger than most in NYC. The best part may have been the location - easy to grab a cab and and a short walk to great restaurants/bars. I will definitely stay there the next time I'm in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! We had a great weekend...”
Reviews.Author: Melheinz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! We had a great weekend stay here. Awesome staff and great location. Room was beautifully designed and very spacious. Huge for right in the city. This is our new favorite hotel and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff, with leadership by example”
Reviews.Author: censington
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand why this hotel gets such good reviews. It's perfectly well designed but no more so than lots of other premium design hotels in major cities and it very definitely feels like a chain hotel, which of course it is. The rooms are good but again no more so than lots of others. The restaurant's fine. The location is very good, right on Union Square. The bar and lounge is buzzing at night, which is probably the best thing about the place. The worst thing is the staff. Overall, they're OK but at their worst, they are completely unacceptable. Take this for example. I needed to meet a client at JFK. The doorman was talking to someone. I asked him for a cab. He told me I could go with the person he was talking to who proved to be a private taxi. It was twice the price of a New York taxi and I told him so. He denied it. He seemed to think that as I was from the UK I wouldn't know. I did. So having had his money making scam go wrong the doorman then walked across the pavement to some tourists who were looking for a cab and got them one. He told me he would deal with me when he was ready. I returned inside the hotel and spoke to the duty manager. She probably could have cared less but I can't see how. New York is full of good hotels so why would I stay here again? I certainly won't.

Reviews.Title: “Their days of glory are over- This place sucks”
Reviews.Author: TheTruthOnTravel
Reviews.Content: I was a regular at the W Union Square for years. It was cool and they basically established a trend... it's over now. Shortly after the sale (at a record per-room price, I believe) the place starting going down hill FAST. Clearly, the new owners overpaid and where trying to squeeze every dime out of the place. Glasses in the room replaced with plastic cups; the towls were worn out, thin, had fringed edges and one had hole in it; the furnture, which used to have a cool dark black/brown stain was painted with black lacquer-- ala a second-rate budget hotel; and, after all this stuff had me fuming, I get into bed and the sheet had a cigarette burn hole in it! To be honest, it made me very sad, because they clearly let it happen. I tried to point this out to management, and while helpful, they clearly didn't care. I'm not a total snub, but for 800 bucks+ a night (for superior, extra big room), I need to feel at least a little luxury. There are a gazillion better places in the area for that kind of money. My new hangout: The Gramercy Park Hotel-- casually plush and small enough to have a staff that truely cares.

Reviews.Title: “A truly memorable experience!”
Reviews.Author: coco2929
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived (at an un Godly 4am) the welcome was warm and real. The service throughout was friendly, and fun. Food was delicious- mega olive tapenade in Olives restaurant! Totally addicted. Room was an unusually generous size for a New York Hotel . Whatever Whenever lived up to its name and took care of all our needs, we will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing experience. If you are...”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyro
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing experience. If you are going to lower manhattan you must stay at the W Union Square. At the front desk Eddie Ruiz, Nelson, and Indiana were extremely helpful and offered the most amazing service from check in to check out. The room was amazing with exceptional views and very clean. Also Olives is very very good you must experience this restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: adiam7
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal for business and I try to stay a bit longer in NYC because I love the city. I have stayed at more then a dozen hotels in NYC. I will name a few to give you an idea of the range: Ritz Central Park, SoHo Grand, Tribeca, Gramercy Park, Royalton, Four Seasons,Trump International, Regency, W Times Square, W Lexington, and the Waldorf. I am no novice! I tend not to care for really large hotels because I feel like service is often a casualty in those places. The boutique hotels seem unable to have things like gyms or business centers in there, or worse 24-hour room service.Once I stayed at the W in Union Square, I have not stayed anywhere else. This last time I stayed for a week and there was a snow storm while I was there. I needed to extend my stay and Natalie at the front desk was able to accomodate my request with no fuss and no muss. The rooms are really large( for NYC) unlike some of the trendier hotels that think a closet will do as a room.The rooms have flat screen tv's, dvd players, iPod docks, wireless internet and there is a buisness center. I thought that staying on Park Ave South, as opposed to mid-town would be a hassle, but actually it was great because the cabs could shoot straight up or down Park Ave and I could get anywhere in the city very quickly. Park Ave. happens to be both ways which is nothing short of a miracle in the city. The location was great to walk around to nice restaurants as well as the famous farmers market across the street. There is a 24 hours store next to the hotel, a Sephora and a Branes and Noble across the street, as well as a CVS at the end of the block, and all came in handy.There is no spa at this hotel, but there are so many in walking distance. This time around I even found a great Pilates studio 3 block away.The food at the hotel is unbelievable and 24 hours, it is also not $100 for breakfast like most high-end hotels in NYC. I think their calamari is the best I have ever had, and I grew up in Italy.There is a really nice and CLEAN gym.The products in the bathroom are all from Bliss, so I never have to pack lotion since that is the brand I use anyway. There is an Olives by Todd English restaurant on site and they have the most divine Brunch there, we are fond of the banana whipped cream. The best part of the hotel is the staff. They are really kind, attentive, and efficient. There is no sense of aloofness as I have found in other W locations from their staff. This is from the guys that open the doors and get your bags to the managers, who can can be found getting your bags too , they are all so professional. The check in and check out has no headaches and no surprises on your bill either, believe me this happens more often then not. I needed to go to Fed-Ex a few blocks away with my luggage, since it is cheaper to mail my luggage these days then to fly with it, and Stella at the front desk arranged for me to use their complimentary Acura car service. It was really at the last minute and Stella was able to do that for me quickly and painlessly. She also had me checked out, with my bill ready for review by the time I came downstairs and I was able to make my flight.I have also brought my nephew, he is 5 here, and the staff was so sweet to him. I am bringing him back for spring break this year and he is already asking if they can stay at the W , since he was spoiled rotten by the staff. I love the way this hotel looks, the smell form their candles, the extremely large and durable W umbrellas that came in handy during this last trip, the different waters by the front dest right net to the granny smiths apples. I love the lounge with its great books that you can read while having some tea. It is a great location, superb staff, and an amazing experience Blissfully, Adiam Berhane

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Hugis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate enough to stay at W Union Square twice in January this year. We absolutely loved the hotel, the wonderful staff and the location. We were made so welcome that upon returning for our second stay it was like coming home. We would like to commend Keith at the front door, Nelson at the front desk and Heather in the lounge/Olives for especially great customer service. They are true talents! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “overall pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: HMSNewYork
Reviews.Content: The room, except for the worn and spotted carpeting, was otherwise clean (nearly) spotless, the bed was superb. The hotel lobby lounge is a favorite nightspot for locals (and I am a local). Olive's restaurant was a joy. Fitness room was barely passable. Hotel location is outstanding for nearby nightlife and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Roe13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was great too! Two names stick out...Eddie and Nelson!! I would definitely go back to The W and ask for them to help me!!! Great job guys!

Reviews.Title: “NY August 08”
Reviews.Author: DanaG73
Reviews.Content: I went with my Mum and we found the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was very stylish but compact. Very little room for storage but great loaction.

Reviews.Title: “Good NYC Location, Somewhat Cheesy Vibe”
Reviews.Author: ReggieF
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel was a bit of a scene - club music in the elevator, bustling bar, neon lights in the hotel rooms. I usually look for quiet, cozy, charming boutique hotels. BUT...this is in a great location and is a good value. The beds were comfortable, views are good, rooms were quiet. If you can get over the fact that your hotel is ready to party all night - the elevator seriously plays techno club music at any hour - 10am, 2pm, 11pm and 3am - this is a decent place to stay. Once you enter your room you are in a quiet zone. The staff is very helpful. You are steps away from the Union Square subway stop. Walking distance to the East and West Village. I travel to New York all the time and I would recommend this hotel to tourists. It is cheaper than staying up by Times Square but just as easy to get around. And, if you want nightlife - it's right downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Nelson at the welcome desk was fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DallasNJen
Reviews.Content: Because of the great service, I would definitely return to your property. I would also recommend all my friends & family to your location. Again, we enjoyed Nelson's enthusiasm & personality whenever we encoutered him. What a wonderful time spent @ the W!!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: counrygal
Reviews.Content: Staying at the W Union Square hotel was one of my very best hotel experiences ever! Chic decor and staff. Has a unique euro-chic feel, yet staff were extremely gracious. The room amenities are top of the line, including bathrobe, and staff could not be more helpful or polite -- more than polite, apparently pleased to be of service! (offered umbrellas in the rain, concierge endorsed my inquiry about a nearby restaurant and dining alone, asking if my inquiry was an invite for me to accompany him!) This did not feel odd, just friendly in what often is not a very friendly city! I felt pampered and in luxury. Plus they upgraded me (on my first stay!) to a fabulous suite with view of Union Square. Union Square is a fabulous location -- so many great restaurants, farmers market in season and convenient to get around town.

Reviews.Title: “2 words- ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! (and I stayed there despite reading bad reviews!)”
Reviews.Author: Biki
Reviews.Content: While planning a Birthday trip to NYC for my Husband, I cam across many bad reviews of W Hotels NYC in general. One day while in the city, I strolled in, told them about the negative reviews I read, and asked if I could see a room.They were taken aback by the mention of a negative review, but nevertheless, they were pleased to show me a room! We just stayed at the W Union Square this past weekend, and all I can say is that I will certainly go back and reccommend this hotel to everyone I know! Check in was simple, the "wonderful" room- absolutely fabulous and SPOTLESS to boot- (believe me- I checked!) Room was HUGE! Bed & pillows so comfy you fell asleep immediately!
