Bathroom spotless, roomy and Bliss Spa travel products were fab! There is also a scent throughout the hotel kind of like a light mens cologne which is wonderful. We were treated like royalty by everyone- from the doormen to the front desk & everyone in between. There was no noise problem, no problems with ANYTHING for that matter! And the view from the 16th floor was breathtaking! I also found out they are dog friendly (for an additional fee of course!) which is awesome- I'll be bringing my dog next time for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel getting tired”
Reviews.Author: JoeFoodie
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square. Olives restaurant on site. Friendly service. But rooms are starting to look tired and need some refreshing; decor drab and dark which doesn't help traditionally small NYC guest rooms. Gorgeous historic building however.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottfd
Reviews.Content: My stay at the w was tremendous I felt like I was n a different country Natlie at the front desk was great very kind,respectful,helpful I look forward in staying at the same hotel n the future when I want to get away again Thanks

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, hip hotel with great service and an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fromnytokw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W Union Square for over a week and loved it. Elegant, modern, hip and classy all at the same time. Service was exceptional (special thanks to Nelson Baez!) and rooms were perfect. Wonderful location, only a few steps away from Union Square. We look forward to staying here again the next time we come to New York!

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a somewhat good and very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Earthman83
Reviews.Content: I have to say this place grew on me. Put it out of your head that you need a four seasons or a Ritz carlton class of service and room if thats what you are used to and you will not go too far wrong here. We were in a "wonderfull room" with a partial view out to union square.The room was fairly basic in my opinion and did not have a separate shower. For one of their better rooms,this was and always will be a major negative for me. When there is room for a walk in shower [rather than in the bath] then they should be put in. It makes the room so much nicer,I think. Servicing of theroom was good but there was no turn down. As we were there for a bit of partying and Xmas shopping , this was a disappointment but not a biggie. The hotel has a busy and very hip [for want of a better word] bar. The staff there are very friendly and theres always a buzz.It's a great people watching spot. The breakfasts in the restaurant beside the bar,I'd give a 10 out of 10 as they were delicious and the service there was great. We found the concierge service here to be excelent. The definitely went the extra mile to help us out! The other thing I'd say about this hotel is that everyone appeared so friendly,guests and staff alike. Maybe it was because it was the Xmas season but we liked it! Would I recommend it? Yes I would but hotel owner's...please install separate showers in rooms that can have them!

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: maki2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great. I was amazed each time I went in. Stuff was really friendly and check-in was really fast. Ans there is one thing in NY that really counts; location! The hotel is located perfectly. I will never ever stay somewhere else in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, comfortable room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CCRR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for seven nights over the holidays. This was by far the best hotel stay I've experienced in New York City. The staff, from the front desk, to the doormen, to room service and the housekeeping staff were all excellent. Being from the West Coast, we were on a bit later schedule leaving our room almost every day but our housekeeper never missed a day cleaning our room! She was friendly and professional. Really a lovely lady! The turndown service staff were also great. We ordered room service dinner one evening and it arrived at exactly the time stated! The room service food wasn't spectacular but acceptable. If you're looking for a quick snack, I would recommend 71 Irving. They had excellent chai and their pumpkin lattes were made with real pumpkin--no sugary syrup! Their sandwiches were yummy as well. Really a nice neighborhood place. This hotel will be our first choice for future trips to NYC provided we can get an affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want for your stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: jenh815
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you'd want when you come to NYC! It is right near Union Square, so there is a multitude of great restaurants and shopping. It is also less than a 1 block walk from the 4/5/6 train so it was an easy commute for me when I worked at Grand Central. What's great about this hotel is you can chill at Olives bar, go work out in the W Sweat, or go to the Underbar Lounge/club, without even leaving the building! The front desk and W desk staff are amazing, especially Danny, Chris, and Eddie - they welcomed me back at only my second stay here and always give me the best upgrades. They always remember what kind of room I like (note rooms on 19-21 are quieter because they are so high up) and the turn down lady never fails to give me at least 3 chocolates! The only thing about this hotel is that it is in such high demand that reservations book quickly! So book far in advance if you want to get a room :)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: AAlyeshmerni
Reviews.Content: This was the ideal boutique experience with the benefit of Starwood points! The hotel is ideally nestled amongst some of the best restaurants in town and conveniently distanced from all of my favorite neighborhoods and retail that are MUST HIT types of spots. The rooms are spacious, the hotel stylish and clean, and the hotel staff was amazing- the maid even wrote me a thank you note for her tip!!! Since I am a creature of habit when I travel (which is often) this is my new favorite hotel. I'll be back over and over again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Hot Spot, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: bebe2x
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've been to! Perfect presentation - amazing ambiance, great vibe, always welcoming. The W Union Square Living Room is a great place for drinks and socializing, the Olives Restaurant is AMAZiNG and the front desk is super accommodating. The rooms are perfect: modern, clean, relaxing. Love watching the W TV station as well!

Reviews.Title: “We always look forward to staying here.”
Reviews.Author: gpointer
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the W Union Sq. a number of times, we always find all of our needs met here. The levels of comfort , care and helpfulness are superb. When we've requested a park view room(if available), we've received one. The location suits us better than any other hotel in New York. We are in walking distance of the majority of things we like to do while visiting. It used to be, we stayed in midtown and spent 90% of our time away from where we stayed. We hope to return to the W Union Sq. many more times. Use the web site to check in advance special rates and promotions. This has always worked in our favor. R. Andrews

Reviews.Title: “Nelson and Eddie are absolutely the best hosts ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cheet35
Reviews.Content: Nelson and Eddie made my stay at the W in NYC an unforgetable experience. They made sure we had everything we needed from transportation, advice on attractions, restaraunts ext. The rooms were the best I've ever stayed in on my numerous trips to the City. The staff was courteous and helpful, I will stay here on every trip back and recommend it to everyone. Thanks again Nelson and Eddie, you guys are the best!! Jeff Devlin Ft. Lauderdale, FL

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Experience”
Reviews.Author: sandals144
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience staying at the W Union Square. Throughout my stay Nelson and Eddie were always there to greet or help me in any way they could. The rooms were very clean and cozy. It was easy to get anywhere we needed as well staying at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Between the amazing service and the five star hotel, it made our trip incredible!”
Reviews.Author: SFL3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend where I planned for my friends and family to help celebrate my engagement to my long time girlfriend. I cannot begin to express how delighted the guests were with this hotel and the service. From the second we checked in to the last second when we left, the employees treated us like family. At the front desk, Eddie Ruiz and his partner Nelson did anything and everything in there power to make our stay beyond enjoyable. Every employee should strive to deliver the kind of customer service that these two gentleman delivered to our group. Overall, every employee that we encountered was very helpful and showed pleasure in doing so. The hotel design was gorgeous along with the location and cleanliness being second to none. The W at Union Square is the best hotel I've stayed in NYC period!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SocalAlliance
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the W for four nights last weekend and it was amazing. The hotel took care of our every need. The lounge, room, bar etc was first rate. I was especially impressed with Eddie and Nelson were extremely helpful and they made the trip extra special for us! PS. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel with great service that realy cares about their guests.”
Reviews.Author: DLDuffy
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to New York for the weekend for her 40th b'day and called the hotel two days before to let them know that's what we were coming for. When we arrived the hotel gave us a complimentary upgrade to a larger room. Having stayed in New York before I wasn't expecting what we walked into, a HUGE corner rooom overlooking Union Sqaure. We went out for dinner and came back to find a bottle of champagne with two incredible cupcakes and chocolate covered strawberries. The next day we went out and came back to find a beautiful bouquet of flowers. The hotel made it a truly memorable experience. The hotel is located right next to Union Sqaure steps from the subway making it easy to get anywhere you might want to go and you don't need to go far. There are plenty of great restaurants (Olive's is in the hotel and highly rated) and shopping. The bar downstairs looks out onto Union Square and Park Ave and has great drinks at more then reasonable prices for New York. The concierge called Whatever Whenever deserves it's name, they got us reservations at a very popular restaurant 4 hours before we wanted to eat after we called and were told they were booked. The staff is always aiming to please with a smile and a friendly greeting from whoever you speak to. The rooms are clean, fresh and well appointed with bliss bath products a large flat sceen tv and iPod docking station. There are a few hotels that I like to stay in when coming to the city but after my experience here, my next trip back will be to the W Union Square!

Reviews.Title: “welcoming, comfortable, quiet and exceptionally customer-oriented”
Reviews.Author: intrepid888
Reviews.Content: I am a senior executive with a global company, and travel extensively. I have had the pleasure of staying at the W Union Square for quite a few years. I am quick to ensure I get a reservation here for my frequent visits to NYC as I know their quiet and attractively furnished room will meet my expectations, as will the exceptional service of all staff members. The front desk staff (Willy, Magy, Indiana, Nelson, Christoph, and others) remember me and make me feel like I'm at my second home. The management team are also very attentive to customer needs, and as a discerning traveller, I really appreciate it. The fitness center is of a high quality, with great equipment kept in perfect maintenance. I often have business meetings at Olive's restaurant in the lobby, which has excellent cuisine. I think very highly of this exceptional hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, room and service”
Reviews.Author: PMRBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W hotel in Union Square over the Thanksgiving weekend. The W had excellent service which only added to an outstanding hotel and room. The lobby becomes a social gathering for locals and tourists at any hour of the day. The staff were always very accommodating. The room was extremely clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, Trendy, Professional Service, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: FreqTrav247
Reviews.Content: I stay here every week for work and wouldn't stay anywhere else in NY. The Union Square area is fabulous for food, shopping, walking through the park, people watching. The front desk and concierge staff is fabulous and can help locate interesting restaurants and things to do in the area. For NY, the hotel rooms are very spacious. Room service is quick and always top quality. If you're into night life, the bar is "the place" to hang out with friends or meet new ones!

Reviews.Title: “Accept No Substitutes”
Reviews.Author: FortyWeeks
Reviews.Content: The W, Union Square has an energy unique to NYC. The hotel is filled with people and amenities there to make your trip perfectly comfortable and easy. The rooms are spacious - certainly for NY and well appointed. The bedding is inviting and plush and the Bliss skincare is a great plus! The public spaces are ideal for drinks, impromptu meetings and generally hanging out! The light filled "living room" is a perfect place to collect your thoughts, connect with others and plan your time in NYC. The location is also another big plus....Union Square is perfectly situated no matter what your plans. This lively neighborhood offers great food, shopping and just wandering. I literally have not stayed in another hotel in YEARS!

Reviews.Title: “i will stay here every time I'm in New York...”
Reviews.Author: lolapujols
Reviews.Content: We were met with a very cheerful and helpful staff and everything was awesome; the room, the decor.. we knew instantly we had made the right decision with the hotel. Everything we could have wanted we had in our room, or it was brought it us. We've been to New York hundreds of times but this place made it a completely different experience and we will probably never stay at a different place if at all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: truenorthtraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest at the W Hotel in Union Square, NYC and I consider this to be one of the best hotels in the world. I initially chose this hotel because I work in the neighborhood yet live in another state and proximity was important. I continued to stay because soon after my first few stays, I realized that this hotel's staff understood how to care for their guests. And I am not referring to special programs or offers - I am talking about hotel employees who understand the value of caring for hotel guests to make everyone feel welcome and comfortable. The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfy, and there is plenty of space compared to other NYC hotels. It's been five years and many hotels have opened since but I will never leave the W in Union Square.can never underestimate the loyalty that this brand has for its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: BCEagle1999
Reviews.Content: I have been a weekly guest at the W Union Square New York and the high level of service has been exemplary and unparalleled to like priced hotels in the area. I would highly recommend staying here above all other W's in New York.

Reviews.Title: “The location can't even make up for what I'm about to say.....”
Reviews.Author: sinanissimo
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I'm one of the most easygoing and calm people ever! I simply don't mind about small mistakes, BUT, this one was very very big! The hotels staff is simply very ghetto, rude and not classy at all... Here is briefly what happened; I had guests traveling all the way from Europe to NYC and they wanted to stay at this hotel. So, they made their reservations 2 weeks ago, received a confirmation letter and took the flight all the way to here...ONLY to be told by the front desk upon their arrival that their card was declined..Doesn't sound "that" abnormal, right ? Well, this was a PREPAID reservation (which means, at the time of the reservation they charge you!) and they got a confirmation e-mail welcoming them to the hotel (extra fancy as they were Platinum Starwood Preferred Guest members). And, the very very very very unprofessional and very uneducated annoying front desk clerk literally said "Oh, that's not my problem sir! They should have checked their credit card balance everyday!".. This is W Hotel at Union Square, not a $50/night student motel in Bronx! And, when I asked why weren't they notified at the time of the reservation or during the TWO WEEK period between the reservation and their arrival about this decline issue, the annoying front desk supervisor gave me a very simple answer "Oh we don't do that! We can't deal with all the customer's card issues!"... Yes, you let them fly 10 hours to New York City and tell them that their card is declined and not even apologize for your attitude... When I asked to the other front desk clerk "How many managers do you have at this hotel ?" With a very rude tone, he said "We have several". Then I asked "How many and who are they ?", he unbelievably replied; "I SAID SEVERAL, OK ?!"... My guests are people who stay in many different Starwood Hotels all over the world (including W Hotels in US and abroad) and again, they had high-balanced Starwood Preferred Guest Cards and a freaking confirmation letter! Yet, this terrible and unbelievably unprofessional attitude.. I simply cannot believe it... The much reasonably priced hotel I was staying two blocks away (Hotel Giraffe) had amazing staff, despite its price. And, when I called all the necessary people about this, they weren't much helpful and one representative guy on the phone literally said "So what do you want ?! Free nights or something?" And, I learned that out of all of the W Hotels in NYC, only the Union Square one is INDIVIDUALLY OWNED! Which probably explains it.. So, make yourself a favor; save your couple of grand and get a different W Hotel or a different hotel in Manhattan!... This is a mistake that shouldn't have been done in the first place for an 8-night reservation for foreign travelers, let alone not apologizing for it on top of the ghetto attitude...

Reviews.Title: “Another great W Hotel, but so expensive”
Reviews.Author: cookieworm
Reviews.Content: This a great W Hotel, in a fabulous location on Park Avenue. But at over $700 a night (with internet $20 a day on top), it's difficult to be upbeat. Nice rooms, modern as is the W way, and very helpful trendy staff. I was staying on a business trip, so the bill wasn't painful personally, but I can't say that it is worth that price. Shame really, otherwise it has everything going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Pity we could only stay one night but were treated like long time patrons”
Reviews.Author: TravelerVA2008
Reviews.Content: The front desk put up with my frequent calls asking where they were (as my cars GPS kept putting us in mid town) and when we got there late evening, raining, cold, David the doorman took great care of us and the SUV. The room was spectacular, the front desk was attentive, wish we could have spent more time there. Doorman turned us onto Sushisamba were we had a delectable meal. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl_5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for me and my boyfriend. It was located directly across from Union Square and allowed us to easily walk either downtown or uptown. There's a subway station directly across the street too. I've stayed at many W Hotels and rate this one highly compared to others. The room was spacious with very big windows. The fitness center was great too. We'll stay here again for sure. My only complaint was that you had to pay to use the computers in the business center. We were just hoping to check-in and print off our boarding passes but couldn't do so without paying for an hour of online time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: fluffywhitekitty
Reviews.Content: The W Union Square is a great hotel. It has a small lobby but there is some seating in the bar area adjacent to Olives Restaurant, which is also part of the hotel. We had lunch and a dinner at Olives (a Todd English restaurant- we actually saw him there the night we had dinner!) - cool design and the food was great. Because we were staying for a business meeting, we had a regular room which was on the small side but it was beautifully decorated. I would ask for a room with a window to the street. We had two windows that looked on to an alley and it always felt dark in the room- may not bother others but it bothered me. It's diagonally across the street from the Union Square Greenmarket which offers local produce & goodies several days a week in the pretty Union Square. This is also a great location. We never had a problem getting cabs. Good shopping nearby- a huge 5-story Barnes & Noble, Sephora, Geox, Filene's Basement, Whole Foods...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel + Great Location = A Perfect Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CMW76
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late in posting as my trip was back in July, but I just wanted to finally post something on Tripadvisor, so here it is! Stayed at the W with my fiancee for a weekend getaway and we were both very happy with our experience. When we walked into the hotel, we really liked the atmosphere of the lobby and even the scented candles they used. The service was good. Everybody we came across was professional and friendly. I booked a Wonderful Room which we were quite happy with. It was very clean and we loved the look of the room. Another reason why the W is a great place to stay is because of the location. I always enjoy going to Union Square, and it was even better during this trip because when we walked out of the hotel the next morning, we walked right into a huge street fair that stretched down for a couple of blocks. We didn't know anything about it, so it was a nice surprise. We spent the next couple of hours checking out the booths, shopping, eating, and then made the short walk back to the hotel to rest, and then dinner and a movie later that evening, also just walking distance away. I would definitely recommend staying at the W Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice lobby but something was missing for a **** hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucybelle1
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my wife for 4 nights at the hotel. It is a nice hotel with an excellent location. I thought it was a little expensive for what we got. Most 4* hotels will offer internet for free in the room and here we had to pay, though you can get free internet in the lobby. The gym was OK but had only treadmills and stationary bikes, no other machines (just some free weights). I was expecting a gym with a view to the park, but I was dissapointed. The bar area and the restaurant were nice and the service excellent. The rooms were average size but I assume they are big for NY. One complaint: there was a food tray left over the hallway for two nights and nobody picked it up until I told the service...

Reviews.Title: “Smart location”
Reviews.Author: Marquez
Reviews.Content: A friend and I met in NYC for the weekend. Our goal was to shop in Soho (mainly) and enjoy some great meals. We chose the W Union Square based on location and the fact we could find a relatively large room with two double beds. Our "mega" room was well-sized and comfortable. Two areas for improvement: 1. Our 4th floor room was pretty noisy at night...with construction. 2. The bathroom amenities did not include Q-Tips, cottonballs, etc. The good stuff: 1. Love the Bliss body products. Loved that the housekeeper kept replenishing them! 2. Location was perfect for wandering the Union Square green market, walking to Soho (about 15 minutes), taking a cab up to midtown, etc. 3. We needed a disposable razor and a pair of scissors...the whatever/whenever service brought both items up within 15 minutes. 4. The airline check-in kiosk in the front lobby was a bonus. 5. Doorman recommended a great coffee shop nearby for breakfast called 71 Irving. Amazing Hudson Valley farm roasted coffee and fresh baked goods. I would definitely return with a friend or hubby.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever! There was blood on my sheets! Absolutely disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: S1028
Reviews.Content: I went to my room around midnight and I was turning down the sheets and there was BLOOD on the sheets! I wouldn't even expect to see that in a motel let alone a "nice" hotel. That is absolutely unacceptable! I don't know if they don't change the sheets? Or if they don't the sheets? Or if maybe someone got cut and was too lazy to change the sheets ...or what? I'm not sure what happened but I was disgusted. I called the front desk and the lady had told me that the manager had stepped out, but she would send someone to change the sheets. The guy came up and threw the pillows ON THE FLOOR, and didn't even change the casing! I couldn't sleep at all I didn't even want to touch anything in that room. The next morning I just wanted to leave so we went downstairs and the man caring our luggage was the only person that worked at that hotel that showed us any hospitality. He asked us were we're going and we told him we were going to another hotel and asked why and I told him, well there was blood on our sheets. He said well you should definitely talk to a manager. We went back inside and waited for a manager to come out (who never came out). Apparently they didn't even put this incident in their nightly report...was it really that little? No one even apologized, they took a small percentage off the bill to compensate. Absolute nightmare, I wouldn't recommend going there at all...in face I'd warn you before you go!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid W Hotel Union Sqare at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Lalique78
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W New York Union Square. As a Preferred Gold Member, I am extremely disappointed. First of all, the room was very tired and dirty. I had to request 4 times for a roll-away to be brought up to my room. The staff at the reception desk were very rude as well when I inquired why I had to request the roll-away 4 times. The Ice machine on the 7th floor did not work, and the delivery person was rude when they had to bring ice up to the room. We requested Champaign glasses, and they brought tumbler glasses and stated that they didn’t have any left. The elevator took 20 minutes to get us in the morning. The over-all property was very tired and dirty. I asked for 2 glasses of orange juice in the morning, and they brought up 2 tiny glasses of orange juice, and charged me $27.00!!!! Again, they were very rude when delivering. My cordless phone did not work at all, and my attempts to rectify this were ignored. We arrived before 3 Pm on September 5th, and the front desk said that they would call as soon as my room was ready. They never called me; as a SPG Gold member, I have never been treated like this. I used a lot of my points to stay here, and I am completely disgusted that this would even be a W property!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay and still fabulous”
Reviews.Author: HavHun65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I organised a 'long weekend' trip to NYC for ourselves and friends from the UK. I recommended the W on Union Square as I had stayed there before a loved it. I was happy to say we all loved the experience. Yes, it is pricy but you can get a good deal if you look (we did) and I did feel it was worth the money for the location, friendly helpful staff, AWESOME bed and comfy welcoming bar/lounge. I think the W Union square feels more like a boutique hotel than a large chain hotel. I will stay there again even if I save my pennies to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Putting the W in Wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustland
Reviews.Content: The W Union Square in New York is a little piece of Wonderful in the city that never sleeps. From the moment I arrived till my reluctant check out, I was engaged by the personable staff and treated in a very respectful but casual superstar manner, made me feel a million bucks! From the moment the yellow taxi pulled up from JFK, I was greeted in a very James bond fashion by the staff. “Welcome to The W Union Square Mr. V” (not my real name :) ), we’ve been expecting you and very glad you chose to stay with us.” All that was missing was a red carpet. It was the eve of Halloween and upon arriving at the front desk with bags in tow, the front desk agent immediately acknowledged and recognized my elite status with the Starwood group and promptly and efficiently checked me in and explained only the need to know information, painless and all the while engaging me in conversation and she keyed away on the keyboard. “What are your plans for the evening?” and there you go, I had a list of things to do for the evening and all, I realized the morning after my first night’s stay were excellent choices even tho' my head might have been a little hazy, just a little. I had a blast that night with Strawberry Shortcake and huckleberry pie. Oh by the way, I ended up staying at the front desk for almost 20 mins Chatting with this very engaging, professional and knowledgeable staff of The W Union Sq. My room was plush, spacious and most importantly, felt like home. I had on 3 of the 5 evenings hosted friends before heading out for nights on the town. The bar at the hotel is attracts a motley crew of the usual suspects, hipsters and wannabes. The bed to this day, is the most comfortable I have ever slept in! Casual, inviting and engaging. The price a night will set you back a little but if you have a little cash to splash, it’s well worth a stay. Depending on which area you like to play while in New York, if you are there to play that is. It was not the closest to my usual haunts but definitely worth the commute. Thank you To Caitlin for booking me in here and to The W Union Sq and staff for a very pleasant stay and for making hospitality uncomplicated, casual, engaging and breezy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & rude reception at hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry5678
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I booked the W Union Square at hotels.com and received an attractive price for a 2 night stay. We booked a King room with a rollaway bed (for 3 adults). When we arrived at the hotel, they claimed to not have a room available per our request. They blamed it on hotels.com (they said that hotels.com shouldn't have allowed that category of king room to have a rollaway bed). In lieu of what we had booked (and paid for in advance), the front desk offered us a king bed only. He said that all 3 of us could sleep in the bed! We politely declined this 'offer,' upon which he countered by offering us the 'best he could do' - a double room on the smoking area. He said that was all they had, and to take it or leave it. We agreed to look at the smoking room, but after getting off the elevator on the smoking floor (it stank), and opening the door to the smoking room,( it also stank and had a huge brown stain on the carpeting), we decided we couldn't bear to be in that room for 2 nights. We went back down to the front desk to let them know we couldn't stay in the smoking room, and they told us to call hotels.com and ask for a refund, then start finding other accommodations! They said they were totally booked that night and that others were walking in off the street looking for rooms. It appears that the hotel wanted to 'sell' our fairly inexpensive room to 'off the street' travelers willing to pay the full retail price. When we told them we were unable to reach hotels.com (we hung up on after being on hold for 20 minutes), we asked for a W Hotel manager. After another 15 minute wait, they miraculously had an opening of a king room with a rollaway bed. That is exactly what we had originally booked at hotels.com! All this nonsense took an hour and a half! When we finally got to our room, it was adequate. We were, however, quite displeased at the service at the hotel's front desk. They acted as if they had no relationship with hotels.com!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel is sooo already past century”
Reviews.Author: XLhehe
Reviews.Content: Perfect location but... Horrible posh staff at front desk, smiling optional. So I liaised during all my stay during the concierge who really found me nice adresses and knows the city... W Hotel sound to me already past century, no doubt was great and trendy in the nineties but now a little but already outdated. Fitness and business center in a tiny basement without windows. What I hated was no real lobby But a bar packed with conventions of working class heroes. Had to stand up every evening to check my emails as the only free wifi was in this area. Overall super Nice location and ok but if you look to thé wow factor promises by W you might be deceipted. Thé hôtel itself cannot be blâmée as i t is thé global concept. NeXT stay in nyc: gramercy hôtel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, But small rooms”
Reviews.Author: LovesTheBahamas08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting our family in Brooklyn. This is The W- So obviously it was clean and comfortable. Location is great. The rooms are small however. Staff was great, everything was perfect as planned. If you can afford it, I definately reccomend it. If you are traveling with a large family and/or plan to spend alot of time in your room, and want spacious accomodations, I would try a hotel in either a different part of the city, or stay out near the JFK or La Guardia hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good for some, bad for others?”
Reviews.Author: johnnysurfer
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I usually write really graphic interpretations of the hotels I stay at, but in this case I will just give the meats and potatos. The W is a very stylish, swanky, chic place to chill. I am not big on the whole "hip scene" in my hotel. I like to go out and have fun, but come back to a chilled out place. The W is very funky. I say "Form over function" describes this place best. If you like this scene, stay here. It is quite cool. Here are my key points. 1. The bar scene here is tight. Hot chicks dressed in black. With a good fake job and some cash you could pull off the Gorden Gecco move and feel like the king of NY. 2. The hotel is very old, and it shows in some spots. The elevators are a horror show. We had to take the stairs. 3. Michelle Obama was in the room next to me so security was a problem. It slowed down the flow of the hotel. It caused elevator backups. Police dogs on the halls, the whole kit and kaboodle.... 4. I love food. For my conference they had a catered macaroni and cheese bar. Now that sounds silly, but it was pure awesome. period. The best comfort food/meal I had in a year. Full on chef making crazy mac and cheese. I would go back for that. If this isn't your scene hit the Waldorf, if not, hit the bar, find the guy who made the mack and cheese and put on your gecco shirt.

Reviews.Title: “Love the W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deeann622
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying at this hotel. The rooms here are on the larger side (than most NYC and W hotels standards). After being out and about, I have always enjoyed having a fruit infused water in the lobby/check in area, simple idea, but so refreshing. Bathrooms are spacious and love using the bliss products. Our room was not quite ready when we checked in, but they were very accommodating with storing our luggage and ringing us if it becomes available. The location is perfect for taking in the city sights. Meatpacking, Soho are all close to the hotel. Subway is on the other side of Union Square, so you can be almost anywhere in the city with a short trip on the subway. Green Market (Farmer's Market) is always fun get fresh bread and relax on the bench. I have gone next door to the deli/market to pick up food when I did not want to mess with going out and just having dinner in. There is also Trader Joe's, Whole Foods and several other markets within walking distance too if you need to pick up a few essentials. Every visit to this hotel, I have had dinner/drinks at Olives (located next to the lobby of the hotel). Food and service is excellent and I always enjoy the cheese plate. I actually prefer staying on this side of town, a little more mellow than midtown. Our room was on a lower level this time around and the noise was a concern because I'm a light sleeper. However, it was not bad and did not have any trouble sleeping, thanks to the heavenly bed. I can't wait for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Brilliant Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay. This was our fist tip to NYC and we loved it ! Our "wonderful" room was on the 16th floor. Very spacious (compared to a London hotel) the most comfortable king size bed, no noise from the street or other rooms. Lovely bathroom, was great to have a shower in the morning with sun streaming through the glass brick wall. Hot water did take a while to warm up. There was no safe in the room when we arrived but this was soon sorted. Well stocked minibar and snack box but well over priced. Better of buying beer etc. from the deli next door. Union Square is a great base. Always something going on in the park, markets, street entertainers etc. and right next to a subway station. 5 mins walk to Flatiron & the village and about 30 to times square. Lots of bars and restaurants in the area. Sidebar round the corner from the hotel had a good happy hour (2 beers $5) Few mins from the Fillmore where we went to see a live band.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: Dallas Traveling Banker
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on free points. I was allowed to check in early, upgraded and to a corner room that was a little larger. Pete's tavern is around the corner, short walk to Chelsea, Soho, The Village and so many great areas. Major subway stop in Union Square, just accross the street. There is a deli next door if you just want to pick up something quick. Staff was friendly and the lady that checked me in remembered me when I went back to the front desk the next day with a question. Bedding and bathroom were great, usualy W standards.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bailey_Inky
Reviews.Content: Although it's not in Time's Square, this is a great location. Very close to the subway (which is always a plus) and great restaurants. Our room was facing out towards Filene's Basement, DSW, Whole Foods and the Union Square Park. Our room was large and the bathroom was a nice size too. The beds are very comfortable and the staff was great. My only complaint was that the windows were very thin. We heard all of the construction, garbage men, and cars honking all through the night. Other then that, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again. It is a very convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed - would stay there again though not a favorite”
Reviews.Author: WendyAM
Reviews.Content: I was going to New York on business and booked a room for me and another room for members of my family who tra velled with me. The check in process was quick - though I wasn't keen on having to pay up front for the rooms at booking several weeks before. When I got out of the elevator, I didn't like the look of the corridors - the dark carpet looks grim and grubby but I think it's just part of the look they're aiming to achieve. The rooms were good - huge bed, very comfortable. Well equipped bathroom (well, shower room), with good toiletries. As with most hotel rooms these days, if you wanted any light you had to turn all the lamps on - the curtains were tricky to pull open or shut behind the desk. Only there one night but I found it perfectly good. I am not sure about the location - for my work it was fine, but for a tourist, it's a long drag up to Times Square or down to Battery Park. When I had to call ahead to ask the concierge to get my bags ready for me to pick up en route to the airport, I was left on hold for about ten minutes which was maddening - but they got the bags ready for me to pick up by the time the cab got there a few minutes later. One thing which irritated me was when I was pulling up outside, trying to pay the cabbie, a guy who didn't look like a doorman pulled open the cab door. Startled the hell out of me. Was wearing a dark shirt and a baseball cap - for a moment I thought he wanted to get into the cab I was getting out of and it threw me completely. I'm afraid I wasn't particularly courteous to him - I feel the doormen should be dressed a little smarter and at least say "Welcome to the W Hotel" if they open a cab door. All in all - pretty happy with the stay - would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Depends.”
Reviews.Author: mcnuttle
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews below after my recent stay, I can understand why some would complain... We were here to celebrate a friend's 50th, and if we ended up with the first room they brought us to, for the b-day boy, I would have been really upset. But... lucky for us, they gave him a room already occupied, with someone in the shower! The bellman's said "oops.. we need to get you another room, especially for the guest of honor. This is the type of room people stay in for one night, just passing through." (It was in the rear/side corner and incredibly dark) Upgrade to a top floor corner room with views. Very nice. And all of our other rooms were impressive, too--very spacious with oversized windows. All bathrooms were huge and nicely appointed. I think the key is to face Union Square on an upper floor. Problem is, not sure you can insure you get those rooms. So I guess it depends on which room you get, whether you'll love it or not. Agree with other comments about the doormen, front desk, and concierge. Poor attitude. Very UNhelpful. Too bad, they make the first and lasting impression at a hotel. The bar is great. Lively. Great drinks. Only drawback is the limited seating and the A/C blasting. Had way too much fun there...!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but price paid was not equal to service and quality”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the W Union Square. Booked in with the Starwood free weekends promotion so only paid for two of the nights. That said, I felt the stay wasn't worth paying two nights at the 450 dollar rate, much less four. This was my first visit to New York City so I have no other hotels to compare it to but when I have stayed with the Starwood brand at St Regis for half the price I've been treated much better and the accommodations have been nicer. Location: Union Square was a great location. Honestly, I choose to stay with Starwood on this trip because I had earned two free weekend nights and I choose this W because of the location in Union Square. Doorman: These folks were not a very welcoming bunch. I guess I'm just not a hip enough chick for them. I finally got so fed up with the attitude, especially that of Frankie, that I spoke with the manager, if for nothing else but to make me feel better. I don't appreciate getting treated like scum of the Earth. I would ask about the house car and he'd be put out. I'd ask for a direction and he'd be put out. I'd ask if we could get a cab and he'd say sure and motion to the street. he was horrible, but the others were indifferent. Checkin: Was the quickest ever. Just need to see id and credit card, here's your key. No nicey nice-no do you know your way around....nothing. When I was at St Regis Monarch beach last week not only did I pay half the price, even with free nights, but the staff were welcoming and a doorman led me to the room and helped me with my bags. Room: I had called ahead and asked for a quiet room. My husband is a Gold member and we were upgraded to the third tier of rooms-not a suite, a corner room on the 18th. It was quiet the first two nights but the hotel was full on the weekend and you could hear the guests in the room next to us, people talking in the hall, etc. You could also hear tv's, hair dryers, etc. The room was a good size but it was pretty basic. There was nothing special about the bed. I even looked under the sheets and it was just a regular mattress. The sheets were better than standard. The desk and bedside table both had a sticky substance on them. Bathroom: This was quite standard. I was very disappointed with the towels-they were like grungy old gym towels, not luxury or fluffy. There was only one robe so I had to call down and ask for one for my husband. I have a huge pet peeve when there is not soap for both the sink and the bath as was the case. I called down and requested another bar and it was left in the room. They were very stingy with the Bliss bath products. There were two of us and they only gave little bottles once a day. Now it was very hot in New York City. I'd take a shower to get ready in the morning, rinse off at mid day and then shower before bed. We never had enough product but they never replendished at night. WiFi-I'm so sick of WiFi charges in rooms. For the price I paid it should be free! I did go down to the lobby, or as W calls it the living room, and got on the free WiFi. Lobby Bar-I think this is still the part they call the living room. We did have tasty tator tots and drinks there. And the server was nice. HUGE plus! Whenever/Whatever: Or as I like to call it, What a joke. Any time I called they acted like I was putting them out. And I didn't even ask for a bathtub of hot chocolate as the silly W ad states. I just needed simple things, like a toothbrush since I left one behind, a bar of soap for the sink, security to quiet my rowdy neighbors so I could have a decent night sleep, a wakeup call. All in all, the location was great but I wouldn't stay at this property or probably any other W again. I don't need people reminding me that I'm not hip and cool. In fact, I'm prefectly happy that I'm not their target consumer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: braziltropical
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W with my husband and 14 month old for three days over a recent weekend. I used to live in NY and so was familiar with Union Square, and so selected the W because of its location, which is fantastic. In the area there are great restaurants of all price ranges, from Olives in the hotel lobby, to the food bar immediately next door, to the street vendors selling halal food and fruit. The staff was quite nice, friendly and very helpful. The hotel was modern and trendy like all the Ws. The bar seemed to be a happening spot. The rooms were quite large in comparison to the normal NYC hotel room. The bathroom was also sizable, the beds comfortable, and there is a DVD player and great I-pod docking station with a stereo that has good sound. I loved the Bliss Spa products in the hotel room and the apples and free coffee in reception. My complaints are as follows: a really dark hotel, trendy does not mean that it needs to be dark. We were on the 15th floor with a view to Park Ave South but it was still dark even with the curtains open. No cotton balls, shower caps, etc in the bathroom. They probably would have given it to me if i had asked but i didnt bother. Only one bath robe in the room, even though it is a double. For the first two days there was no garbage can in our bathroom, which was annoying. Again, if i had asked they probably would have brought one. It took them forever to bring us a crib for our daughter. These are nitpicky things, but overall we had a great stay and i like the hotel. My mom is going to stay there in july based on my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “W is just as great the second time”
Reviews.Author: BB4th
Reviews.Content: I wrote a long review in winter of last year, but having taken a trip to NYC this past week and stayed at the W Union Square again, I wanted to review it again to say it was just as great the second time. We were originally going for one night and had gotten a great rate, and decided to go down a day early. The hotel extended the great rate to us for the additional night as well, even at the very last minute. Once again, the staff was personable, helpful, and professional, and our two dogs were treated great as well. Having the dogs, I usually ask that our room not be cleaned since our dogs are older and someone being there would make them nervous. So when I travel at hotels I try to catch one of the maids to do a towel exchange, etc. At so many other hotels, when I do that I sometimes feel as though they are nickel and diming me like, "So you are giving me two bath towels back, three glasses, and you need just shampoo?" At the W, the maids just brought me a whole new set of towels and amenities, without trying to do an "even exchange". I actually had way too many towels and left the unused ones on the bench, but I'm sure they probably had to wash them all again, but they weren't concerned. It was so nice that they just make that so easy and smooth. The only hard part with having our dogs (and this has nothing to do with the hotel) is that Union Square park is really busy in the summer, and so it wasn't great to take them there during the day. (The park has a dog run but my dogs being older don't do well with other dogs). So we did find a much smaller area that had some trees about three blocks away. I think it's a challenge in any park in NYC (except Central Park) where the dogs aren't really allowed on the grass. My country dogs had to get used to being city dogs for a couple days, which was an adjustment! :) It was fun to see all the vendors lined up in Union Square Park this time of the year, and again, the W was just a perfect hotel for luxurious comfort, style, and attentive staff. I recommend it now to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Enormous Room”
Reviews.Author: HouseFairy
Reviews.Content: Most hotels in Union Square are out of budget for our travels to NYC. When the "W" offered a Pay-2,Stay-3 discount, we jumped. Union Square is such a fun area - with open-air markets all year round; Whole Foods, DSW, and tons of great, affordable dining. This hotel is casual but sophisticated, the staff was phenomenal, and the room was elegant and enormous by NYC standards. Beds get A+ for comfort and for beauty. The bathroom was OK. Sink had adequate storage beneath, and superb amenities, including plenty of towels. The shower gets a solid "B": awesome water pressure and shower head, and it drained like a champ - but the stupid polyester shower curtain wants to cling to the occupant. Yuk. Can't wait until they have another 3-for-2 offering. We'll go back. Maybe by then they'll have installed arc shower rods!

Reviews.Title: “Do not bother, bad location, staff rude”
Reviews.Author: Deb70
Reviews.Content: Staff not very friendly it was like they treated you as you were not good enough to stay there. Rooms tiny no room for suit case. Rooms tiny for New York standard. A big TV at the end of the bed which give you a headache as too big for the room. bathroom was tiny too small to get dressed in there. My friends room they could not even walk past the end of the bed no room and the bathroom door was hanging off. Overpriced for what you got. bad location. better at the wellington hotel which has a better location, prcie , frienlt and good room size. We were only at the W 1 night then went to the Wellington I am so glad we did not choose the W for the whole stay very disappointing as being part of the Sheriton group. It had trouble calling out in my room so I rang the front desk they saidf I do not know what is wrong and hang up. I went to my friends room and used there phone which was ok. they do not even have a public phone in the foyer you have to walk down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gkukreja
Reviews.Content: Wonderful bed, Amazing service and excellent food and beverage

Reviews.Title: “really dark rooms!”
Reviews.Author: autumnzena
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - excellent location but very dark! I know it is meant to be trendy - but it was really hard to see in the room! Good bar and breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice W”
Reviews.Author: born4hotels
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the W Union Square - probably my favoitre W in New York. The room was bigger than the W New York, which was nice. Bar had great drinks, and the staff was very friendly. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jane24104
Reviews.Content: After having searched for the last year or so, we have found our New York hotel and that is the W New York - Union Square. The staff are wonderful and extremely helpful, but also genuinely friendly, which made our stay a delight. The room was fine, it was comfortable and the location right on the square is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Hotel. Always Treated Well.”
Reviews.Author: pparasher77
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel to NYC, which is quite often, we always stay here. Since we are starwood members we always get uprgraded to a suite which is quite spacious for new york city hotels. Love the modern decor and bliss bath products. It is a little loud since it is in Union Square but that's city living. The restaurant Olive's is nice with a great bar scene. We travel withour 3 year old and have been happy with the agency they use for babysitting but it is pricey. Definately recomment.

Reviews.Title: “Promises Kept...Promises Broken”
Reviews.Author: TiredMom2D3JS
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a friend for a "girls" weekend. They used points for the hotel, so I cannot comment on the value, but, we were given amazing perks. W lived up to its promise. We were each given a huge goodie bag of Bliss bath products, in addition to the ones in the room already, FYI...the same would have cost about $50 @ Sephoria across the street. Than we went for a walk to Filene's Basement (yes the one that has the run of the brides). Upon our return there was a bottle of Sophia sparkling wine for us to drink (not to be greedy, but I wish there were snacks as well). The beds were amazing. Now, our only issue was they have a free Acura promise, but that night for some reason the Acura driver took off and never came back. I dont know why, but, no one had his cell number to find out why, nor were they consirned that he left with an Acura, go figure. All the same, the night was nice and we walked the 10 or so blocks to dinner. Oh, btw, the Acura returned the next morning and we were able to use it to go to the Empire State Building and later in the day to Penn Station. We did not eat there, as my friend wanted to eat brunch at Freind of a Farmer. So, I cannot comment on the food. There was one door man who was just as nice as could be (though I cannot remember his name) and another (heavy set gentleman who made it seem like we were a bother). We were granted late check out (4pm) and than they stored our bags for us while we went out to dinner. Again we ate off property at Rosa Mexicano. I wish I could have stayed longer, but, back to reality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jackeemd
Reviews.Content: Great location, room was big! A bit of a draft, so the room was a little cold, but all in all, really nice.

Reviews.Title: “W Union Square - not very Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dina4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many W hotels, dozens of times, and this particular visit was the only time we were met with so much disappointment. While the decor of the hotel was quite hip, and the location was very good, the service was really lacking. Here are some examples: -- We checked in at 6:30 pm after a long day of travel and our room was not ready!! it still hadn't been cleaned! -- The next day, we were gone from 9am until 5pm, and when we returned after a long day of sightseeing, our room had not been cleaned. -- turn down service was only offered once on a four-night stay. -- we had 2 non-smoking rooms, and of the rooms reeked of cigarette smoke. they kept saying they would put some kind of filter in it to clear it up, but they kept forgetting, and didn't do it until the 4th of day of our stay. -- we decided to eat breakfast one morning at the the hotel restaurant -- OLIVES. Six of us ordered cereals, granola, and bagels at 9:15 am. (nothing that to be cooked) I told the waiter we had to be OUT of the restaurant by 10, and at at 9:50 our food still had not arrived. When we complained, it came in shifts, and it was not even correct. -- the construction in Union Square began with jackhammers at 7am. it sounded like someone was tapping a fork really loud on your bedside table, and we were on the 17th floor!

Reviews.Title: “The most character of any W”
Reviews.Author: mikeyyz
Reviews.Content: A quick one-night stay with my wife to enjoy the winter in NYC - as an SPG Platinum member, I was thrilled to receive an upgrade to a nicely appointed, cozy, corner suite. I finally got to use the Acura service to get to breakfast, and had no questions asked for the late checkout I requested. I'd definitely stay here again over the W TS and certainly over the W on lex.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic suite!”
Reviews.Author: chloe78
Reviews.Content: I just came back from W ny union square. It was a fantastic experience. I stayed in a fantastic suite room which is quite expensive room for 6nights. As it costs, It was really really fantastic room! the room is large, devided into kind of 2 room with a beautiful bath room. the living room has 2 huge couch, 1 large confy chair, a large desk, a large flat TV and a large working dsk with a printer and a flower. the bed room has a flat tv and 1 king bed. there were large windows that I could look down union square in both room and the bathroom. I love the cafe in the street level,too. All the ppl staying there look very stylish as the hotel is:) Everything is perfect. all stuff are very helpful, friendly and nice! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Citris
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the W in Union Square we had a great experience. Everyone made our honeymoon so memorable. We were upgraded to an amazing suite, came back from dinner to a nice bottle of Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Vince at the front door was so awesome to deal with. He helped us get to the giants game by giving us directions on what trains and buses to take, make recommendations on how to get to places and even where we could buy beer. The room was huge and the bathroom very clean and large as well. We never heard anyone in the hallways, rarely did we ever even run into others staying on the floor. We will go back to NY for sure, and I`m almost certain we`ll stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the cost”
Reviews.Author: scscientist
Reviews.Content: Reservation was made for me by others. I was schocked at the price ( >$500 with tax even when prepaid via internet) and expected elegance . Checkin was efficient and mechanical. Room was adequate - but no larger than a standard Hampton-Holiday Inn, Sheration , etc. Decorated in modern chrome and wood. No in room coffee pot - but It did have an IPOD docking station - I do not have an IPOD. Desk was against the one window and therefore it was very difficult (impossible without moving the heavy desk) to open the drapes and look out on Union Square or get natural light into the room. BUT the real annoying aspect was not revealed until the morning when I took a shower - there was mold growing in everal places in the shower grout ! UGH! Also the toilet seat was not screwed tight - I fixed that . Should I have to do that I and have mold in the shower in a $500 per night hotel room.!!!!! I will not stay here again and will not reccomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this W, and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Almond66
Reviews.Content: I have tried to stay at this W before but it is often sold out or the prices get into the 600 dollar range and I know I can get more for my money elsewhere. I finally stayed here for the first time in August. I had a great stay start to finish. The front desk staff is awesome, very welcoming, and accomodating. As an SPG Gold member I got upgraded to a Mega Room. Room was a nice size and we even had a rollaway that fit fine. Only glitch was when the bachelorette party started with their stripper next door in the midst of an afternoon nap. We notified the hotel and they took care of it immediately. Security could be heard telling the women in the next room that if they had to come back that the group wouldn't be staying at the hotel much longer. The noise, hooping, and hollering stopped immediately. The rooms are beyond comfortable. The location was great. Could hop the subway to go anywhere easily. Tons of restaurants, bars, stores nearby. The hotel lobby bar is a great place to relax in the afternoon. Great people watching at night and if you like talking to strangers from around the world its a fun place to do it. If you want a high energy hotel with comfortable restful rooms in a great location.... I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All About Service”
Reviews.Author: ballmom15
Reviews.Content: When The Westin Times Square was completely booked, we were more than a little disappointed that we wouldn't be able to stay at our favorite hotel during our NYC visit. Upon a suggestion from one of the reservationists at the Westin, we booked into The W Union Square. From the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out, every staff member did their best to welcome and pamper us. Even when we threw a curve ball of requesting three rooms together and checking in early, they bent over backwards to accomodate us - calling us to update us on the status while we were out shopping; moving luggage out of three rooms while we were gone and into the three new rooms; making sure we were happy with the rooms once we returned from shopping. Great experience! Pros: Out of the traffic congestion; attentive staff; intimate, smaller hotel atmosphere; historic neighborhood Cons: Taxi or subway to get to most attractions vs. walking; city noise audible in rooms; chic bar adjacent to lobby so partying at nite, but not bothersome in your room

Reviews.Title: “Great but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: NicMTL
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in april 08. Hotel was booked for a business outing at 550$/night. Room was extremely well appointed and quite large, wonderful bathroom. Staff was nice and I really have no major complaints other than the price (which is probably not out of line for New York) but I don't feel it was really worth it. Pros: clean, luxuriously renovated rooms, competent staff. Cons: paying wifi (16$/day) and shampoo/soap... At 500$ + per night this W could offer a 2 ounce bottle of shampoo to their customers...

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed at the W”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer1Usa
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but feel compelled to after our horrible stay at the W. The first room they put us in smelled terrible, so they moved us to another room, which smelled fine. Later that night, a strong smell of cigarette smoke started wafting in through the air vents, despite our being on a non-smoking floor. The staff's first suggestion (at 10:30 pm) was for us to leave the room for half an hour while they "purified" the air. Ultimately, they moved us to another room, but it took about an hour for them to pull that together. Once we were settled in the new room at around 11:30 pm, the front desk called to say we had a package at the front desk that was going to be delivered to our room. Turns out it was not a package for us. Ten minutes later, we got another call saying that someone was coming to pick up the misdelivered package. When we got our bill, you can imagine how pleased we were to see that they not only didn't compensate us for any inconvenience, but they actually overcharged us for the room by $30 and charged us for movies we never ordered. Great location, but will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not your ordinary W”
Reviews.Author: raskinco
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the W. The hotel is not laid out like a normal W. It has more light and not the groovy ambiance of what I expect from W hotels. The location is great. Sort of in the center of Manhattan. Lots of restaurants and shops and a short walk to Greenwich Village. On Saturdays there is a green market at Union Square which is pretty amazing. The bar downstairs always seems to have a lot people. We had a mega room which is bigger than their standard room, so room size was not an issue. The first room we had was showing some wear an tear. We had to move because apparently some one had gotten sick on the carpet and the smell was lingering. The front desk was very nice and moved us immediately. Our second room was in very good condition. There was nothing spectacular about the decor. Very standard earth earth tones. The bed was very comfortable. We had no problems with the service and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “going back”
Reviews.Author: swingfully
Reviews.Content: best bed ever. pleasant new york staff. great location. well run. can't wait to go back for a third time!

Reviews.Title: “All hype. Nothing unique.”
Reviews.Author: agean007
Reviews.Content: We paid $469/night. The staff were polite. The rooms and lobby were relatively clean and small. There was nothing special about the decor in the rooms. No complimentary internet, coffee/tea in the room. However there was a complimentary juice dispenser with a stack of tiny little plastic cups (the kind you use to gargle with at the dentist) in the lobby. My friends whose rooms faced Union Square complained that it was too nosy and they couldn't sleep. Not worth it. It's all hype.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: VaTraveler62
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the W Union Square. We stayed two nights July 1 and 2. The staff was great. The bed was very comfortable and we had a nice view of Union Square. Construction noise on Union square started early, but we were up anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous lobby, tiny rom”
Reviews.Author: rubyslipper29
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I LOVE W Hotels! Everything about them (for the most part) is FABULOUS...the design, the decor, the lobbies are all chic, chic, chic. However, I was so dissapointed when I checked into my room at this property. My room was the tiniest thing known to man... I think it was designed for Papa Smurf. Now, I've traveled to NYC before, and I know all about the notoriously small hotel rooms there, but this prior knowledge did not prepare me for my stay at the W. Imagine a Queen size bed...now draw a line around it about 1 foot out from the bed (on all sides) and that's about how big the entire room was. Getting beyond the fact of its size, the room was very dimly lit and and just didn't seem to be welcoming or inviting at all. I REALLY wanted to like it though, but I just couldn't. Sorry W. I'm glad I only slept there for 2 nights. The saving grace here was the awesome Front Desk staff, the happening lobby bar scene each night and the amazing restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: kcrimson55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one Sunday night and were upgraded to a larger room upon our arrival. Not sure if this was because I'm an SPG member. The check-in area is relatively small, but they do have a nice seating area off to the side that ties in with the hotel bar. Check in was fast and friendly and you can play with the funky grass decor they've decided to spread around the check-in desk. We were near the top floor, and having stayed at other NYC hotels, the room size was generous. Nice bed, flat screen TV, large bathroom, clean. Really there were only 2 drawbacks: 1. Our view out both windows was blocked by a stone railing that went around the building. You had to stand on a chair to see over it. 2. Internet access was something like $14.95. In this day and age of free access at some much cheaper places, this was a drawback. We would certainly stay here again. Liked the location near Greenwich Village.

Reviews.Title: “Forgetful Staff. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paneristi
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Saturday morning and were lucky to get an executive check-in for the Mega Room, which was not SO mega.. but nice. Being able to check in at 7am was a HUGE plus for us, especially after our red-eye flight. My gf attempted to surprise me with champagne and strawberries 2x, but the ball was dropped both times and they forgot to bring it while we were out to dinner.. so they brought us 2 bottles of water.. big whoop. The maids never actually CLEANED our room. While they made our bed, every single glass/empty water bottle/champagne (that we had to go out and buy) was left. Our room was beginning to look like the aftermath of a frat house party. Only when I emptied the contents of our room into the middle of the hall, were they picked up. We were also constantly bothered by pestering maids, hotel staff and wake-up calls we didn't set up at 5am. They would stop by the room every 30 minutes.... ridiculous. It didn't end when we checked out. I left an expensive black belt in the room and when I returned home, I called to have it shipped to me.. but to my surprise, they didn't find anything in the room! I'm sure the maid's son just got a fine piece of leather. The location was great, staff not the sharpest tool in the shed, bartender from the bronx is awesome, extremely loud music from the bar SHOOK our room til 2am.. thank God we were up. I wouldn't stay here again.. I've had GREAT service at every other W, but this was the worst...by far.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: sageann
Reviews.Content: Considering the pricetag, we were disapponted in this hotel. The pluses were the courteous staff and the fact that the hotel was neat the clean. The hotel also required a room card to use the elevator. Not a bad securty measure. The bar located off the lobby served a really good white sangria The minus was that the room was quite small and not much of a view. The room was meant to house only one person not two. We had a difficult time moving around each other while getting dressed. There was only one comfortable chair in the room. The room only had a shower, no bath tub. This is definately not a kid friendly place. The lobby was also small and the seating seemed to be in constant use. The location is a good one during the day. Itis close to a number of NYU facilities. There have been some issues involing violence in Union square recently. The price to value ratio is the primary reason for the lower ranking If you are thinking about holding a catered event at the hotel, I would think twice. The event we attended had an open bar but not enough bartenders. The hor dov's were brought out on small plates that only held 12 hov dov's. They were passed around by the waiters. The waiters and their tiny little trays barely made it into the room before all of the food was grabbed up by the staving crowd. They also took a long time between bringing out additional plate of food. I gave the impression that the waiter may have been preparing the food. There were over 100 people attending the event, some were elderly. There was inadequate seating provided for older guests (people in thier 80's) . The food severed for dinner ranged from poor to adequate. An asparagus rissoto was a pasty lump and filet was nicely cooked but not very flavorful. The desert was OK but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: J2meLumi
Reviews.Content: As a first timer to the big apple, I wanted to be central to everything and Union Square was the place to be. RESERVATIONS/CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT: This is the worst part of my stay. There were some glitches were due to some circumstances, I had to postpone my stay from January to May. I had booked online via their website a deal where if you buy two nights you get the third free. Perfect! When I learned that I would not be able to make my original trip, I called the hotel---I had to call 10 times to get a manager--when I got a hold of the manager, they told me, no problem and moved my reservation. This was 4 months before my arrival. One week prior to arrival, I called to confirm my reservation. I was not anywhere in their system. I sat on hold for 30 minutes while they tried to find me. Finally, somehow, my starwood preferred guest program booked me under my maiden name. Fine, no big deal. I have a room over looking the park, right? I was assured I would. I called day of arrival to let them know my flight was delayed, but I would be there between 11-12 so to please hold me room. I was once again told no problem. When I arrived at 12am, I was told they were completely sold out and that I would in-fact not get my room. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I was tired and I said I didn't care, just put me in a room and we'll figure it out in the morning. I was assured that I would get compensated for my trouble because they did note that I had called and said I would be there. Upon check out, I checked my bill and saw no compensation and some other charges that I couldn't figure out. I spent a half hour at the front desk straightening out my bill, but finally got it squared away. ROOM: I had a mega room (on my second and third night) which is the largest below a suite. It was very large and spacious with views over looking the city below. (we were on the 19th floor). I didn't hear any street traffic or people in their rooms. Every once and a while I could hear people in the hallway, but only if they were loud. The bathrooms were very large with a separate tub and shower. The robes were soft and luxurious and there were bliss amenities. A large flat panel TV and a docking station for my ipod/iphone. The beds were comfortable and the linens were soft. The cleaning staff didn't bang on our door early in the morning, but we were out of our room by 10:30 am. *I was a little surprised to see that the hallways leading to the rooms were stained. This is the only part that I thought needed improvement* RESTAURANT/BAR: These were swanky and attached to celebrity names Todd English and Randy Gerber. The lounge area was always packed with those wanting to see and be seen. They poor stiff drinks, so be careful! I got tipsy pretty fast! The food at Olives was good. Ultra modern decor with white square plates, exotic plants, straight lines, crisp linens (you get the idea) we only ate breakfast there, but the service was great as was the food. Fresh baked bread for my toast. Warm eggs, crisp bacon. LOCATION: This is central to everywhere you want to be in NYC. You are close to Greenwich Village, Soho, East Village, Tribeca, the Meat Packing district and just a few stops on the subway to Times Square and Central Park. If you have time, go to Supper in the East Village, the best little Italian joint (It's cash only though) There is a Starbucks, Barnes & Noble, Whole Foods and everything you may possible need within a two block radius of the hotel. OVERALL: A great, comfortable stay and an even better location. Hopefully next time I come back I will not have the same problems with check in/check out. But, I would definitely come back and would recommend this hotel to hip, modern couples without children. I think the noise and loud music may be a little too much for families. They also allow dogs, if you need to travel with your pooch.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: travelerlucky13
Reviews.Content: When we got to the room it wreaked of cigarette smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. After complaining to the front desk, they claimed that the hotel was completely booked and they could not move us. They put a machine in our room while we were out at dinner that they claimed would clear out the bad smell. However, upon returning to the room, it was still terrible. Besides this, the air conditioning was broken in the room and the room was sweltering! The shower curtain had a weird yellow stain across it, and overall the room felt unkempt. We felt for all that we were inconvenienced we should have been compensated in some manner or been apologized to, but the W did not seem to care. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, but way too "urban hipster" for my taste.”
Reviews.Author: Lorispad
Reviews.Content: As hotels go the W is pretty good. I had a great experience with the staff, they were friendly and helpful without being either over officious or haughty. The room was ok - pretty clean, average room decor. My problem was with the overall atmosphere of the hotel. This is not somewhere to stay if you are there for business. The noise in the lobby was overwhelming; they blasted the most laughably horrid techno dance music at all hours, which was not particularly enticing when I had to wait for people in the lobby at 9am on Sunday. It wasn't at all enticing on Saturday night. It was just annoying. And the decor screams "trying too hard to look hip" - the whole design is just overdone. I met a friend of one of the designers while in town and got an earful about the "corset" lampshades in the lobby and I have to say that they were too subtle to even be noticed. Overall, the hotel looks like a mishmash of someone's idea of hip decor. The W designers just tried way, way too hard. The main problem most people have with all of the W hotels is the bizarre lighting. For some reason they like to keep their hotels dark. Dark lobby, dark hallways, dark rooms, dark, dark, dark. Again, this is not the place for a business trip, if the meeting-preventing lobby racket doesn't deter you, the gloom (sorry, mood lighting) probably will. This is not a place to get work done. I was in NY for pleasure, and I found this hotel really distracting and annoying. I just don't get what the hotel is going for: Why the calming lighting but loud jarring muzak blaring 24/7? Why the sweet little patches of grass on the front desk but nightmare before Christmas lights? And can we dust the DIY-looking flower lights in the lobby once in a while? And while the lights are dusted can we hose off the plastic plants? The whole lobby looks a little worn out from all the nighttime partying going on downstairs. If you ask me, you can go to a hundred other hotels in NY that won't cost as much and won't be as god-awful annoying. If you are a tourist, it really doesn't give you a "NY hotel" feeling, it feels like it could be anywhere. The closest similarity in overall design and feel that I've encountered was a hotel I stayed at in Berlin in the late 80s. - That's it! It's just like Berlin in the 80s!

Reviews.Title: “Will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: licampbe
Reviews.Content: I most recently stayed at the W in Union Square for a one night visit to celebrate my boyfriends birthday.
