I received the best customer service I have ever experienced from any hotel. The trip started with me working with guest services to do a few special things to the room before we arrived. The Hotel was wonderful to work with. They were friendly and helpful from the date of booking through check out. Beyond customer service, the rooms are great! Very clean, spacious and accommodating. We also enjoyed drinks and dinner at the hotel lounge and restaurant, Olives. Both the lounge and restaurant were great. Very friendly people, great service and excellent food and drink. This was my first stay at the W and I will definitely be going back. Already looking to book a room for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurBon
Reviews.Content: A coworker and I went to Manhattan on business. From the moment we walked in the front door we were treated like royalty. The lady at check-in was so amazed that I'd be staying for 6 nights, she signed me up for the Starwood Advantage program, which should eventually get me a free hotel stay or two. Whoever checked in my coworker didn't do this, however. The elevators are so ridiculously tiny, you'll find yourself violating strangers' personal space with regularity as you reach around their waist to press your room number. If you see two people already in the elevator, wait for the next one, especially if you have bags. Our rooms seemed large for New York, yet were furnished in dark, warm, colors, which made me feel calm and cozy. All of the touches were just right, from the W CD in the CD player to the sliding glass bathroom door. The temperature was just right and never needed to be adjusted once I set it to 69F. The curtains were fairly difficult to open and close, as they were about 12 feet tall and didn't have any way to open or close them other than yanking them back and forth. But I got good light in my room once they were open. My coworker complained of loud street noises in his room. But I didn't have any such problem, plus I wore earplugs. The TV in the room was really annoying because it took about 5-10 seconds between changing each channel for it to actually show the channel. Oh well. The room was clean and kept clean by the staff. The bathroom was clean and quite large. The water pressure was excellent and hot water immediate. The water pressure in the sink was so high that it would splash all over you if you turned it on full blast. We went to the Underbar through the "VIP" entrance in the basement. It was a nice spot, if you consider a $12 gin and tonic reasonable. I used the gym daily. It was spotless, well equipped, and had free water, magazines, and apples. The lobby of the hotel is lovely. The concierge recommended good restaurants to us. What more can I say but that this place was a joy to stay at?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: travelgal1111
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed one night at the W Hotel in one of their least expensive rooms (which, during the holidays, meant $349/night). We loved this hotel's location in Union Square and knew that we'd be getting good service and a nice, modern room when going with the W chain. In that sense, the hotel totally met our expectations. The Room (A-) Bed was truly "heavenly" as they like to call it. We requested the highest available floor and they put us directly below the Penthouse (nice that they were paying attention to my internet request). The view is pretty nice from up there. By NYC standards, this was an average to above-average sized room. Nice modern decor, clean, with a large flat-screen TV and DVD player. The bathroom door was a slider and you could hear everything from either side - that is probably the only con. Well, that and the price, which I thought was a little steep when you add $50 in taxes and parking charges, which I will get to... The Service (A+) They have a "Whatever, Whenever" motto and encourage you to request anything you might need. We took them up on this, as we had our wedding cake topper (1 year anniversary), but no plates or utensils to eat it with. We called down (and were greeted by name), and - no joke - in less than 2 minutes they were there with everything we needed. The concierge was very helpful during our stay as well. Added Fees (C-) They charge $60 a night for parking. This is valet service, but I asked if you bring your car to the garage yourself if it would be the same charge - it would. This is high for overnight parking, IMO, even for New York (where I have lived and parked overnight many times). As I mentioned earlier a $349 room is actually $400 with taxes. We did not order any, but I noticed that room service charges were a bit exorbitant and the one-hour massage costs $150 (I'm used to $100-120, again I am talking avg NYC prices). So... with great service and style comes higher prices. I guess that should be no big surprise, but just wanted to paint a complete picture for you. We really did enjoy our stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone (well, maybe not families - the hotel has much more of an adult vibe to it).

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: DebFL
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the W for 2 nights mid December for our birthday weekend. I have some positive as well as some negative comments to report. Lets start with the positives.... The hotel is beautiful and nicely appointed. We arrived a few hours early, were accomodated immediately and upgraded to a larger room. Very impressed! The room was huge, on the 19th floor, and nicely decorated. Our bathroom was large with a seperate shower/tub and BLISS products, which are great! The room was noisy, but its NYC! The location of the hotel is perfect! Many great restaurants close by, Rosa Mexicano (guacamole made at your table), City Bakery (great bfast/choc chip cookies), Maxi's (Kobe hot dogs/fried cookie dough dessert), excellent food! The union square market is nice, many vendors featuring food, gifts etc. Also walking distance to many shops including the SOHO area. Lombardi's is great for Pizza! The subway is very close and the taxi's are plentiful. Okay, here are the negatives...the staff seemed a bit too pretentious for us. Many of them seemed "bothered" performing their required duties. However, the doorman on sunday was excellent-very helpful- and housekeeping during our stay as well. For "several" hundred dollars a night, I definately expected a higher quality of service. On check-in, I realized the concierge had written down a quote for the room approx $100.00 more than I agreed to online. Although, he did apologize and correct it when brought to his attention. The living room bar was extremely crowded each night, we ended up leaving and going elsewhere for a drink. The "Underbar" club is very dull, dark and boring patrons, but a great DJ and bartenders. The day of check out I recieved my bill with a room service charge we did not use. I called the desk and was told accounting was closed and it would be a couple days before fixing my bill. Thankfully someone with more experience was able to credit my account that day. I find it interesting this seems to be an issue with many guests staying here. All in all, we had an amazing time! However, we will probably stay elsewhere next time we visit NYC. P.S. Allstate car service to and from the airport was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: gothamfoodie
Reviews.Content: My hsuband and I stayed at the W Union Square for 2 nights for a weekend in the city (we live in Bergen County, NJ) for a getaway from the kids. The hotel is very stylish with courteous staff. Our room was gigantic, and not by only Manhattan standards. It was huge by hotel standards. We got a king room up on the 14th floor. We origianlly booked a suite, but they all face the busy street, and the canyon effect in NYC is bad with the sirens and traffic all night. Too bad: the suites are gorgeous, but I like sleeping soundly better. The location is perfect for the weekend farmers market (its right on the square), and for access to the subway (walk 1 minute to the station). You can get anywhere from here and Union Square is a great neighborhood in and of itself. Absolute perfect location. Overall would recommend to others and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Idea of Cool”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: This was a one-night impromtu stay, my flight back to Paris having been cancelled at the last minute, I felt lucky to find a decent place to stay in busy NYC. Reservation over the phone went well, for a King room (whatever stupid name they may call it) on the top floor. When I actually turned up 10 minutes later, the top floor had changed into a 4 th floor. I traded it for a double room on the 14th (1407), upgraded or sa I was told. However, all-in-all check-in was efficient and prompt, despite a blaring music, that also blared in the elvators. Very quiet despite being right across the elevators, and right over Union Square. Tha main noise was actually the wind whistling through both window frames. This was my second stay in a W, previous being San Francisco. It is less cool than San Francisco. Rooms are ok, slightly worn : he heavenly bed is there, but it should be changed. Carpets look old. , and the bathrooms have clearly been re-used from the previous hotel in the buiding. Not even close to trendy. But they work, which is the least thet can do, with poor water pressure in the shower. I remembered great Aveda toiletries, and they are now Bliss, totally unattractive in style. Bar area was dark, music blaring again. Overnight laundry was good, and right on time, eventhough I had cheked in past the time. I tried to have breakfast downstairs at 9.30 am, but no seating was available, and I was requested to ask for 15 minutes, which I did not care of. I ordered from room service. I am not one to discuss prices, but they were extortionate : large orange juice, coffee, one single bagel and a side of smoked salmon set me back $50, which I found steep, evethough they were truly delicious. After checking the menu, I realised that the cream cheese had not made it to the room, and the salmon had been charged three times. I stated this at c/out, and they removed more than they should have at once. The bellman looked like he could not be bothered when I requested my 3 small pieces of luggage to be stroed for the day. Also the guys hopping taxis seemed to prefer discussing tips and enjoying themselves rather than opening the doors and actually hopping taxis. As often in NYC, the attitude issue stays with the lowest employees, and I am easy goiongand rather friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best W in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: WHopperNyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the last weekend of November. The location is great. It's right in the middle of Union Square (which is my favorite neighborhood in the city). I frequent the W's in NYC and I've stayed at W Tuscany, W New York (never stay at this on) and W Times Square in NYC and the W Union Square is head and shoulders above them all. It's not as trendy as the W Times Square and has a little bit of a Westin/St. Regis feel but it is very comfortable. I had a mega room on the 12th floor and really loved it. It was large, shiek and clean. Not extremely modern but more of a sophisticated decor. This hotel ranks as my favorite hotel in NYC. Great location, Extremely friendly staff and Sophisticated Decor.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - the W union square has really elevated their service!”
Reviews.Author: joel26
Reviews.Content: An absolutely great stay. The hotel, while no longer looking cutting edge n the decor department, is still spotless with very, very comfortable rooms. The highlight of the stay however was how much this W has elevated its service - even better than many recent stays at four seasons, ritz carlton, etc. The staff consistently went beyond the call of duty, meeting even unusual requests quickly and cheerfully. Dinner reservations requested through the concierge were efficiently carried out with typewritten confirmations and directions appearing under the room door minutes later. On our last night, we were amazingly surprised to have glasses of champagne appear at our table with our server smiling and saying "compliments of your hotel". I can't say how impressed I was and i will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: medicalalert
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel in Union Square is an Oasis in NYC! All of our expectations were exceeded during our brief, one night stay in NYC. The staff is attentive and courteous, the decor is muted, yet modern, and the overall experience was one of upscale relaxation. We booked a "mega-room", which is the hotel's midsize room. It was generous, with 15 foot ceilings, flat screen TV, DVD player ...etc Linens and bath ameneties were top shelf, and the room was surprisingly quiet despite being over Park Ave and across from the elevators. I requested some wine and cheese prior to our arrival, and it arrived immediately upon check-in, and was complimentary at that! I requested a red rose as well, and it was placed across the bed with a dozen others in a vase to continue the theme. The lobby bar and restaurant were very comfortable - made you want to settle-in and forget the rest of the city. The night spot (The Under Bar) was a little lound and young for a couple in their 40's, but we were very happy in the lobby bar. The hotel may seem pricey, but if you're going to New York you need to loosen the wallet and resign yourself to everything costing more. Money spent at the W is well worth the investment!

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky Charges on my Bill”
Reviews.Author: cb8
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many W hotels, I have always had non-smoking rooms. A week after my stay, I noticed a $150 charge on my bill so I called and inquired. They told me they smelled smoke so I must've been smoking in my room and I was charged for it. The hotel accountant told me "you must've been caught smoking", which wasn't the truth either. I'm not a smoker, never have been, and personally find it disgusting, but it's their word against mine now and they are getting $150 off me!!!! I'm furious about this and have disputed it with my credit card company. They can't make a quick buck off me like that, they already charge enough to stay there per night. Such a disappointment, check your bills after you checkout everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I've ever had, and I've had a lot”
Reviews.Author: lilajane20
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that I travel a lot and have probably stayed in about 400 hotel rooms in the last four years. My stay at the W Union Square was by far the best experience I ever had. I used my Starwood points to book two Spectacular Rooms for a trip to NYC with six other girlfriends for a weekend to celebrate my birthday and bachelorette party. I had never stayed at the hotel before, but chose it based on the great location and after looking through the reviews on TripAdvisor. Two days before my arrival I was contacted by Heather at the welcome desk to talk about which rooms were available. When she heard I had a special occasion, she upgraded one of the rooms to a king suite with a complementary rollaway bed so three people could fit in it. She was extremely helpful and friendly all around, and had George at the concierge desk get in touch to let me know there would be a gift in the room for my birthday and to see if I needed anything else. I jokingly responded that it would be great if he could have Brad Pitt waiting. Our party had seven women arriving at the hotel at different times from different places, and the front desk was great about making sure there were keys waiting for each girl in her name at the desk. No one had any problems getting in the rooms. And we laughed hysterically when we got in the suite. The staff had taken the time to cut pictures of Brad Pitt out of magazines and put them all over. There was one in a frame, some on the TVs, some on the mirrors. There were also two birthday cards -- one signed by several members of the hotel staff and another signed from "Brad." My fiance had also called the concierge desk to arrange a bouquet of flowers for me in the room, and it was there looking gorgeous. They also had left little bottles of flavored vodka on ice; a complementary gift package of Bliss body products and a W Hotel teddy bear as gifts for me. It was an amazing and very touching effort. The suite had a great view of Union Square, as did the Spectacular Room, which was much bigger and nicer than your typical NYC hotel room. The bedding is incredible. We ate at Olives the first night, and had the tasting menu. It was delicious and our waitress (forgot her name, but she was a very friendly blond woman) took great care of us. And the doorman was always smiling and quick with suggestions of where to go. I probably couldn't stay in this hotel if I wasn't using points since my employer would flip if I tried to expense that much for one night. (Usually I stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers when I'm in NYC on business travel.) But I would definitely come again and again if I can afford it. My stay was beyond perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Union Square perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: Union Square perfect! This is the best W in NYC. From the front door staff (Keith or Jose are brilliant!) and the front desk staff...it is easily the best place to stay when in Union Sq. The rooms are a little on the small and dark (brown) side, but the hotel has that BoHo funky edge to it that is what the W brand is all about. If you want corporate American hotels - go to Midtown. If you want faux Euro-luxury, go to the Four Seasons. W is a younger hip vibe, and although it is just as Starwood commercialised - it's perfect for that in-NY-for-a-day-or-two business trip.weekend and want the W experience. Don't eat at Olives unless you are prepared to be overcharged, and the lobby is just one big afterwork martini lounge for local workers...but, you can't beat the location, and the beds are so comfortable and bathrooms clean and well amenitied...so, you can't complain. Unless you look at the rates ($500 and upwards). Concierges are great, and hotel can arrange anything for you (Whatever, whenever...just makes you laugh that they call it that, doesnt it?) forget the Giraffe and stay away from the Gershwin if you want a close to Union Sq experience...and, the coffee shop around the block on Irving St is the best; Lucy has the best latin food, and the Coffee Shop for breakfast on the other side of Union Sq will keep me coming back!

Reviews.Title: “great location great service”
Reviews.Author: mhaskello
Reviews.Content: After leaving the giraffe(see review) we checked into W. Staff was so concerned about our anniversary. we were upgraded....champagne delivered with a card signed by staff as well as other wonderful suprises.Room was very clean and lovely. Flat screen TV. Great location. Fun bar and restaurant. The W's staff made our anniversary and i will always remember the great experience. I will stay here when in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Skipgolf
Reviews.Content: Location: Perfect for shopping. I brought my wife and she shopped while I worked. Much better than the Times Square area. Service: I mentioned to the person at check-in that we were celebrating my wife's birthday. My intention was to try to get an upgraded room (to no avail). They sent desserts to our room which was very thoughtful. Rooms: Nice but small....just like everywhere in NYC. We paid $675/nt which is a bit pricey. Make sure to eat at Spice Market in the Meatpacking District. Shop at Neccessary Clothes on Broadway (3 locations) for great bargains. Beer and good live music at Back Fence at Bleeker and Thompson near NYU.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely great hotel in great part of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: pineappleeurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Union Square on two occations during our 3 week vacation in the US and both stays were absolutely wonderful. The staff recognised us when we returned after 2 weeks travelling in the South. The rooms are large and well-equiped. Great Lounge and room service food. The Whatever/Whenever service is excellent. Location is superb away from the touristy parts of Mahattan in a more quiet and authentic part of this amasing city. Will return again, soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: kearneyhill
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife while we took in the city for a few days. Great Place and Great Location. Awesome beds and large bathroom. Olives restaurant rocks!!! Incredible location. Excellent for young professional looking to get away for the weekend or a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on company business - Thank God! Loved the location and thought the Olives restaurant was very good. But.... my room was $850 a night and breakfast was extra! It was a small suite but very tired-looking, dirty carpets, ancient TV. The only good point was that the bathroom was a decent size. The atmosphere was very dark and gloomy. The room service was appalling. In fact, I became ill after eating it and had to miss my morning appointment. I complained to the front desk staff and was surprised to see that the meal was still on my bill when I checked out. They also mishandled the booking and charged my personal credit card for the five night stay until the MD of the company arrived two days later. This is very much a nickel and dime place. Everyone who checked out when I was there disputed their bill. On my bill were three long distance calls I didn't make and a $53 charge for time at the business centre - again not mine. In all there was $200 in extra charges that were not mine. I come to New York three times a year and would never stay here again - especially for prices that would secure the best hotels in town such as The Peninsula and The Ritz-Carlton. Most of the staff are perfunctory and the concierge on duty when I was there left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KirkHarrod
Reviews.Content: We loved the W Union Square. Room was small but the bathroom was huge. The king sized bed was very comfortable with excellent linens and pillows. The room was very clean. The location is excellent as it is in a central spot for sightseeing in the Village, East Village, SOHO, Chinatown and Little Italy to the south and Midtown, Times Square to the north. There is a subway station 1 block away. We walked just about everywhere (we are big time walkers) from the hotel, including across the Brooklyn and Williamsburg Bridges on two different occasions (one night we walked back to the hotel from Peter Luger's Steakhouse across the Williamsburg Bridge in Brooklyn). The lobby is always rocking with club music and lots of people hanging out. The staff was very nice to us. We had a government rate of $196/night so I expected to be treated shabbily but that was not the case. Right next door is a great market with salad bar, sushi bar, fresh juice bar, bakery, etc. Next to the market is a CVS pharmacy to get anything that you forgot to bring.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service!”
Reviews.Content: We were helping our son set up his new apartment after his graduation and celebrating his new position, and we stayed at the W in Union Square. It was a welcomed respite after our very busy day! Everything was perfect , and we can't say enough, except thank you to the staff , for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Good but overpriced, even for NYC”
Reviews.Author: khw225
Reviews.Content: I had a “spectacular” room and it looked very nice overall. Fairly basic hotel-room layout: bed and nightstands, desk & chair, armchair and reading lamp, dresser with TV. Quite big by NYC standards. The bathroom was also very spacious and well laid out. All the usual amenities. The shower deserves a star all on its own. The water pressure (10th floor) was reminiscent of a jet engine. The same was true for the sink – be careful not to splatter yourself. The bath was clean overall, but the shower showed some moldy spots that really should have been taken care of! I don’t understand the ga-ga over the Bliss products. I tried them (soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion) and felt like my skin and hair were covered in wax for the rest of the day. Yuck. There’s a mini-bar, of course, but you don’t even want to know the prices… No coffeemaker, though, which was disappointing – I don’t really consider that such a big luxury. A big plus for the bed: soft – but not too soft – and a lovely satiny-covered down duvet. Lots of big pillows. Comfortable doesn’t even begin to describe it. Nights were not all restful, though: Even in a room toward the back, I got quite a bit of street noise during the night. I also had some trouble with the thermostat – I could adjust it to my heart’s content but the room temperature never changed at all. I definitely did not like the per-day internet costs. Even many cheaper hotels are now making wireless access freely available, and I don’t appreciate being nickeled and dimed, especially if I’m already paying nearly $500/night – and that was the corporate discount rate! Something annoying that the W shares with many other hotels: poor lighting in the room. I appreciate soft light as much as the next person, but sometimes you want it bright, perhaps to pack, but there were only various reading lamps, nothing overhead. Only in the bathroom was there bright white light, which is exactly where I would appreciate the option to have less. The lobby area is busy and the adjacent bar area is always full. This is definitely a trendy place and quite noisy at night. In the morning, you can eat breakfast at the hotel restaurant, but you’re probably better off at a nearby coffee shop. All in all, this hotel is good, but far from great. Given that, it’s totally overpriced, even for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: sstj
Reviews.Content: We always like to stay in a different neighborhood in NYC. Loved Union Square & the W was a perfect location. Conciege service was GREAT...gave us all the info we wanted. Service very good. W has lots of little trendy extras that make it fun. Bar & restaurant "OLIVES" good place to hang out. Skip breakfast...overpriced, but dinner was a real treat. SS - St.John, Virgin Islands

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive considering what you get”
Reviews.Author: hitsman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip, and don't think I would ever stay here if I was footing the bill. My room was over $500 a night, and just seemed like a standard hotel room. I've stayed at much nicer places for <$200/night. Granted, this is New York, but I still don't understand the value here. It just doesn't seem all that special to justify the rate. Pros: Room had a nice view, comfortable king size bed, nice desk, good pay movies, and friendly check-in. Cons: Price

Reviews.Title: “Too much street noise”
Reviews.Author: Jber40
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk was extremely gracious and upgraded us at check-in to a suite. It was well appointed and had nice views. A comfortable roll-away was sent to the room for my son. Unfortunately, both of us experienced a terrible night's sleep due to incredible noise. It sounded as if every window in the suite was open; none of them were. It was a corner room, facing Park Ave. and that may have contributed to the amount of noise - traffic, conversations, etc. It was by far the noisiest and worst hotel experience we've had in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the famous W atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Carr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Union Square for 3 nights in March 07. I have stayed at the W New York (Lexington Ave), W Times Square and the W in LA before and this was definitely the worst experience. Not much of a wow factor at all, the lobby area (seating area) is quite small, I found the bar staff a bit snobby and the usual fun W atmosphere was missing. My room was ok (was meant to be one of the better ones) but small. There was only 1 window in the room which made it dark but I do have to say that the bed was very comfy! The night club downstairs was ok but quite pricey. The Olives restaurant was quite nice and the food was good. I had breakfast there nearly every morning and it was always nice. The business centre is tiny and expensive. I couldn't get my lap top to connect and had to use the internet. It was something like $60 for an hour! I also tried the W's Whatever/Whenever service and it didn't work! I wanted to charge my Nokia cell phone and they didn't even have any spare chargers to borrow. Nokia charger should be a basic item at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location - no real problems”
Reviews.Author: bennyhill
Reviews.Content: Good hotel if you want to use it as a base to do all things New York, We have stayed in NY in the past the hotel Essex house overlooking central park, nice hotel by the way. W hotel, room ok nothing special, I thought the bed was very comfortable a heavenly bed I believe in fact with all the walking, shopping and drinking we did in NY we needed a bed that could satisfy our need to sleep and this certainly lived up to its name!! Fantastic location, central everywhere really. Having stayed in upper Manhattan in the past we found the W hotel location more suited to finding out how the real Manhattan works, so close to the village, Soho, Chinatown and little Italy it was a mere walk away, that isn’t to say that you cant take a stroll up Broadway to upper Manhattan as that to easy to do also, and a very interesting walk to (don’t forget credit card). We also made the walk across the Brooklyn bridge into Brooklyn Heights enjoyed the walk no so far as to cause a glum face. The hotel offered a great bar in Olives however it was somewhere that was obviously very popular with the office set in that it was extremely difficult to grab a table so book early, the offerings were superb we found the bar a great place to relax following a hard days tromping around the city. Also not too far from local bars and diners, we never ate in the hotel as we thought the prices especially that of room service were taking the Mick!! I have stayed at hotels throughout the world and this was expensive. I booked the hotel and used my Starwood points so really did not feel the pinch with regard the room charge however I believe it to be very expensive but given the time of the year (in between boxing day and staying over new years) you can expect a higher than normal rate. The rooms were clean, not spectacular the hallways were dimly lit which I suppose did its job when you consider how dirty and water stained the hallway carpets are, they really do need replacing. The business suite or room is located in the basement, not great facilities to be honest and the charge is overwhelming, I would not stay here if it were for business let’s just say that. The staff were very pleasant no complaints what so ever, they were very attentive and ALWAYS expected a tip however I guess that’s NY for you. Hey, my wife and I had a great time. If you are on a visit to see NY then you are not going to be spending lot of time in a hotel, it was comfortable and clean and as long as you see it as a base for all your NY excursions then you will enjoy your time.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar for a W”
Reviews.Author: chnyc
Reviews.Content: We ended up booking the W Union Square using our Starwood points. The reservation desk said that otherwise, the room would have cost $709. It was just a standard looking room, not a suite. The bed was not a heavenly bed (like at most Westins and now some Ws), which I was disappointed about. We requested a king sized bed, but we're pretty sure it was a queen. Cool lobby, but the room itself was nothing special, fairly basic. No spa on site, which again, we found disappointing. It was ok, but we've stayed at a few other Ws which were better. I would not recommend paying this much to stay here. The W New York (on Lexington Ave) is better if you want a W in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but pricey”
Reviews.Author: MaggieM94
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights at W Hotel-Union Square to attend a family wedding located on the property. Would stay again at the wedding/ group rate we received, but not at the regular rate!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tyma
Reviews.Content: Good location, large room, great bar downstairs. All the staff I spoke to were helpful and pleasant. For a business hotel with a bit more character or a nice hotel for a weekend (romantic or not) I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Allmy$$gotoNYU
Reviews.Content: This was the most enjoyable hotel stay I have experienced in a very long time! The staff was delightful, even playful. They couldn't have been nicer or more accomodating. After checking in, we stumbled into the bar/restaurant connected to the hotel, Olives. There we were surprised with one of the most enjoyable and delicious meals we have ever had! We stayed in one of the "Mega" rooms. It was very spacious and clean. The hotel shower is the best shower in NYC! Bliss Spa products are the bath products offered. Having stayed in a "boutique" hotel before, I wasn't sure I wanted to try one again. The W at Union Square shattered all of those myths for me. The W didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “It Would be Hard to Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York quite frequently for business and pleasure. Usually, I use points from another hotel point program and stay free. In February, W did a promotion where if you booked with AMEX, you'd get one night free at a W hotel, so I decided to try at W Union Square. I'd heard it was a hip and trendy place, which has it's pros and cons. The pro is, it's fun and people watching is great. The con is, as a 36 year old woman I might feel a little "old" and out of place. This was not the case. When I arrived, I was welcomed by the staff and taken to my room. A few weeks prior, I'd requested a sunny room and they complied with a giant, corner room with a view of the park. Because they knew I like "sunniness", they brought me a giant sunflower and some fruit and champagne about 5 minutes after check in. That right there would have won me over in terms of personal touches and friendliness, but throughout my stay, the entire staff did little things to show they were anticipating my needs -- they even went so far as to bring me a tray of comforting things on a day I was sick. As for the room itself, it was a good size for New York and had a great view of Union Square. Unlike many hotel rooms in the city, this room had a full bath (soaking tub) with Bliss Spa products -- definitely worth talking about. I don't think I've ever been as impressed with bath products. The water pressure was very good and the hot water never ended. There were no coffee pots, however, the hotel sent up a coffee maker for me to keep in my room, so if you are a coffee addict, keep this in mind! Just ask and you shall receive. At night, the lobby does become somewhat club-like. It's a stylish, loud, see and be scene place. That being said, it's kind of small and there's so much going on that if you do happen to be schlepping through in your sweats, no one really cares. It's smaller than it looks in the picture. The "living room", a place to congregate and have drinks, is very small and I felt a little uncomfortable going there alone....so I didn't. Underbar is a different story. I went with girlfriends and we had a fabulous time. The waitress was super nice (which was surprising, since others have said the opposite about Underbar staff) and the music was a good mix. It was dark, so I think I wouldn't have minded going in by myself for a drink, though I never got around to it! Olives, the restaurant in the hotel, is incredible. My friends and I were seated in a big, comfy booth and treated like royalty. The chef (Todd English), who owns about 20 restaurants, just happened to be there that night and sent us loads of free samples because he'd heard we were all cooks. You can't go wrong with the hotel restaurant, that's for sure. Still, you'll want to get around. The W is a minute or two walk from the Union Square station, so in minutes, you can get anywhere in NYC. There's plenty to do right in the area. Sephora and Barnes and Noble are right smack across the street and Filenes, DSW Shoe Warehouse and a Children's Place are also very, very close. You'll want to take a subway or cab ride for finer shopping, though. The concierge knows what stores have what and will help you out. Restaurants in the area include Veritas, Candela, Union Square Cafe, Tabla and many more I can't think of right now. There are plenty of nice hotels in NYC, but when you find one that's perfect, it's hard to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Soothing hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: theresama40
Reviews.Content: The positives: 1. Good sized rooms (especially for NYC) with calming decor and very comfortable beds. 2. Nice amenities. 3. A very soothing reception area, that's always quiet even when the adjoining lobby bar/restaurant area is hopping. 4. Friendly service. 5. Great location -- close to both multiple subway lines and terrific restaurants. Also not a bad location for getting a cab. 6. Elevators require a room key to operate. It's a great security feature that I can't believe more urban hotels haven't adopted. The negatives: 1. Can't really think of any, unless it's the prices, but I think the room rates are in line with the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $500 a night”
Reviews.Author: SFgirl777
Reviews.Content: Sitting here in the W at this moment, I am truly disappointed. For the hype and price-- and having had a much better experience a couple of years ago-- this place is a let-down. First, the check-in person acted as if she couldn't care less whether we were there or not. At Hilton's and Sheraton's, the check-in staff are almost overly-friendly-- perhaps the W folks at the desk think courtesy and a smile aren't cool. (I should add that the porters are extremely friendly and helpful.) Second, these days, charging for Internet connection is just plain nickel-and-diming. Here, including tax, it's $16 a day! Other little things: our room is comfortable, but, again, for the price, I expect a better television-- flat screens seem standard now at chains like Crowne Plaza, etc. This one is small and so far away from the beds, that the remote signal doesn't reach! Also, wall outlets with lamp and other electrical cords hanging every which way. And, there's graffiti scratched into the leather headboard of one of our beds! At first we thought it was some clever Basquiat-like art, but clearly, it's just plain scratchmarks from some previous guest. Finally, and it's just a small thing, but again a nickel-and-diming item, we ordered a large pot of tea from room service - $8. The large pot of hot water arrives with one tea bag, so we asked for one more bag, and they charged us another $8. PUH-LEEZE! For the price, you can find a hip hotel with much better customer service and sense of pride!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in New York but no restaurant service”
Reviews.Author: Peagreen98
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from 5 days in NYC over Christmas where I stayed at the W on Union. I had a lovely room on the top floor with great downtown views, a good sized bathroom and by NY standards a large room (we booked a mega room). We arrived Christmas day from the UK and were greeted by a really helpful doorman. The check in however seemed an inconvenience for the desk staff – my passport is in a different name to my credit cards (a trial too far for her) and was then informed that the restaurant was closed for the evening and only room service was available. Here we were in NYC without a booking for anywhere on Christmas day to be told only at this point that the hotel restaurant was closed – it was here that the door man got helpful with suggestions of places to go for a drink or a “bite to eat”. I would have appreciated this information at booking or before arriving as I would have made plans. So room service it was and not really the choice I wanted on a romantic get away with my husband for Christmas. The hotel room was great but the service in both bars was hit and miss. This was particularly apparent on the weekend when it was more like a bar with rooms and preference seemed to be given to non hotel residents – that’s not say it was a bad as the Hudson Hotel though, just that the staff had a tendency to be rude and unhelpful. We did complain to the lovely Australian night manager who was sympathetic although ultimately didn’t do anything. I did however like the atmosphere of the “Underbar” (which was open on Christmas Day and everyone in there was in great spirits). The highlight of the hotel experience though, was the really great room service guy who brought our breakfast every morning with his view on the weather and how thick a coat to wear – he was a tonic to the start of everyday. Apart from the bar experience this is a lovely hotel – its convenient, has great rooms and some of the staff are delightful. For a NYC hotel experience not too shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: traveler213
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Union Square for one night during an extended vacation in New York City. This hotel is in a great location for those who are familiar with the city (especially the subway lines) as it is convenient to the Union Square subway station, but not much else. While Union Square is a nice part of town, those who are interested in doing those touristy things like visiting the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park and the other sites of midtown may find it a bit out of the way. The rooms are huge (by New York standards anyway) and very well equipped as can be expected at W hotels. The check-in staff was friendly enough but the girl who checked me in was not remotely interested in going above and beyond the call of duty in any way. Her attitude wasn't negative, but definitely more expected from an economy brand hotel than an upscale hotel like the W. Overall, great stay. The beds are fantastic and they provided a roll-a-way bed free of charge as a one-time courtesy. I'm not sure how much they charge other guests for this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: s0s
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a comfortable, enjoyable two nights on a business trip. The hotel is in an interesting building (by US standards) and has a fabulous lobby/bar/restaurant area...but this is by no means the only reasoon to recommend it. I was given a lovely room on the 14th floor. In tune with the style of the building it had high ceilings and two huge floor to ceiling windows capturing rainy New York outside. The room was not newly decorated, but very well kept nonetheless. The staff were both efficient and friendly. I called for room service, laundry and had one minor problem with the heating. In every case the service was quick and the staff were helpful. In my opinion the W really understand the basic principles of hotel service and they make it a pleasure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: mammohead
Reviews.Content: stayed there after i proposed to my girlfirend. my room was immediately upgraded from a 'wonderful' room to a corner 'mega' room. the staff was very nice and courteous. lobby and lobby/lounge area was very crowded and loud in the early evening, but had no problem finding space for family and friends to celebrate. as per previous reviews, the halls are a little dark. one convenient plus is backdoor keycard access with your room key to the ajoining bar. would stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “p is for pricey, w is for wow”
Reviews.Author: grathy
Reviews.Content: w puts the p in pricey, but if money is no object, this groovy place offers a great stay-but where's the free coffee in the a.m?-coffee is available in the lobby in the afternoon, but for us early risers, we have to hit the streets for our java fix- i like the workout gym with its individual lcd monitors and headphones-also bedding in the rooms is divine...
